quotes.quote: A (true) believer does not taunt, damn, slander and abuse people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A (true) believer is bereft of two attributes: telling lie and stinginess.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A (true) believer should have the following eight characteristics: soberness at hard times, patience in calamities, gratefulness in reliefs, contentment for whatever the Great and Glorified God has given, avoidance from oppressing enemies and hurting friends, and toleration of physical sufferings to make people feel safe from him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A (true) Muslim is the one from whose tongue and hand, Muslims at rest stand.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer does his best in what his ability demands, but craves for what beyond his power stands.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer does not resort to jealousy or flattery, save in seeking knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer has all kinds of natures save treachery and telling lie.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer has four enemies: a jealous believer, a detesting hypocrite, a deviating Satan, and a hostile infidel.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is a servant of God who doesn’t oppress his enemies nor does he commit sins for the sake of his friends, who keeps trusts intact and refrains from jealousy, sarcasm and cursing others, who tells the truth though not called to bear witness and calls not people with bad names, who observes humility in prayers, hastes in paying his due alms, keeps patient in calamities and thanks (God) in affluence, who is content with what he has and claims not what he doesn’t, who doesn’t stop doing good deeds due to misery, who keeps company with people to learn and talks to them something to earn, and who forebears oppression and tyranny, awaiting the Merciful God to give him victory.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is in a good state all the time; even when he is on the verge of death, he praises God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is like unto a bar of gold, getting reddened when breathed upon and losing nothing when weighed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is like unto a date palm; whatever you take from it will be to your benefit.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is like unto a perfumer who will benefit you, should you keep company with him, or move along with him, or be a partner to him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is like unto a sieve, receiving nothing but clean and passing nothing but pure.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is like unto a stalk bending to all sides by winds but staying calm and static when winds vanish. Blights make a believer bend in same manner. The wicked (on the contrary) is like unto a spruce- fir standing firm and straight till the Exalted God destroys it should He wish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is like unto a stalk shaken by wind, standing and collapsing alternatively, and an unbeliever is like unto a pine standing all the time against the wind to be finally uprooted.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is like unto an apparently ruined house, being neat and beautiful inside, and a wicked person is like unto a domed elevated tomb making visitors excited but being inwardly filled with infection.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is more favorite to God than some of His angels.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is more worried about the affairs of this and the next worlds than others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is noble and generous, and an evildoer is ignoble and deceitful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is satisfied with little.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is shrewd, careful and cautious.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is so lenient and gentle that one might call him stupid.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is the brother of another believer and never connives at wishing him good.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is the one whom people consider honest as to their lives, wealth and blood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is the source of benefit. He will avail you, should you keep his company, counsel with him and become his partner. He is the cause of benefit in all affairs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer is zealous, but God is more zealous than him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer makes friends (with people), and there is no good in the one who does not make friends and is not subject of friendship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer must not feel satiated, with his neighbor being hungry.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer to (his) faith is like unto a horse to its stable around which it moves about (for a while) and then returns to it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer to a believer is like unto a building a part of which fortifies another.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer to a believer is like unto a firm building, parts of which fortifying one another.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer to other believers is like head to the body, suffering from their pains just as head suffers from the pains of the body.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer who associates with people and patiently tolerates their harms is better than the believer who does not do so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer will not be bitten twice from the same hole.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer will not kill anybody in ambush warfare.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer will reside under the shade of his alms in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer won't be exposed to any suffering, hardship, disease, harm and sorrow, unless God ignores some of his sins (in lieu of them).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer’s departure from this (secular)world is like unto an infant’s deliverance from his mother’s womb, leaving darkness and distress towards the world’s ease and expansion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer’s dignity lies in standing up to prayer at nights, and his greatness lies in needlessness from people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer’s dream is a servant’s talk to his Lord in sleep.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer’s dream is one among the forty- six units of prophethood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer's dream is one among the forty units comprising prophethood. It is tied to the leg of a bird as long as not revealed, but it will fall down if the reverse occurs. Thus, reveal not your dreams to anybody save the wise or intimate friends.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer’s intention is better than his deed, while a hypocrite’s deed is better than his intention, and everybody acts upon his own intention. When a believer does an action, a (sort of) light passes through his heart.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer’s intention is more significant than his deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer’s promise is a binding commitment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer’s promise is a debt, and a binding commitment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer’s promise is a must (he shouldn’t miss).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A believer’s sickness is the atonement of his sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A boaster has three traits: flattering in (people's) presence, backbiting in (people') absence, and clapping in people's calamities.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A bondservant should be fed and dressed properly and be not burdened with intolerable tasks.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A child is the fruit of one’s heart, and thereby the source of fear, miserliness and grief.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A counselor is people's trust. He is allowed to give a counsel or keep silent, but if he gives a counsel, it should be such that he himself would follow, were he to take a counsel.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A counselor is people’s trust. He is allowed to give a counsel or keep silent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A covert prayer equals seventy overt ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A coward trader a loser remains, but a courageous one gains.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A creditor will be in chains in his grave, and nothing can make him free but paying his debts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A curb of fire will be put on the mouth of whoever conceals his knowledge when asked to offer it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A day will come to pass when people would belie the truthful and approve of the liars and would regard the honest treacherous and the treacherous honest, when men will bear witness without being required and will swear without being asked to, and when the most fortunate people would be ignoble, sons of the ignoble, who would be bereft of the belief in God and His prophet.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A Derham earned in usury is worse for a man in the sight of God than committing adultery thirty six times.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A fast person will be worshipping God from early morning till night, if he does not backbite people, but his fast will be ruined as soon as he begins to do so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A fast person's praying will surely be granted.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A fast person's silence is praising God, his sleep is an act of worship, his praying is granted, and his deeds are (rewarded) twice.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A fast person's sleep is an act of worship, his silence is praising God, his deeds are (rewarded) twice, his prayers are granted, and his sins are forgiven.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A father’s praying for his child is like unto a prophet’s for his nation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A fertile woman is more favorite to the Exalted God than a (barren) beautiful one. Verily, I will pride myself on the multitude of my nation in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A generous man's food is cure, and a miser’s is disease for sure.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A giving hand is better than a receiving hand, and start charity at home.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A good companion is like unto a perfume- seller who might spare you any perfume, but the pleasant fragrance of his perfumes you (can surely) smell, and a bad companion is like unto a blacksmith whose flame of fire you might be able to escape but you surely suffer the bad smell of his working place.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A good deed is recorded for whoever removes a stone from people’s path.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A group of my people will always stick to truth for God’s decree to be issued.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A group of the people of Paradise will get worried about some of the people of Hell, and will (therefore) inquire: “Why are you in Hell? By God, we did not enter Paradise save through what we learned from you”. The Hell- bound reply: “We did not practice what we preached.”
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A group of you will always resort to begging till they (finally) meet God, with no flesh in their faces.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A guest carrys his own sustenance, removes the host's sins and causes them to vanish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A guest is a guest for three days; the more he stays, will he be under charity (to the poor); and thus, a guest should leave his host’s home after three days.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A guide to goodness is like unto its doer, and God loves `helping the poor’.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A heart with no sign of wisdom is like unto a ruined house. So, learn and teach, meditate deeply, and try not to die in ignorance, for God will not pardon (people for ignorance).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A house wherein children (we) miss, is bereft of bliss.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A house wherein they recite the Quran is as (bright) to the dwellers of the heavens as are the stars to the dwellers of the earth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A hypocrite is devoid of two traits: reputation and deep knowledge of religion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A hypocrite is known by three characteristics: he tells lie, breaks his (her) promise and commits treachery in trusts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A hypocrite is like unto a goat, wandering between two flocks (of sheep).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A hypocrite is the one who humiliates the learned, just leaders and those who have grown old in their struggles for the cause of Islam.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A hypocrite rules over his own eyes, shedding tears as he wishes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A journey for the sake of God is superior to making fifty pilgrimages to Mecca.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A just and humble leader is God's shade and blade on the earth, for whom the rewards of seventy sincere ones will be saved.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A just and most magnanimous man who must be observed in brotherhood and must not be backbitten, is the one who treats people with justice, speaks to them in truth and does not break his promises.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A just leader is God's shade on the earth, to whom resort the weak, and whose assistance the oppressed seek.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A just leader is God's shade on the earth. Whoever keeps him in honor will be kept in honor by God, and whoever disrespects him will be disrespected by Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A just leader is God's shade on the earth; and so, when one of you arrives at a place wherein there is no such leader, he should avoid staying there.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A learned man’s sleep is better than the prayer of a devout.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A little bit of action accompanied by knowledge is useful, and a lot of deeds followed by ignorance is of no use.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A little chance is better than much intellect. Intellect is the cause of loss in worldly and that of pleasure in otherworldly affairs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A little child’s memory is like unto a picture carved on stone, and an adult’s is like unto something written on water.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A Little knowledge is better than praying much. Worshipping God suffices to show one’s knowledge and selfish judgment is enough to show his ignorance. People are two groups: the faithful and the ignorant. Do not annoy the former and do not be a company to the latter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A little sufficient thing is better than a lot making one negligent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A little, but sufficient, is better than much leading to vanity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A man gains more value when the world is less worthy in his view.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A man of ancient times wore a fine garment and walked out proudly. God commanded the earth to take him, and he will thus be suspended in it till the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A man of the past was called to account (after death). He had no good deeds in his record to present, but an order to his agents to connive at the debts of the helpless, for he had been a rich tradesman (in the world). Thus, said the Great and Powerful God to His angels, “we have more rights for connivance than him. Ignore (his sins).”
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A man set out on a journey to pay a visit to his brother (in faith). God sent an angel to him on the way, asking, “Where are you going?” The man replied, “to see my brother somewhere”. The angel asked: “Is there any blessing you wish to expand for him?” “No, I only love him for God’s sake”. The man answered. The angel said: “I’m God’s messenger to you. God loves you as you love him”.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A man who colors his hair black should let the woman whose hand he seeks in marriage know about that.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A man who has two wives and treats them not in a just manner, will arrive at the Resurrection in half (of his body).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A man who loses his power of sight but keeps patient and is satisfied with the divine will, will surely be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A man’s son is among his earnings, the best of his earnings. So, eat from your sons’ wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A man's prayer said willingly, out of people's sight, is twenty five times as much the prayer he says in people's presence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A master is not allowed to do the following to his bondservant: making him haste in setting prayers, stopping him in eating, and leaving him satiated.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A miser has the least peace of mind.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A miser is he to whom they remember me, but hesitates to greet me.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A moment of delay on the part of rich (to help the poor) is cruelty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A Muslim has five duties towards another Muslim: greeting him, accepting his call, paying him a visit in sickness, participating in his funeral procession, and wishing for him what he wishes for himself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A Muslim is not allowed to terrify another Muslim.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A Muslim is rightful to see and act upon what he likes or dislikes as long as heis not required to commit sins; if so, he no more allowed to.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A Muslim is the brother of another Muslim; and so, he should not oppress him, nor should he surrender him (to enemies).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A Muslim should observe the following six in respect to his Muslim brother: greeting him in meeting, accepting his invitation, providing him with advice when he asks one’s counsel, wishing him good health when he sneezes, paying him a visit when he is sick, and attending his funeral procession when he dies.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A Muslim's charity prolongs his life, prevents him from bad deaths, and causes the Exalted God to save him from overweening and vanity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A neighbor has (specific) rights.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A Neighbor has priority (to others) in buying his neighbor’s house. Being absent, he should be awaited for, if moving in the same line as the seller.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A neighbor’s respect is as significant to his neighbor as his blood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A pious woman among other women is like unto a raven marked with a white leg.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A poor at the door of the pious is God’s gift for him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A promise is a debt. Woe is him who breaks his promise! Woe is him who breaks his promise! Woe is him who breaks his promise!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A prophet went out with his people to pray to God for rain. He saw an ant raising its leg to the sky, and so he said to the people: “Return to your homes for, God accepted your prayers for the sake of this ant”.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A prostitute was passing by a well where she saw a dog at the point of death from thirst. She tied her skirt to her shoe, fetched water from the well and quenched the dog’s thirst, and was thus forgiven (by God.)
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A quack vender is just as a usurer accursed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A rich man’s request (to people) will be a badge of shame on his face in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A rich man’s request (to people) will lead him to Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A scholar who avails himself of his own knowledge is superior to a thousand simple worshipers (of God).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A scholar who does not act upon his knowledge is like unto a niche providing people with light but burning itself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A scholar who teaches good to people but forgets himself is like unto a candle illuminating people but burning itself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A seeker of knowledge among the ignorant is like unto a living creature among the dead.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A small family is one way to comfort.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A sparrow killed in vain will come to stand before God’s Throne in the Day of Judgment, shouting “O Lord! Ask this man (the killer) why he killed me for no gain?”
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A strong believer is like unto a palm tree, and a weak one resembles a stalk.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A supposedly postponed affair should not make you do it hurriedly, for the Great and the most Powerful God will not haste for man’s hurry.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A thankful heart, a mindful tongue, and a virtuous wife who helps man in worldly and otherworldly affairs, are better than whatever people might treasure.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A time will come to pass when man has to choose between helplessness and debauchery. Those living at that time should prefer the former on the latter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A tree branch had blocked people’s way and hurt them. Somebody pulled it aside and was thus allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A truthful, trustworthy trader will keep company with martyrs in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A truthful, trustworthy trader will keep company with the prophets, the truthful and martyrs (in the Day of Judgement).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A wine drinker is like unto an idol worshipper.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A woman has two veils: the marriage bond and the grave.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A woman is like unto a (tender) rib. If you intend to straighten it, it will break, and if you intend to avail yourself of it, it will offer you the chance, though bent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A woman is not allowed to give in charity anything of her husband’s wealth without his permission.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A woman was doomed to Hell, for she had kept a cat in bonds without food to die from hunger.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A woman who shows her beauty to the public is like unto the dark of the Day of Judgment, with no light.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A woman's private prayer is twenty five times as much the prayer she says in the presence of men.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: A young man who honors an oldster because of his old age, will be honored in old age by someone appointed by God to do so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Abandon hues and cries, myriad (unnecessary) questions and destruction of wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Abandonment of prayer connects a servant of God to disbelief.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Ablution before eating makes poverty perish, and after eating removes obsession and strengthens eyesight.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Ablution is half of faith, and tooth brushing is half of ablution.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Abominables lie on the way to Paradise, and passions pave the way to Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Abstain from the (material) world, and beloved to God you will turn out to be, and connive at people’s possessions and they’ll come to love thee.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Abstinence is the best feature of your faith (religion).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Abstinence refreshes one's body and soul, and worldliness makes them suffer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Abstinence refreshes one's body and soul, worldliness increases one's Sorrows, and debauchery hardens one's heart.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Abundant speech brings forth no eloquence; eloquence is meditation on what God and his Holy Prophet love. Neither is stammering a defect of tongue; stammering comes from deficient knowledge of Truth (God).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Accept the first offer in transactions, for profit follows leniency.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Accept truth from anybody (being him a child or and old man), even if he is an enemy or a stranger, and do not accept falsehood from anybody (being him a child or an old man), even if he is a friend or a companion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Accomplishing a good deed is better than beginning it, (indeed).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Acquire knowledge and through it, peace (of mind) and soberness gain, and to your teacher humble remain.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Act upon marriage as a tradition, for I feel proud of your great population.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Actions depend on (are rewarded according to) intentions.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Adulterous are the women who marry in the absence of witnesses.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Adultery entails poverty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Advise each other in the acquisition of knowledge and do not spare your knowledge from one another, for treachery in this respect is worse than treachery to wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: After me, my people will fall to seditions as dark as nights, when man will be a believer in the morning and an unbeliever at night, when some people will barter their faith for unworthy wealth of the world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: After my death, nothing will be more harmful than women for men.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All affairs, being good or evil, belong to God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All attributes are desirable for a believer, save treachery and telling lie.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All eyes are adulterous, and an adulterous woman is she who odors herself and passes by a people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All forms of loaning are (considered charity.)
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All forms of lying are recorded in man’s book of deeds, save the following: Telling lie in war for war is deceit, telling women a lie to please them, and telling two persons a lie to make them come to terms.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All good deeds make one half of worshipping (God) and praying makes the other half, and when the Exalted God wishes good for someone He will make his heart inclined towards praying.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All holders of knowledge hunger for new knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All holders of wealth are more entitled (than others) to use it as they wish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All kinds of knowledge will entail evil results in the Day of Judgement, save that which is put to practice.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All my people will enjoy (God's) forgiveness, save the pretentious- those who (for instance) commit debauchery at night, which the Exalted God conceals from people, but reveal it themselves at daytime despite God’s concealment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All of you are observers of and responsible for your subjects’ rights.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All people are (members of) God’s household, but the dearest to Him are the most beneficial for their own family.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All sons of Adam are jealous, and a person’s jealousy will not be harmful unless (s (he expresses it or puts it into action.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All sons of Adam are kings- men ruling over their families and women over their houses.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All sons of Adam are wrong doers, and the best among them are the penitent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All sorts of lying are sins, save the one benefiting people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: All vices are confined in a house, the key to which being drinking wine.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Alms mixed with one’s property will surely make it ruin.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Alms-giving is a bridge to Islam.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Among all believers, the best Muslim is the one from whose hand and tongue other Muslims feel at rest, and the most faithful one is the most good- tempered.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Among man’s good prayers is to have a good opinion of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Among people, the best is one who brings them utmost gain (and rest).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Among the best of all deeds is to gladden a believer by paying his debt, meeting his need and putting an end to his suffering.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Among the great aspects of good- manneredness are the following three: forgiving those who treat you unjustly, joining those who cut relations with you, and tolerating those who insist in their ignorance against you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Among the prophets’ patterns of life are chastity, forbearance, brushing one’s teeth and using perfume.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Among the worst people is the one who barters his spiritual world for people’s material world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Among your brethren the best, your faults to you manifest.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Amuse yourselves with plays and recreations, for I dislike watching violence in your religion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An angel will pray the same for whoever prays for his brother in his absence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An elder brother has the same right on his younger brothers as a father’s on his children.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An emigrant to God is the one who avoids what He has forbidden.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An evildoer who has hope in the Exalted God's Mercy is closer to Him than a disappointed pious.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An honest man should not be accustomed to cursing people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An honest merchant will not suffer poverty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An hour of seeking knowledge is better than praying one whole night, and a day of seeking knowledge is better than fasting three months.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An hour of standing in the line of holy war (jihad) for the cause of God is better than sixty years of worshiping.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An hour of thinking is better than sixty years of praying.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An ignorant man oppresses his companions, is cruel to his subjects, shows vanity against great men and speaks foolishly.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An ignorant worshipper is like unto a millstone ass.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An illegitimate child is worse than his parents, should he commit adultery.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An oath depends on the intention of the oath- taker.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An old man can feel young for loving two things: long life and abundant wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An old man to his family is like unto a prophet to his people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An old man's heart is young for two things: love of life and love of wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: An ugly fertile woman is better than a beautiful barren one, for I take pride in your greater population in respect to other nations.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: And what disease is worse than miserliness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Angels only make their presence in your wrestling and horse–riding games.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Angels spread out their wings for the seekers of knowledge, for they are pleased with what they seek.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Angels spread out their wings in satisfaction for whoever leaves his home in search of knowledge, until he returns.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Anger belongs to Satan, Satan was created from fire, and fire can be put out by water. Thus, when one of you gets angry, (s (he should immerse in water.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Another preferable way is there besides going to extremes, i.e. being moderate in one’s deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Answering letters is as much a must as greeting someone back.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Any compromise is permissible among Muslims, save one by which the lawful is made unlawful and vice versa.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Any group of people among whom usury and bribery prevail will be respectively afflicted with famine and fear.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Apart from sincerity (in faith), you are not endowed with anything like safety. So, ask God for it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Appointed to a job, be kind to and forgive your subordinates.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Appreciate God’s blessings given to you, and let them not vanish, for a lost blessing will hardly be regained.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Aren’t you (women) pleased that when one of you becomes pregnant of her husband and he is satisfied with her, she will be rewarded the reward of the one who keeps fast while struggling in the way of God, and when she gives birth to a child, she will be offered a reward for each drop of milk she produces and for each time her breast is sucked, and if she keeps awake one night to look after her child, she will be given the reward of releasing seventy slaves for God’s sake?
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: As long as a man truly guides those who consult him he continues to enjoy correctness of opinion, but as soon as he starts deceiving them, the Exalted God will deprive him of this blessing.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Ask for generosity from the Merciful among my people, not from the hardhearted, and live under the protection of the former.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Ask God (to give you) of His bounties, for he likes asking Him. The best act of worship is looking forward to deliverance (in hard times).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Ask God (to give you) useful knowledge, and take refuge with Him from useless knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Ask God for everything, even a shoelace; for should He not wish success, to nothing will you have access.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Ask God for good health and cure of all illness here and in the Hereafter; for if you are granted these in this world and in the next, you will be prosperous.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Ask God for good health and forgiveness; for apart from certainty, no one has been bestowed anything better than prosperity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Ask guidance from the wise to find the straight path, and do not disobey them; otherwise, you will become remorseful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Ask your heart for what’s false or true, and let others say whatever they want to.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Asking forgiveness (from God) rubs off sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Asking properly is one half of knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Assign people their due status (value) of good and evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Assist your brother (in faith), being him an oppressor or oppressed; if the former, keep him away from oppression and if the latter, lend him a hand.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Assist your children in doing good, for everybody can save his children from being cursed if he so wishes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Assure me of six things, and I will ensure you of entering Paradise: avoidance of telling lie, avoidance of breaking your promise, keeping away from treachery to trusts, closing your eyes on the unlawful, controlling your hands and restraining your privy parts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Attending the Friday ritual prayer is obligatory for all mature people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Attending the weak is paying attention to me, for your sustenance and its support (by God) is for the sake of them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Avail yourself of five things before five other things: youth before oldness, health before illness, wealth before need, convenience before inconvenience and life before death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Avail yourself of what God has made available for you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Avoid doing evil to people, for it is charity you give for yourself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Avoid drinking wine, for it is verily the key to all evils.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Avoid using (even one piece of) unlawfully- earned stone in (your) building, for the very stone causes its collapse.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Avoidance of bidding to good results in disgrace here and Fire in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Awaiting betterment (in life), is servitude to God if coupled with patience.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Awaiting prayers by God’s servants is (in fact) saying prayers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Backbiting is to mention your brother’s name in connection with what he hates.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Backbiting the wicked is permissible.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Bad - temperedness is ill- omened, obedience to women is regrettable, and good- naturedness is growth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Bad- temperedness is ill- omened, and the worst of you is the most ill- tempered one.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Bad- temperedness spoils one's deeds just as vinegar acetifies honey.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be a company to the Quran and make it your leader and guide, for it’s the word of the Lord of the worlds. It belongs to Him and to Him will it return. Believe in its allegorical verses and take lessons from its parables.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be a follower to the Book of God forever.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be afraid of the oppressor’s curse, for it mounts on clouds (i.e. ascends to the heavens), and God, the Exalted, says: I swear by My Honor and Glory to help you though it may take time.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be afraid of the oppressor's curse, though an infidel he might be, for it is immediately answered by the Great, Powerful God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be an early bird in seeking knowledge, for early- rising brings you blessing and prosperity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be an scholar or a student, a listener or a lover of lore, and be not the fifth (of these four), for you’ll perish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be careful about a believer’s wit, for he looks (at things) through the light of God, the Most High!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be clean to the extent possible, for the Exalted God has founded Islam on cleanliness, and nobody enters Paradise save the clean.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be duly modest towards God, for he who does so, should control his head and mind as well as his belly and privy parts (against the unlawful), and remember (his) death and trial. Whoever seeks the eternal life should abandon the luxurious beauties of worldly life and thereby, he will be the one duly modest towards God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be early rising, for in it there is blessing.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be easy- going and do not be hard (on people).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be economical in speaking, for the word which settles your need suffices you (indeed).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be generous (to people) and put them not in straits, for you will be put in straits (in the Hereafter).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be truthful, for truthfulness is surely a path to Paradise, and avoid lying for it’s verily a way to Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be good and refrain from evil. Behave in such a way that in your absence, people talk of you as you wished, and abstain from what you do not like people to attribute to you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be good- tempered and keep silent as long as possible, for by the One in whose hands lays my life, there is no beauty as these among people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be good- tempered, for the most good- tempered are the best in religion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be good to the one who is good to you; and if you cannot do so, pray for him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be honest to those who consider you trustworthy, and be not a traitor to those who have been disloyal to you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be honest, for it’s akin to goodness and both reside in Paradise. Avoid telling lie, for it’s akin to badness and both dwell in Hell. Ask God for certainty and good health, for aside from certainty, nothing better than good health has been given to anybody. Avoid jealousy and hostility, and do not break your relations with people. Be brothers, O servants of God, to one another as God has ordered you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be hopeful about your brother (in faith), if in him you observe three virtues: chastity, trustfulness and truthfulness; and be hopeless about him, if he is bereft of them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be hopeless of what people possess.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be humble and keep company with the poor to be glorified before God and saved from vanity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be humble to the one who is kind to you, though being an Ethiopian slave, and avenge the one who does evil to you, though being a freeman of the Quraish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be humble to your teachers as well as to your students, and be not despotic scholars.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be humble, for humility lies in one’s heart, and a Muslim should not annoy other Muslims.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be just in issuing judjement and speak well when uttering words, for God is good and loves good- doers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be kind to be praised and rewarded.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be kind to the one who shows kindness in friendship with you, for this type of kindness lasts longer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be kind to the poor; for theirs is a (high)status in the last Day, for sure.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be kind to your parents and thus, your children will be kind to you, and practice chastity so that your wives keep chaste.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be lenient to people, and they will be lenient to you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be moderate and avoid harshness and abuse.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be moderate in friendship, lest your friend should turn out to a foe in future, and do the same in enmity, lest your foe should turn out to a friend in like manner.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be moderate in seeking the (material) world, for everybody gains his (destined) share.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be modest (bashful) against God as you are against two of your righteous relatives.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be needless of people even for is a toothbrush.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be patient in doing what you want to, and God will show you how to do it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be pious in hardship and ease.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be pious to be the greatest of all worshippers, be contented to be the most thankful of all, wish for people what you wish for yourself to be a (true) believer, be a good company to your neighbors to be safe and laugh less, for laughing in excess will make your heart perish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be properly modest to the Exalted God, for He has distributed among you your morals in the same way as your sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be steadfast and improve your behavior towards people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be steadfast, and how nice is your steadfastness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Be truthful, for truthfulness will surely lead you to kindness which will (in turn) lead you to Paradise, and man constantly tells and seeks the truth till he is (finally) considered truthful before God, and avoid telling lie, for it will surely lead you to wickedness which will (in turn) lead you to Hell, and man constantly tells lie and seeks falsehood till he is (finally) considered a (great) liar in the sight of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Beautiful hair and visage, (material) properties, and good language are among man’s wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Beautify your dresses and improve your tools to shine as a star among people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Beauty is to speak well based on truth, and perfection is to act well based on honesty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Begin (your affairs) with what God has begun with.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Begin your day with charity, for it surely stops calamity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Being a bad company means stinginess, insult and bad- temperedness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Being a means for God to lead a man weighs over everything on which rises and falls the Sun.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Being chaste leads to chastity in your wives, and being kind to your parent leads to your children’s kindness to you. Whoever does not accept his Muslim brother’s apology will not be allowed to meet me at the Pond (in Paradise).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Being chaste towards people’s wives keeps your wives’ chastity intact, and being kind to your parent leads to your children’s kindness to you. Accept your Muslim brothers’ apology, being it sincere or not, for whoever avoids doing so, will not be allowed to meet me at the Pond (in Paradise).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Being famous suffices to make of man a sinner, for good fame makes him slip unless the Exalted God showers His Mercy on him, and bad fame brings him evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Being hurt in earning an honest penny is superior to God than swording a whole year.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Being in hardship and waiting for comfort is better to me than being in comfort followed by hardship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Being like one’s father is indicative of man’s fortune.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Being notorious suffices (to show) one’s evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Being serious or funning about three affairs do not reduce their serious nature: marriage, divorce, and returning to marriage (after) divorce.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Belief and deed are interrelated- none is good and perfect without the other.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Believers are from the point of kindness, friendship and compassion like unto the organs of one single body, which at rest cannot remain when one of them suffers pain.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Believers are lenient and gentle, just like camels, which move if pulled ahead and lie down on a piece of stone if made to do so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Believers are like unto body organs in their friendship and kindness. When one suffers pain, others uneasy remain.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Believers are mirrors for and brothers of one another, covertly guarding each other.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Believers will not be satiated with hearing the good till they join Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Believing in predestination makes griefs and sorrows fade away.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Beneficence will vanish from the sight of people, but not from the sight of God and the beneficent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Benevolence is not allowed, save to believers and the nobles.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Bereft of misery is the one who pays the poor due, invites guests to his house and is generous at times of hardship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Bereft of wisdom is the one who has to be a company to others, but does not treat them kindly to find relief from God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Beware of being inquisitive about matters religious, for the Exalted God has set up an easy- going religion (for you). So, derive from it what you can carry out, for God loves good deeds which are the most durable, though in quantity little.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Beware of jealousy, for it devours good deeds as fire puts out firewood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Beware of slackness and ambitious desires, for they result in the ruin of nations.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Bid people to good and forbid them from evil; otherwise, God will make the worst among you dominate you. Then, your best men will pray (for you) but their prayers will not be answered.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Bid to good even though you do not abide with it yourself, and forbid evil even though you do not avoid it in its entirety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Bidding to good is good per se.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessed are horses’ foreheads.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessed are the sincere ones who are lights of guidance, enlightening all dark seditions through their brightness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessed are those who take precedence over others in seeking God's support, who accept the truth when they face it, and who judge among people as they do for themselves.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessed is he whose faults stop him attending to people's faults.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessed is one who connives at ignorance, dispenses the excess of his wealth, and treats people justly.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessed is the one who controls his tongue and sobs for his sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessed is the one who has a long life, good deeds and a happy ending, for God is pleased with him, and woe to the one who has a long life, evil deeds and an unhappy ending, for God is displeased with him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessed is the one who is a Muslim with sufficient sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessed is the one who is guided to Islam, who has sufficient sustenance, and who is contented with it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessed is the one who keeps humble without being deficient in anything, suppresses his soul (carnal desires) without being poor, dispenses from his lawfully- earned wealth, makes friend with men of deep knowledge and wisdom, and sympathizes with the poor and the indigent. Blessed is the one who suppresses his soul (carnal desires) and purifies his earning- who has a pure mind and a good- looking appearance and who keeps people aloof from his evil. Blessed is the one who puts his knowledge to practice, dispenses the excess of his property, and does not go to extremes in talking.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessed is the one who suppresses his soul, who is good- mannered, who dispenses the excess of his wealth, who follows (the Prophet's) tradition and who does not leave it for (heretical) innovation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessed is the one whom God has given sufficient sustenance with which he is satisfied.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessed is the one whose faults stop him attending to people's, who dispenses from his lawfully- earned wealth, who makes friend with men of deep knowledge and wisdom, and who keeps aloof from men of sins and vices.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessing escapes a meeting wherein participants do not listen to each other.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessing is with our aged ones, and whoever is not Merciful to our young ones, nor respectful to our aged, will not be among our followers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blessing is with your aged ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Blind- heartedness is (in fact) deviation after guidance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Borrow less (money), freer to be.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Breaking promises is not giving a promise with the sincere intention to keep it; it is to give a promise and intend in heart not to stand by it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Brush your teeth, for it is cleanliness, which consolidates one’s faith, and faith follows its holder to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Brushing one’s teeth brings the following benefits: cleanliness of mouth, strength of gum, brightness of sight, elimination of phlegm, happiness of angels, satisfaction of God, increase in one’s good deeds, and health of stomach.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Brushing one's teeth elevates one's eloquence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Brushing one's teeth gives rise to health of mouth, pleasure of God and strength of eyes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Brushing one's teeth is (an Islamic) custom you can put to practice whenever you wish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Brushing one's teeth is half of faith, and making ablutions is half of faith too.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: By your wealth protect your fame and respect.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Calamities are rewarded greatly; and should God love a people, He will put them to trial.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Calamity is in pledge of (man's) words- should anybody berate someone for sucking a dog's breast, he will himself do the same.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Calamity is in pledge of (man's) words- when someone says, By God I will not do such a thing, Satan abandons all his affairs and craves for making him commit sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Call unto your Lord and believe that He will hear you, and know that God will not grant the prayers of those with negligent hearts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Calling to good weighs over silence, and silence weighs over calling to evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Carnal desires will be forgiven, if not put to words or action.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Carrying out heavenly- ordained punishments in this very world is better for men than forty days of raining.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Casting an unlawful look (at a woman) is a poisoned arrow from Satan.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Causing the world to decline is more tolerable to God than killing a Muslim.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Caution does not block the way of fate.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Caution is not useful against fate; rather, praying is of use against the befallen and non- befallen (events).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Charity blocks seventy doors to evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Charity puts sins out just as water extinguishes fire.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Charity to the needy is only alms- giving, but to the is alms- giving as well as strengthening kinship ties.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Charity wards off hard deaths.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Chastity and faith are interrelated. Should one of them vanish, the other will (definitely) perish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Chastity and faith are interrelated; none lasts without the other.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Chastity and faith are two companions. They do not leave (their holder), but collectively.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Chastity and taciturnity are two components of (one's) faith, while scurrility and talkativeness are two elements of hypocrisy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Chastity comprises one's whole faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Chastity entails nothing but goodness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Chastity is (man's) beauty, piety brings magnanimity, patience is the best means to ends, and awaiting divine solution is an act of worship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Chastity is a portion of faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Chastity is goodness in its entirety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Chastity is women's beauty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Chastity originates from faith, and faith leads (man) to Paradise. Scurrility roots from cruelty, and cruelty ends in Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Cheerfulness carries away one's hatred.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Children are flowers of Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Choose appropriate containers for your sperms and keep distance with this black, for it is an undesirable color.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Choose many friends, for your Lord is so modest and Merciful that He hesitates to chastise His servant among his brothers (in faith) in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Choose suitable containers for your sperms, for women give birth to the like of their brothers and sisters.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Choose suitable containers for your sperms, marry women (and give your daughters in marriage to men) of equal status to yours.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Choose your neighbor before buying a house, and find a friend before taking a trip.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Choose your neighbor before buying a house, your companion before selecting a way, and your provision before setting out on a trip.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Choosing a bride from one's own family is like growing grass in one's own house.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Clean your clothes, beautify your hair, brush your teeth and be all made up and tidy, for the children of Israel didn't do so and their wives turned out to be adulterous.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Clean your mouths by brushing.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Clean yourself of urine, for it's the cause of most punishments in the grave.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Cleanliness has root in faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Cleanness of food (lawfully- earned food) results in an increase of food, faith, and sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Closer to you than your shoelaces is Paradise, and Hell is likewise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Color your white hair and stop looking like the Jews.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Comb your beard and pare your nails, for satans (microbes) move between flesh and nails.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Commit less vice, an easier death to face.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Committing adultery with ten women is less sinful than doing so with a neighbor's wife, and stealing from ten houses is easier (i.e. has an easier punishment) than robbing a neighbor's house.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Compared with martyrs' blood, the learned's ink is weightier (worthier).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Complete repentance is repenting (one's) sins in the sense that when you commit a sin, you should ask for the Exalted God's forgiveness and never commit that sin again.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Connivance at the world is of patience and is much harder to do than to use swords in the way of God, the Powerful, the Great.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Connive at a scholar's slip and await him to the right direction to keep.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Connive at the shortcomings of the Merciful people; for by the God who rules over my soul, whenever one of them slips, a helping hand to him God gives.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Connive at the sins of a generous man, for whenever he slips, God gives him a hand.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Connive at what you are worried about its performance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Connive at whatever your heart does not accept.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Constant contention (with others) suffices to make of you a sinner.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Consult women concerning their daughters.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Consultation is a wall for regret and safety against reproach.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Contentment is an unfailing wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Contentment is an unfailing wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Contorting one's tongue keeps man from wrong.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Control your tongue as well as your private parts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Control your tongue.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Cover your sexual organs in the presence of all but your wives and bonds women. It was asked: What about relatives ? The Holy Prophet replied: They should try not to see each other's sexual organs. What if one of us be naked at his (her) own privacy?, He was asked. The Holy Prophet said: One must be much more chaste to God than to people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Cover your thighs, for they're part of man's privy parts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Creating Adam in Paradise, the Exalted God left him on his own for sometime. Then, Satan began to move around watching him, and finally finding him empty- minded, he came to understand that Adam was not a self- possessed creature.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Creatures are God's and lands are His too, and whoever cultivates a piece of barren land, has a right to own it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Cunning and stingy people will not be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Cure yourselves by cow milk; for I verily hope that you can find in it divine recovery, since cows graze on all kinds of plants.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Cure yourselves, for He who has let diseases befall you, has created their medicines too.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Cure yourselves, O servants of the Exalted God! for he has created a (specific) medicine for any single kind of disease, save old age.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Cursing the one who remains thankless to the blessing bestowed on him will be effective.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Damned is the one who bothers a believer or plots against him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Damned is the one who does not issue true judgment between two persons choosing him as a judge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Damned is the one who insults his father and mother.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Damned is the one who shoulders all his responsibility on others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: David said: O you who have planted evil, you'll harvest its thorns.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: David said: putting your arm up to the elbow in the mouth of a dragon to smash it to pieces is better than making a request to upstarts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Death compared to its aftermath is like unto a goat's butting.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Death is a gift for believers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Death is the expiation (of sins) for all Muslim men and women.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Death of a lonely person is martyrdom.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Debt causes day's abasement and night's grief.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Debt causes defect in one's faith and descent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Debt defiles one's faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Debt is God's banner on earth, which He puts on the shoulder of the one He wishes to abase.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Declining your subjects' daily bread suffices to make of you a sinner.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Delay in the payment of debt is a form of injustice.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Delay in three things is not allowed: setting prayers in due time, carrying a dead body (for burial) as soon as possible, and marrying a widow to someone equal in status with her.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Deprived from my intercession will be the one who does not accept someone's sincere or insincere apology.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Descended to me Gabriel and said: Muhammad! Live as long as you wish, for you will finally perish, love whatever you mind, for you will leave it behind and do whatever you want to do, for its reward will come back to you.Know that night vigilance (for worship) is man's dignity and needlessness from people shows his magnanimity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Descent is (like unto) wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Dinars and Dirhams are seals of God on the earth, and the requests of whoever delivers his Master's seals to Him will be granted.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Diseases are God's whips on the earth for the correction of people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Divine anger is so severe for the one who regards himself the lord of lords, (for) there is no lord but the Lord (God).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Divine wrath is so severe for the one who oppresses those who have no helper save God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Divorce is the most despised thing God has declared lawful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Divorce is the most hateful (of all) lawful things to God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do brush your teeth, for a very good practice it is! It strengthens (your) gum, wipes out stink from (your) mouth, refreshes (your) stomach, elevates (your) status in Paradise, and makes God pleased and Satan furious.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do brush your teeth, for it's the cause of mouth purification and divine satisfaction.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do fear God, for it's the origin of all the good.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do fear God, the Greatest and the most Powerful, and remember Him in all cases. When you commit an evil deed, do repent instantly-a covert repentance for a covert sin, and an overt repentance for an overt sin.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do good immediately after doing wrong.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do good to those who deserve it and those who don't, for if your goodness the former receive, it would be quite appropriate; otherwise, you yourself will be the receiver of it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not allow your silly ones rule over you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not ask people for anything. Should your scourge fall down, bend and take it up and do not ask others to do so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not backbite Muslims and do not try to discover their faults.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not be a company but to believers, and do not share your meal save with the pious.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not be a company to the one who does not regard you of equal status with him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not be amazed at anybody's being a Muslim; rather (try to) know the essence of his thought.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not be amazed at anybody's state of affairs; rather, (wait to) see its end.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not be contentious to your brothers (in faith), do not make fun of them, and do not break your promises (in respect to them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not be easy- going to yourself, but hard on people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not be in gross grief, for your due sustenance and whatever is destined for you will surely come to pass.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not be jealous, do not raise prices (in business bargains), do not hate one another, and do not turn your backs to each other. Be brothers to God's servants, do not find fault with, admire or speak ironically to others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not beat your bondswomen for breaking your bowls, for bowls are surely destined to die just as people do.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not blame your brother (in faith), for God (may) keep him safe but make you suffer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not consider any good deed as insignificant, and do not break it when you promise your brother (in faith).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not curse the dead, for it annoys the living.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not curse the dead, for they have reached what they have sent ahead.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not demand a penny from whom you have not offered a penny to.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not divorce your wives unless you are suspicious about them, for God does not like men and women who marry a lot.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not do in privacy what you like people not to see in you (in public).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not drink wine, for it's the key to all evils.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not feed the poor on the things you don't eat yourselves.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not frighten a Muslim, for it's great injustice.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not get angry, for it entails evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not hate (your) daughters, for they're the cause of comfort.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not hate each other, do not turn your back to each other, and do not envy one another. O servants of God! Be brothers (in faith).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not hurt a Muslim by insulting an infidel.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not indulge your hearts in this material world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not insult Satan, and take refuge with God from his evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not insult Time, for Time is surely God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not joke (a lot) for it makes your worth vanish, and do not tell lie for it makes your light finish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not keep company with the foolish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not laugh excessively, for it makes (your) heart wither.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not leave wisdom to the unwise, and do not withhold it from the wise, for both these will be injustice to it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not make your hearts die of drinking and eating excessively, for they're like unto farms dying of over-irrigation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not make yourself afraid of religion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not marry barren or old women, for I take pride in your greater population (as compared with others').
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not postpone your brethren's affairs, do not be hostile to them, and do not contend with them.
