quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not punish people when you are doubtful (about their faults), and be oblivious to the great men's blunders, unless (the punishment) is divinely prescribed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not put anyone to shame.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not put yourself into trouble for guests.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not reject invitations, accept gifts and beat not Muslims.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not respond to the one who starts speaking without greeting.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not seek anybody's satisfaction by causing God's anger, do not praise anyone for God's grace on him, and do not blame anyone for the things God has not given you, for sustenance from God will not reach you through the greedy's greed, nor will anyone's discontent ward off your (destined) sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not sit between two persons without their permission.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not slander Muslims, and when one of them passes away, speak well of him (her).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not swear by God unnecessarily, being it true or false, and do not make God the means of your swearing, for He will neither be Merciful nor attentive to the one who falsely swears by Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not swear by God, for if one does so, God will surely belie him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not think that your sustenance comes to you late, for no creature dies before receiving the last bit of his (destined) sustenance. So, fear God and be moderate in seeking sustenance, i.e. in taking the lawful and avoiding the unlawful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do not wish for others what you wish not for yourself, and wish for your brother (in faith) what you wish for yourself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do you know what a lion in its roar says? it says, O God!Let me not win over benevolent people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do you know what talebearing is? It is to narrate one's sayings to others and break their relationship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do you think (man's) strength lies in carrying stones? No, it lies in bearing anger and wrath when in him they rise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Do your actions for God with purity of intent, for He only accepts sincere deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Doing another man's jobs (obligatorily) is hidden polytheism on the part of the latter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Don't look at your wives' or bond women's vulvas when having sexual intercourse with them, for it is a cause of blindness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Don't you know that Islam, Migration (to Medina) and Hajj destroy whatever have been practiced prior to them?
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Down with the one, down with the one and down with the one whose parents, or one of them, reach old age in his lifetime but he cannot make of himself a resident of Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Dreams are of three kinds: God's good tidings, reflection of one's deeds and Satan's threat. When one of you has a good dream, he can narrate it to others if he so wills, and should the reverse happens, he has to narrate it to nobody, rising instead to prayer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Dreams are of three kinds: Satan's threat to sadden the son of Adam, man's wishes during the day dreamt at night, and one part of the forty- six parts comprising prophethood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Drop your grudges.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Each of you is in your mother's womb as sperm for forty days, then as an embryo for forty more days, and as fetus in like manner. Afterwards, God will send an angel to it, appointing her to four issues- to determine its deeds, daily bread, death, and prosperity or adversity. Then, He blows his spirit into it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Each one of you should keep modest in the sight of the two angels companion to him, just as he does with respect to two of his righteous neighbors, for (these) angels are with him day and night.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Early men of this (Islamic) nation will be saved for certainty and piety, and the last of them will perish for stinginess and (unfulfilable) desires.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Early morning sleep bans a part of one's sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Early morning sleep wards off one's sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Eat and drink and give (something) in charity. Dress yourselves without prodigality and vanity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Eat currant, for it condenses the bile, makes phlegm vanish, strengthens the nerves, and makes the mind sharp, the nature good, the soul purified and one's grief escape.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Eating (food) in bazaars shows one's meanness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Eight groups of God's servants will be the most detested of all in the Day of Judgement: liars, selfish people, those who meet their brothers (in faith) joyfully while reserving enmity for them in their hearts, those who are slow in accepting the call to God and His prophet, but quick in following the call to Satan, those who resort to swearing in order to achieve their worldly requests, though having no claim to it, tale- bearers, those who create discord among friends, and those who oppress the fallen innocent people and are called dirty by the Great, Merciful God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Engage yourself in acts of worship to the extent of your ability, for as you get exhausted, God gets exhausted too. Verily, the most beloved deed in the sight of God is the most durable, though in quantity little.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Ensure me that you will act upon the following five, then I ensure you (of entrance) to Paradise: being just (to each other) as to the allocation of inheritance, treating people equitably, leaving fear in battles against enemies, keeping distance with treachery as to spoils and preventing the oppressors to do injustice to the oppressed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Ensure me that you will practice the following six, then I ensure you of (entrance to) Paradise: telling the truth, standing by your promises, returning (people's) trusts, keeping your privy parts (from the unlawful), controlling your eyes and restraining your hands.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Entering Paradise, I saw the statement on its door that `charity will be rewarded ten times as much but lending, eighteen times as much. I asked Gabriel for the reason, and he replied: Charity is to the good of the poor and the rich alike, but lending is only to the good of the needy
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Entering Paradise, on two sites, I saw three statements written in gold, reading There is no god but Allah and Muhammad is His messenger. We arrived at what we sent ahead, availed ourselves of what we made use of, and lost what we left behind and What a sinful nation and what a forgiving Lord!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Envy and hatred ruin all the good, just as fire swallows firewood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Even a horned goat having gored an unhorned one will be called to account in the Doomsday when rights are given back to the rightful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Even if you have mercy for a lamb, God will be Merciful to you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every believer has a sin which he commits once in a while and will not avoid doing it till he dies.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every blessing is perishable save that of the blessed, and so is every grief save that of the damned.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every distress has its specific remedy, and the remedy of sins is asking for God's Mercy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every distress has its specific remedy, but recovery would be achieved by proper remedy as well as the will of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every form of loaning returned in double is usury.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every good deed is (a form of) charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every good deed is charity, and whatever a Muslim dispenses for himself and his will be considered charity, and so are the steps he takes to keep his own fame intact.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every hardship is banned (for man), and no hardship is there in religion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every heart is hanging from two fingers of the Merciful God's Fingers of Power, which He holds fast or lets fall if He wills, and the scale of people's deeds is in God's hands, by which He will lift up a group or push down another in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every king has restrictions (of his own), and God's one on earth is His prohibitions.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every midnight, the doors of heavens open and a caller calls out: Is there anyone to pray and enjoy(God 's) acceptance? Is there anyone to ask for something to be answered in the positive? Is there a sorrow- stricken to be relieved of his sadness? Thus, there remains nobody with unaccepted requests, save and adulterous woman who trades her privy parts and a tax- taker who usurps people's property.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every morning a caller summons the servants (of God), saying: O you people! Reproduce for the earth, pile up (wealth) for ruin, and build for destruction.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every Muslim judge is watched by two angels who support him as long as he seeks nothing save truth, but abandon and leave him on his own as soon as he intends other than truth and purposefully deviates from it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every Muslim should pay alms. If he cannot do so, he must work with his own hands to avail himself of it, and pay alms too. If this is impossible either, he should help the needy. If he cannot do so, he should bid them to good or forbid them from evil, for this is in itself giving alms.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every Muslim who has two young unmarried daughters at home, whom he treats kindly, will be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every Muslim who loses three children to death before their puberty, will be welcomed by them at the eight doors of Paradise, being asked to walk in through each one he wishes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every one of you should be contented with a passenger's provision.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every traitor will have a flag in the Resurrection by which to be recognized.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Every traitor will have a flag in the Resurrection by which to be recognized.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Everybody derives strength from his brother (in faith).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Everybody has a reputation in heavens. Being it good or bad, he will enjoy a high or a low position on the earth respectively.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Everybody has his own fame, which ascends to the sky being it good but descends into the earth being it evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Everybody is an inspector of his own deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Everybody is responsible for what he has taken from others as long as he has not given it back to them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Everybody should accept his (Muslim) brother's apology when he apologizes to him, being it sincere or insincere; otherwise, he will not meet me at the Pool (of Kawsar).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Everybody should be optimistic to God on the verge of death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Everybody should save his face from the fire of Hell even through half a date.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Everybody will be a company to his own desires (in the Last Day) and thus, he who craves for disbelievers' (support) will be a company to them and his deeds will not avail him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Everything has a pillar, and the pillar of this religion is deep meditation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Everything has its own path, and the path to Paradise is (acquiring) knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Everything will (finally) decrease, but evil will (constantly) increase.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Everything, even birds in skies and fish in sees, curse those who conceal knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Everything, even fish in seas, asks forgiveness for the learned.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Everything, even inability and sagacity, has a due extent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Evil and scurrility degrade, but modesty decorates their hosts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Evil eye exists for sure. Satan and man's envy call it to action.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Evil eye exists, for sure. It is the only thing, which might change fate.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Excessive laughter makes heart wither.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Excessive love of the world leads to an increase in one's sorrows and hardens one's heart.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Exchange date with date, wheat with wheat, barely with barely, salt with salt, goods with goods and a handful (of anything) with a handful (of the same thing). Divining and receiving beyond that is usury unless what is given is different in kind from what is received.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Expect good for whoever dies while doing good, and be worried about and fear for whoever dies while doing evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Expecting betterment (in life) from God is servitude to Him, and God will be pleased with the little servitude of the one who is pleased with his little sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Exploiting one's brothers (in faith) is not of equity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Eyes, hands and feet (may)commit adultery besides one's privy parts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Faith (in God) requires the following five attributes, and faithless is the one who lacks any single one of them: surrendering to the will of God, being pleased with His decrees, leaving one's affairs to Him, relying on Him, and keeping patient when one first faces a disaster.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Faith abides not in wishes, but dwells in hearts, and (should) be verified by deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Faith consists of recognition by heart, acknowledgment by tongue and performance by (bodily) organs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Faith has two halves: one half is patience and the other, thanks- giving.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Faith lies in patience and generosity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Faith requires the following three: being generous in poverty, greeting the learned, and being just.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Faith requires the following three: to avoid doing wrong in anger, to refrain from keeping distance with truth in satisfaction, and to stop seizing others' property in power.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Faithless is the one who doesn't keep his promises.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: False oath makes goods sell but ruins the business well.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fasten your camel (with a rope), and in God then hope.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fasting in winter is a cold (easily- earned) gain.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fasting is a shield against Fire. Whoever fasts on a certain day, should not commit frivolity that day, and if somebody does something wrong to him, he should not revile or abuse him but should only say, I'm fast.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fasting is a shield against God's punishment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fasting is a shield as long as lying or backbiting does not tear it off.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fasting is half of patience.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fasting is half of patience. For everything some alms are due, and for the body, fasting.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fear an oppressed's prayers, for he claim his rights through praying, and the Exalted God refuses not to grant him his rights.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fear God and let peace among you breeze.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fear God and treat your children justly, as you would like others to treat you well.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fear God in treating women, for they are your assisting maidens.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fear God wherever you are, and do a good deed subsequent to any sin you commit in order to efface it. (Moreover), be good - tempered and treat people well.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fear God, and consider not any good deed insignificant, though it's pouring water from your bucket in a thirsty person's vessel or meeting your brother (in faith) with a happy face.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fear of people should not stop a man telling the truth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fear the oppressor's curse, even though he is an infidel, for against it there is no obstacle.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fear the oppressor's curse, for it ascends as a flame high to the sky.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fear the oppressor's curse, for there is no veil between it and God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fearing God is above all wisdom, and abstinence is the leader of all deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Feed the pious your food and to the believers, do good.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Feeding a hungry Muslim is a cause of being blessed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Feeding your wife, your children, your servants and yourself is considered charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fetter knowledge through writing.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fever is a prelude to death and God's prison on the earth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fever is believers' share from Fire, and fever of one single night wipes out the sins of one whole year.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fever makes one's sin fall just as trees let their leaves fall.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fighting with Muslims originates from blasphemy, abusing them is a sinful act, and a Muslim is not allowed to be sulk with his Muslim brother more than three days.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Find pretext to pardon the faults of the fair, generous people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Find the proximity of God by being hostile to (His) enemies, visiting them grimfaced, seeking God's pleasure in making them displeased and getting close to God by keeping distance with them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fire (Hell) will be the abode of a person whose tongue frightens people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Five things are among worldly disasters: a friend's death, waste of wealth, enemies' reproach, abandonment of learning, and a bad wife.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Five things break (man's) back: mistreating one's parents, being disloyal to one's husband against his confidence, disobeying God on the part of the one whom people obey as a leader, breaking one's promises, and speaking ill of people's consanguinity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Five things break one's fasts and invalidate one's ablution: telling lie, backbiting, tale- bearing, casting a passionate look (at someone) and swearing falsely.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Five things give rise to five other things: those who break their promise will be subjected to the rule of their enemies. Those who judge contrary to God's Law, will suffer poverty. Those who commit obscene acts, will face recurrent unexpected deaths. Those who make use of short weights in selling, will be afflicted with famine. Those who do not give poor- rate, will suffer years of drought.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Flattery is not an attribute of a (true) believer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Follow moderateness in life, for everything gets beautified with it and debased without it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: For (the realization of) three things I (earnestly) swear: the Exalted God will not consider those who have a share in Islam of equal status with those who don't - the shares in Islam being prayer, fasting and alms, He will not leave a servant on his own in the Hereafter after having offered him His friendship here, and He will offer him the otherworldly company of those whom he loves in this world. The fourth thing for which I can swear, and hope not to be sinful an oath is that when God keeps hidden a servant's doings here, He will (certainly) do so in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: For every disease, God has devised a certain remedy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: For every heart there is a piece of cloud as that of the Moon, covering it to darkness when it begins to shine and letting it shine one more time.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: For every sin there is (a form of) penitence, save for bad- temperedness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: For every sin there is a way of repenting before God, save ill- temperedness, for verily an ill- tempered person does not repent of any sin without a later return to something worse.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: For everything some alms are due, and for one's house, the drawing room.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: For everything some alms are due, and for the body, fasting.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: For everything there is a (form of) harm leading to its ruin, and the harm to this religion are corrupt rulers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: For everything there is a beauty, and for the Quran, a nice recitation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: For everything there is a key, and the key to Paradise is to love the poor and the needy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: For everything there is a key, and the key to skies is saying, There is no god but Allah.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: For his faults, a generous man, do not reprimand, for whenever he slips, God gives him a helping hand.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: For others' health (always) pray, and you will enjoy it (without delay).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: For the realization of three things I (earnestly) swear: charity causes no reduction in one's wealth, patience against injustice causes God, the Great and powerful, to enhance one's dignity and begging makes God to open to the beggar the doors of poverty. And keep in mind what I tell you. There are four groups of people in the world. First are those gifted with knowledge and wealth, who fear their Lord in dispensing them, who give a hand to their kins and who know that God has a share in their possessions. This group has the highest status. Second are those gifted with knowledge but not wealth, who are truthful of intention in saying, `if we possessed wealth, we would practice what the wealthy do'. This group will gain the results of their own intentions and are equal in reward with the first one. Third are those gifted with wealth but not knowledge, who make use of their wealth ignorantly, fear not their Lord in dispensing their wealth, give no hand to their kins and observe no share for God in their possessions. This gruop has the lowest status. Fourth are those on whom God has bestowed neither wealth nor knowledge, who keep on to say, `If we possessed wealth, we would practice much the same as the wealty'. This group too will pick the fruits of their own intentions and are equal in vice with their leaders.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: For the realization of three things I (easily) swear: charity will not cause a reduction in one's wealth (give charity, therefore), no one connives at the oppressions he has gone through, unless God expands his dignity (forgive, therefore, and God will further your dignity), and nobody stretches the hand of need toward others unless God opens the door of poverty on him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Forget about a barren beautiful woman and choose a black, productive one.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Forget about barren beautiful women, and marry productive (black) ugly ones, for I will take pride in the greater number of your offspring on other nations in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Forgetfulness ruins knowledge, and the knowledge transmitted to incompetent people will be ruined (too).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Forgive each other to make your grudges drop.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Forgive others' sins; if not, punish them to the extent of their sins and do not hit them on the face.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Forgive punishable sins among yourselves; for punishment will be inevitable should you make me aware of them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Forgiving is the best of all deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Fostering changes children's natures.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Foul- mouthedness, debauchery and stinginess suffice to make of man a sinner.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Four people will not be allowed to Paradise by the Exalted God, and will not taste heavenly pleasure: tipplers, usurers, seizers of orphan's properties, and those cursed by their parents.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Four people would earn the Exalted God's anger: an oft- swearing seller, a poor selfish man, an old adulterous person and an oppressive leader.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Four things are great, though little in weight: pain, poverty, fire and enemy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Four things have been predestined for Adam's son: his physical appearance, character, death, and sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Four things ruin a house, should its residents act upon them: treachery, theft, drinking wine and adultery.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Four things secure the prosperity of a man: having a chaste wife, having benevolent children, having pious companions, and earning his living in his own town.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Four things show one's wretchedness: drained eyes, hard - heartedness, inaccessible ambitions and excessive love for survival.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Free women bring (moral) regeneration to the house, and bonds ones bring corruption.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Frequent (people) time and again, more beloved to remain.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Friendship and enmity are both hereditary.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: From vanity is away, whoever greets others err hello to him they say.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Gabriel addressed me, saying: The Exalted God says, 'There is no god but Allah is My fort. Whoever enters it, will be safe against My punishment.'
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Gabriel came to me and said: 'Give your people good tidings that whoever does not adopt a partner for God, will enter Paradise after death'. I said: 'What if he has committed theft or adultery,' and I repeated it thrice, but the answer was in the positive and Gabriel added, 'even if he has drunk wine'.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Generosity is a heavenly tree with branches hanging over the earth, leading to Paradise whoever clings to one of them, and miserliness is a hellish tree with branches hanging over the earth, directing to Fire whoever touches one/of them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Generosity is God's outstanding attribute.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Get accustomed to grief, for it's the light of man's heart. Keep yourself hungry and thirsty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Get married and increase in number, for I will pride myself in you over other nations in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Get married, but do not divorce your wives, for God surely detests men and women who marry a lot.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Get married, for I pride myself over other nations for the largeness of your population, and do not follow the path of Christian monks.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Get married, for women bring you wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Gifts are sustenance from God; and so, whoever is offered a gift should accept it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Gifts blind men of wisdom.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Gifts impair ears, eyes and hearts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Girls' consent (in marriage) should be sought from their fathers, and silence is their consent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Give alms, for a time may come to pass when man manages to give something on charity, but the one who is supposed to get it will say, I would have accepted it if you had brought it yesterday. Today, I am no more in need of it, and thus he will find nobody to accept it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Give alms, for it surely releases you from the Fire.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Give alms, though a date it might be, for it drops one's hunger and puts out (the fire of) sin just as water makes fire extinguished.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Give good tidings to the poor believers that in the Day of Judgment, they will get rid (of the trial) five hundred years earlier than the rich- the former residing in Paradise, benefiting from God's blessings, and the latter being called to account.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Give good tidings to those who move towards mosques in the darkness of night that theirs will be full brightness in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Give something to a beggar, even if it is half a date (petty).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Give something to those who beg you, though coming to you on horse back (though rich), and pay workers their wage before sweat is dried on their skin.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Give up hope for what people have and avoid avarice, for it is immediate poverty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Give up the doubtful and grasp the undoubtful, for surely you will not feel the lack of what you have abandoned for the sake of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Give up the doubtful and grasp the undoubtful, for whoever grazes his cattle on the whereabouts of a forbidden pasture, might unwantedly find himself on it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Give up the doubtful and grasp the undoubtful. Verily, truthfulness entails salvation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Givers and receivers of bribe are both subject to the fire (of Hell).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Giving a morsel of food to a Muslim brother for God's sake is more favorite to me than giving a Dirham in charity, and giving a Dirham to a Muslim is more favorite to me than giving ten Dirhams in charity, and giving him ten Dirhams is more favorite to me than making a slave free.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Giving alms to kins is alms- giving as well as strengthening ties of kinship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Giving charity early in morning takes away all evils.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Giving charity is the best path to piety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Glorify God to be forgiven by Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Glorify what's divine, and God's glory will be thine.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Gluttony hardens man's heart.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God changes (darkens) the visage of the one who earns his living through knowledge, disturbs his affairs, and makes Hell his appropriate abode.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God created John (son of Zechariah) a believer, and created Pharaoh an unbeliever in their mothers' wombs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God created the creatures and determined their fates, deeds, and sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God divided (His) Mercy into a hundred parts, keeping ninety- nine parts with Himself and letting one single part descend to the earth. It is through this very part that (His) creatures are Merciful to one another, to the extent that a horse lifts its hoof lest it should hurt its colts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God does not endear the ignorant, nor does He degrade the patient.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God does not forgive the killer of a believer, and accepts not his (her) repentance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God does not observe a heretic's deeds unless heabandons his (her) heresy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God does not trust in hypocrites.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God gives chastity and abundance to the one who seeks them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God gives sustenance to the frugal and deprives it from the extravagant.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God grants a good friend to the one for whom He wishes good.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God has commanded me to behave moderately with people, as he has commanded me to perform my obligations.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God has created something to overcome any other created thing, and thus, His Mercy has He created to overcome His anger.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God has decreed this nation (Muslims) to suffer their punishment in this very world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God has forbidden Paradise for the scurrilous people who don't care about what they say and hear.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God has made it incumbent on Himself to help and bestow blessing on the one who does the following three while relying on Him and hoping for His reward: trying to free oneself from slavery, marrying, and cultivating barren lands.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God has made wine and all the intoxicant unlawful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God has not created anything inferior to (man's) intellect on the earth, and that's inferior even to the earth's red sulphur.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God has not given His servants anything better than chastity in their religion and privy parts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God has not granted His servants any beauty better than unwillingness towards the world, and controlling one's belly (food) and privy parts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God has not granted knowledge to the learned unless He has made them promise not to spare it from others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God has predestined every man's deeds, death, sustenance and resting place, and He will never turn away from them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God has sworn that misers will not be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God helps a judge as long as he keeps away from tyranny, but as soon as he starts cruelty, He leaves him on his own and Satan joins with him thereof.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God helps His servants as long as they help their brothers (in faith).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God in the Day of Judgment will terrify whoever casts an awful look at a Muslim, terrifying him unfoundedly.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God is (the real) physician. What's good for you is perchance bad for other than you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God is kind to whoever has a kind heart.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God is not Merciful to the merciless.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God is pleased with little deeds of the one, who is pleased with Him as to little sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God is too Just to punish His servants anew in the Hereafter, if they are punished in this very world for their sins, and God is too Generous to reconsider man's punishable sins after having covered them and forgiven him (in this world).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God is truthful, and so be truthful to Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God is very displeased with (people) eating without hunger, sleeping without tiredness and laughing without reason.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God likes two characteristic features (for man) and dislikes two others. The former are generosity and forgiveness; the latter, parsimony and ill- temperedness, and when He wishes goodness for someone, He assigns him (her) the service of people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God made Mercy one hundred portions. He granted one single portion to people by which to feel pity for each other, and kept ninety- nine portions with Himself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God marks a sign of one's good or bad characters on his face by which to be recognized.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God may forgive all sins, save those of dying a polytheist and killing a believer intentionally.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God overcomes those who try to overcome Him and plots against those plotting against Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God provides the moderate ones with abundance, afflicts the extravagant with poverty, grants to the humble sublimity, and makes the arrogant face ruin.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God raises (the status of) the one who keeps humble for Him, lowers the one who shows vanity to Him, and belies the one who swears falsely by Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God raises (the status of) the one who keeps humble for His sake and lowers the one who shows vanity (to Him).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God relieves the one who often asks Him forgiveness from all griefs, provides him with a refuge in all difficulties, and gives him sustenance from an unexpected source.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God secures the sustenance of those who seek knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God taught me courtesy and how nice was it (to me)!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will abase whoever seeks honor through His servants.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will assist anyone who intents to pay back his debts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will banish Paradise for the one who dies after having deceived his servants whom God have put under his supervision.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will be pleased with whoever seeks His consent, even if it leads to people's anger, and will be angry about whoever seeks people's consent by making Him displeased.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will build a house in Paradise for whoever builds a mosque, small as it may be only for a pigeon to lay its eggs in.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will create a good relation between people and the one who establishes a good relation with Him, and will amend the outward conditions of the one who rectifies his inner self.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will definitely give a hand to the one who marries in order to avoid indulging in the heavenly- unlawful deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will definitely not answer the call of an oppressed man who has already made someone else suffer the same oppression brought on him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will definitely provide His believer servant (s) with sustenance from an unexpected source.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will forbid Paradise for whoever is not a well- wisher of the subjects put under his protection.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will forgive a sinful person who knows that He has witnessed him, though he avoids seeking His forgiveness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will forgive whoever begins his day without intending to oppress any body.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will give a reward to the one who cultivates a barren land from which a thirsty heart might drink.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will grant the reward of a good accepted pilgrimage to Mecca to the one who casts a tender glance at his parents' face.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will help whoever helps the poor, here and in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will improve one's relation to people, if he improves his relation to Him, will correct one's outward status, if he corrects his inner self, and will give one sufficiency in the world, if he works for the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will in the Hereafter echo in the ears of people the disgrace of whoever echoes his knowledge in the ears of people (in this world), and will lower and belittle him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will keep His wrath away from the one who restrains one's anger, and will cover the faults of the one who controls one's tongue.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will keep in honor a servant who loves another one (for His sake).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will keep in the Hereafter the secret of the one who keeps the secret of his Muslim brothers in this world and does not disgrace them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will make a servant's property end in good, should he give good charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will make a wasteful person rule over anyone who sells something rotten.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will make everybody a company to those whom he loves (in the Hereafter).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will make everything fear the one who fears Him, and will make one fear everything if he fears Him not.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will make everything fear the one who fears Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will make one suffer the unlawful, if he is ashamed to act upon the lawful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will make one's faith vanish when he commits adultery or drinks wine, just as one puts off his shirt.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will make the sign of His servant's intentions appear in him, being they good or evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will make up for whoever keeps patient in calamities and will reward whoever swallows his anger.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will make whoever prefers His love to people's, needless of the latter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will not accept faith without deed and deed without faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will not accept the compensating deeds of three groups of people in the Day of Judgement: those with whom their parents are dissatisfied, those who put their donations under compulsion, and those who belie predestination.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will not afflict a people with famine, save for disobedience to Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will not attend whoever puts on a dress of pride to show himself off, until he takes it off.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will not bestow His grace on three groups of people in the Day of Judgement: those with whom their parents are dissatisfied, women who behave like men, and those who connive at their wives' unfaithfulness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will not bestow His grace on three persons in the Day of Judgement: an old adulterer, a man whose only possession is swearing- who swears for truth and falsehood alike- and an arrogant poor person.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will not bestow His grace on three persons in the Day of Judgement, will not purify their souls and will make them suffer painful punishment: an old adulterer, an arrogant poor person, and a man whose only possession is God, buying and selling nothing save through swearing by Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will not call to account (in the Hereafter) the one that teaches a child to say, 'There is no god but God.'
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will not debase any servant before sparing him knowledge and courtesy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will not heed the needs of the one who undertakes a part of Muslims' affairs, unless he heeds their needs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will not make anybody mean, unless He manages to take away his knowledge and politeness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will not regard any of the good deeds of the one who is not virtuous enough to avoid disobeying Him in privacy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will not reject the requests of three groups of people: those who remember God a lot, the oppressed and just leaders.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will not talk to and will not look at three persons in the Day of Judgement: a man who falsely swears to have bought something more expensive than its real price, a man who falsely swears in order to seize a Muslim's property, and a man who refuses to give his extra water to others. God will address such a man, saying: I spare you My grace today as you refused to donate the excess (in your wealth) for which you made no efforts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will not talk to three groups of people in the Day of Judgement, and will make them suffer painful punishment: old adulterers, monarchs who tell lie, and the arrogant poor.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will open a way to Paradise for those who leave their homes in search of knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will open the door of poverty to the one who opens the door of excessive requests to people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will pardon whoever pardons others, and will forgive whoever forgives others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will provide for the needs of the one who provides for the needs of his brethren.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will relieve a man from one of his otherworldly griefs, should he relieve one of the worldly griefs of a Muslim, will be easy- going to a man here and in the Hereafter, should he avoid being hard on a poor person, and will veil a man's secrets in both worlds, should he veil a Muslim's secrets.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will remove the griefs of both worlds from the one by whose hand He removes a Muslim's problems.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will return the debts of those who borrow people's property and intend to give it back, and will waste it if they intend to waste it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will reward a man who plants a tree, to the extent of its fruits.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will save from the Fire the face of the one who defends his brother's fame.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will settle all the needs of whoever forsakes everything and depends on Him alone, granting him sustenance from unexpected sources, and will leave on his own whoever relies on other than Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will surely forgive a sinful person who knows that he has a Lord capable of punishing or forgiving him if He so wishes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will surely love those who become angry but keep patient.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will surely save (from the Fire) the one who defends his brother's fame in his absence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God will, in the Hereafter, cover up the secrets of those who does not uncover the secret of others here.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God wishes man to do his job very well.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God wishes to join the one who wishes to join Him, and hates to join the one who hates to join Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God withholds the yoke of Islam from the neck of the one who takes a distance of even one inch with the Muslim community.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God, the Exalted, loves the one who is easy- going in buying and selling, as well as in borrowing and repaying.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God's anger is so severe for an adulterer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God's anger will be so severe for a woman who gives birth to an illegitimate child who will see of her mother's family what is unlawful and will share in their property.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God's forgiveness weighs over your vices.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God's hand is with the community (of people).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God's increased blessings to a servant causes people's increased requests to him, and whoever does not manage to settle these requests will surely jeopardize such blessings.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God's pleasure with a penitent person weighs over that of a thirsty man who arrives at water or a barren woman who begets a child or a loser who finds his lost one. Verily He will make the guardian angels, his limbs and all the points on the earth to forget the sins and faults of the one who repents and turns to God sincerely.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God's pleasure with His creature's repentance weighs over that of any one of you finding his lost camel in a desert.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God's pleasure with His creature's repentance weighs over that of a barren woman who begets a child or a loser who finds his lost one or a thirsty man who arrives at water.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: God's power over you is more than your power over Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Gold and silk are lawful (to be used) for the women of my (Islamic) nation, and unlawful for men.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good deeds ward off bad falls, hidden charity quenches God's wrath and observing the bonds of kinship prolongs one's life. Every good deed is charity, and the benevolent and the wicked of this world will be the benevolent and the wicked of the Hereafter, with the benevolent being the first to enter Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good intention leads its owner to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good- manneredness roots from man's happiness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good manners are deeds of Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good manners are ten in number. They may be found in a man but not in his son, in a son but not in his father, and in a servant but not in his master, and God bestows them upon those whom He wishes to prosper. They are: sincere talk, steadfastness in war, donation to the poor, goodness for goodness, trustfulness, keeping the bonds of kinship, supporting friends, supporting neighbors, hospitality, and above all, chastity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good name (fame) is one single part of the seventy- five parts of prophethood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good name (fame), gentleness and moderateness make one single part of the twenty- four parts of prophethood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good- naturedness belongs to the Great Lord.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good- naturedness is a curb of God's Mercy in the mouth of its holder and under the control of an angel leading him to goodness which guides him to Paradise, and bad- naturedness is a curb of God's punishment in the mouth of its holder and under the control of Satan leading him to evil which shows him the way to Fire.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good- naturedness is goodness (blessing) and bad- naturedness, evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good- naturedness is goodness, bad naturedness is evil, obedience to women leads to penitence, and bad deaths are prevented through benevolence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good- naturedness is growth and bad- naturedness, evil. Goodness brings man longevity, and bad deaths are prevented through charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good- naturedness is one half of religion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good- naturedness makes one's faults vanish as the Sun causes ice to perish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good- naturedness strengthens friendship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good news is carried by the pious, and bad news by the impious.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good- temperedness is indicative of man's fortune and bad- temperedness of his misfortune.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good- temperedness wipes out one's sins just as water makes ice melt, and bad- temperedness ruins one's deeds just as vinegar makes honey spoil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good tidings of this world are pleasant dreams.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Good words are (acts of) charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Goodness accompanies your noblemen.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Goodness does not lie in finery and brilliant bearing, but in peace and solemnity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Goodness goes round in the hands of a hundred men, with the last one being rewarded as the first.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Goodness has many forms to do, but good doers are few.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Goodness is a door of heaven, blocking bad deaths.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Goodness is good- temperedness, and badness is what is carved in your heart and you do not like people to know about.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Goodness is that in which your heart and soul find rest, and badness is that which is carved in your soul and which passes through your chest......?
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Goodness is worshipping God in such a way as if you saw Him, for if you see Him not, He surely sees you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Grave is the first dwelling of the eternal ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Greatness lies in piety, dignity in humility, and needlessness in certainty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Greed is like unto a slippery piece of stone on which the scholars' feet will not stand firm.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Greed makes wisdom leave the learned's hearts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Greedy is the one who demands unlawful gains.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Greet (people) back, control (your) eyes, and utter good words.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Greet openly, mind! Safety to find.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Greet sincerely (openly), feed others, establish close relations with relatives and set prayers at nights when people are asleep, if you wish for permission to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Greeting (should) precede asking (for something); thus, do not answer those who request before greeting (you).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Greeting is an act voluntary, but responding to it is obligatory.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Greeting is one of God's attributes He has spread on the earth. So, let it prevail among you, for when a Muslim passes by a people and greets them, he will be higher in rank than them if he is greeted back, and he will be greeted back by someone better and purer than them if they do not respond to his greeting.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Greeting is peace for our people and guarantee for our commitments.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Greeting people and having a cheerful face is a form of charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Grief is half of oldness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Guided and saved will be the ones who keep patient in calamity, who are grateful when gifted a bounty, who forgive in suffering tyranny, and who seek (God's) forgiveness after treating people unjustly.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Had God let the dwellers of Paradise do commerce, they would have been merchants of clothes and perfume.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Had ten of the Jews believed me, all of them would have done so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Half of the graves dug for my people is due to evil eyes and gluttony.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hand something to the poor, even if it is a (piece of) burnt hoof.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hands are of three kinds: God's hand which above all hands stands, the giver's hand which stands below God's hand and the receiver's hand which below the other two stands. Be generous, therefore, and be not close- handed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Happy is the man who has a good house, a good neighbor and a tame horse.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hard trials (hardships) befell you and you kept patient, but I am worried about you as to harder trials on the part of women when they decorate themselves with gold, and dress themselves in precious cloths, thereby causing troubles for the rich and asking the poor what they cannot afford.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Haste in seeking knowledge, for uttering true words is better than the world and its gold and silver.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Have mercy (on people) and forgive them to receive divine Mercy and Forgiveness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Have mercy on the degraded formerly held in honor, the rich afflicted with poverty and the learned left unknown among the ignorant.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Have mercy on those who are on the earth to receive the Mercy of the One who is in the heavens.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Have supper, though a handful of bad date might be there, for surely doing the reverse brings old age and weakness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Having entered paradise, most of its dwellers I found of the unwise!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Having hope in God, and having faith (in this world) are sufficient for me.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He is not a believer whose neighbors do not feel safe against his evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He is not a liar who makes peace between two persons through good words or attribution of something good to any one of them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He is not poor, who begs among people to get one or two morsels of food or one or two dates, but the one who does not have anything to make him needless, who is not attended with alms, and who does not make a request to people at the same time.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who berates you, saves you (from his evil).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who bids a good deed is like unto the doer of it, (indeed).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who breaks the bonds of kinship will not be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who hurts people the most here will be hurt the most by God in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who in the path of truth walks, effectively talks.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who is obedient to his parents and his Lord, will reside in the highest heaven.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who is well- fed, with his neighbors starving, is not a (true) believer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who learns (something) but does not teach it (to others) is like unto the one with a treasure, not spending it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who makes efforts in favor of orphans and widows is like unto a struggler in the way of God or the one who stands up to prayer at night and keeps fast during the day.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who provides our bazaars with something is like unto the one who struggles in the way of God, and he who hoards goods is like those called 'infidels' in the Book of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who recites the Qur'an, will not suffer poverty, and that's the peak of riches for him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who remembers God among the negligent is like unto the one who among the deserters (of the battlefield) remains steadfast and patient.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who remembers God among the negligent is like unto the one who fights the deserters of the battlefield, is like unto a lamp in a dark house, and is like unto a green tree among cold- stricken leafless ones- one whose place of residence in Paradise is shown to him by God, and whose sins will He forgive even if they amount to the number of silent and speaking people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who repents is like unto a sinless person, and he who asks God for forgiveness but insists in committing sins is like unto the one who ridicules Him, and he who annoys Muslims is sinful to the extent of palm groves.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who repents is like unto a sinless person, and when God loves someone, he will be safe from sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who takes back his gift is like unto a dog eating its vomit.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who teaches good to people but forgets about himself is like unto a candle giving light to people but burning itself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who undertakes the affairs of a group of people, but carries it out without (enough) care and honesty, will be excluded from the Exalted God's Mercy, which extends to all things.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who utters indecent words about the dead is like unto the one who is at the verge of ruin.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He who walks to pay a visit to a patient goes the direction of Paradise till he returns.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: He whose death is left off to live for sixty years, will be spared any excuses (for his sins) by God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Health and relief are two unthanked blessing.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hearsay is no evidence. When the Almighty Lord bespoke to Moses of his followers' tendency towards the Golden Calf, he did not break the tablets, but when he saw their corruption in person, he cast the tablets down and broke them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hearts are like unto roots in a land, turned over by wind (all the time).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hell has a door through which nobody is allowed to pass, save those who quench their wrath by making the Exalted God angry.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hell is filled with wishes, and Heaven with the abominable.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hell is not allowed to burn the eyes having shed tear out of God's fear, and the eyes having watched out in the way of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hell is not allowed to burn the eyes having shed tears out of God's fear, the eyes having been wide awake for God's sake, the eyes having been kept away from the unlawful and the eyes having been cut out in the way of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hell is not allowed to seize a gentle, lenient, and an easy- going man who keeps close relations with people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hell is the abode of fraud, deceit and treachery.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hell is the abode of oppressors and their supporters.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hell is the dwelling of the cunning people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Helping a Muslim brother in his requests is more favorite to me than keeping fast for a month and having ritual seclusion in the holy Mosque.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Helping the poor, suspends terrible deaths.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Helping your brother (in faith) for one day is better than retiring to pray a month whole.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hidden ambition and (false) pretension are (two kinds of) polytheism.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hidden charity cools down God's wrath.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hoarding people's food in Mecca is fighting God in disbelief.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hold bread in honor, for God has sent it down from the blessings of the heavens and brought it up from the blessings of the earth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hold the learned in respect, for they are heir to prophets, and whoever honors them, honors God and His messenger, (indeed).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hold witnesses in respect, for through them God administers justice and repels tyranny.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hold your children in honor and on them, excellent training shower.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Holy war is not mere fighting in the way of the Almighty God. Verily, it is to shoulder one's own parents and offspring's burdens, and the man who carries his own burden to be needless of people is a struggler (in the way of God).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Honesty leads to (increased) sustenance and treachery, to poverty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Honor the one who pays a visit to you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hope and fear will not simultaneously befall a believer's heart unless God, the Greatest and the most Powerful, grants him hope and keeps him safe from fear.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Horses abound in everlasting gains and achievements and stand as a source of assistance for their owners, and spending for horses is like unto being generous in giving charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Horses abound in everlasting gains and stand as a source of assistance for their owners. So, caress horses' foreheads, ask God for their good, adorn them with something, but not with warfare implements.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Horses abound in everlasting gains, and spending for them is like unto spending generously for one's family.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Horses abound in everlasting gains, i.e. spoils and rewards.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hours of sickness sweep away hours of sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Houses you make wherein you will not rest, things you amass which you never taste and wishes you have which are never fulfilled.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: How bad are the people among whom believers have to live with dissimulation and denial.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: How bad are those who do not invite guests (to their houses)!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: How bad is a hoarder of things, who gets depressed when the Exalted God makes the prices fall, and rejoices when He causes them to rise!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: How is God (expected) to consider a people as pious, who do not endeavor to take back the rights of the weak from the powerful?
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: How is it that when one of our agents returns to us says, 'I have collected this for you and I have been gifted that?' If so, why didn't he stay in his father's and mother's house to see whether people gift him or not?
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: How loathsome is the food of a marriage ceremony, when served to the rich but not to the poor!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: How nice a bestowal it is to hear a word of truth and communicate it to your Muslim brother!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: How nice a gift is a word of wisdom!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: How nice a place of worship is a Muslim's house for him!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: How nice for those of my people who brush their teeth before or after eating and when making ablution.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: How nice is a gift at the time of need!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: How nice is it to be moderate in affluence, in poverty and in worshiping (God).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: How nice is lawfully- earned wealth for a pious man!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: How nice it is for man to take up abode in privacy once in a while, look back on his sins and ask God for forgiveness!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: How nice weapons are patience and prayer for a believer!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Humility adds nothing to God's servants but dignity. Be humble, therefore, and God will grant you dignity. Forgiveness adds nothing to God's servants but glory. Forgive, therefore, and God will make you glorified. Charity causes increase in one's wealth. Give charity, therefore, and God will bestow (His) Mercy on you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Hurting a Muslim is hurting me, and hurting me is hurting God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Husbands have the greatest claims on wives, and mothers on their children.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I advise you (to be careful) about your neighbors.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I advise you to be as modest to God as you are to a chaste man of your clan.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I advise you to fear the Exalted God in public and in privacy, to do good after doing evil, to ask nothing from people, to hold nothing on trust and to avoid judging between two persons.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I am a warner, death is a plunderer and Resurrection, a meeting place.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I am anxious about three things to happen to my people after my death: deviated carnal desires, unbounded sexuality and gluttony, and negligence after knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I am mostly worried about my nation of carnal desires and unfulfilable wishes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I am mostly worried about my nation, of glib- tongued hypocrites.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I am the most eloquent Arab.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I am very amazed at those who believe in eternal abode but try hard for the abode of vanity!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I am worried about my (Islamic) nation more of gluttony, over- sleeping, laziness and weakness of faith than anything else.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I am worried about you more for blessings than for sins. Beware that blessings not thanked for will entail your definite ruin.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I am worried about you more for trials in poverty than for trials in affluence. Verily, you were afflicted with poverty but kept patient; verily the world is sweet and charming!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I asked Gabriel, Do you see your Lord ? He said: There are seventy screens of light between me and Him, the closest of which will set me afire should I happen to look at it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I asked God to let me call my people to account (in the Hereafter), lest they might feel disgrace in the sight of others, but He- the Great and powerful - sent me a revelation, saying O Muhammad!I Myself will call them to account and hide their sins (if any) from you, so that they won't feel disgrace even in your sight.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I assure (you) on behalf of God that each time a wise man makes a mistake, he is upgraded by God so that he finally joins Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I do not like Mount Uhud to turn to gold for me and even one Dinar of it be left with me more than three days, save for lending.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I eat food like slaves and sit on the ground as they do.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I established two things among you, which will keep you from going astray: the Quran and my Sunnah (ways & attitudes). They will not be detached from each other till they join me at the pond of Kawsar (in Paradise).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I give you glad tidings, and you give glad tidings to others, that whoever honestly bears witness to There is no god but Allah, will undoubtedly be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I have been advised to keep short in talking, for it is good indeed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I know no one save a believer to be better than a thousand like unto himself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)
