quotes.quote: I looked at Paradise and saw the poor dwelled therein the most, and at Hell wherein women were the majority (to roast).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I never buy something before getting aware of its price.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I saw a man in Paradise walking around a tree he had cut off in the world, for it blocked people's path and annoyed them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I suffered in the way of God when no one suffered and I was frightened in the way of God when no one feared at all. Many a day and many a night I spent when Balal and me had nothing to eat.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I swear by God that leading one to the right path is much better than having red- haired camels.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I swear by God that this world to the Hereafter is just as one of you puts his finger into a sea, and see what happens! (Nothing he gains).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I swear by God that you will not find anyone juster to you than me after my death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I was appointed to treat people moderately.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I was appointed with a pure, easy religion and, therefore, whoever opposes my manners is not my follower.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I was given the option to either choose intercession or to take half of my nation to Paradise (without final judgment), and I chose the former for it is more extended and sufficient in range. Do you think that intercession is specifically applied for pious believers? No, it is for the sinful wrong doers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I was offered short, but comprehensive words.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I was so much advised to brush my teeth that I got scared lest it might become obligatory for me.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I was so much advised to brush my teeth that I got scared of putting them to harm.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I will inform you of what authority is, if you ask me to do so. It begins with blame, leads to remorse and ends up with the torment of the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I will undertake to reserve Paradise for whoever undertakes to put no demand to people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I wonder at a Muslim who keeps patient when calamity befalls him and thanks and praises God when he attains some good.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I'm not worried about my people (concerning anything), save weak faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I'm not worried about my people as to villains who may kill them or foes who may cause them to annihilate, but as to misleading leaders who will kill them in case of disobedience and impose on them seditions in case of obedience.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I'm not worried about my people concerning any trials, save wine and women.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: I'm not worried about your poverty but only about taking pride in your excessive wealth, nor am I worried about your wrongdoings but only about intentional ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If a believer manages to hide himself in a hole, someone will be sent by God to hurt him (put him to trial).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If a drop of hellish Zaghoom drips to the world, it will ruin the life of the people. So, what would happen to the ones whose otherworldly food is Zaghoom.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If a relative is in need, giving alms (to others) will not be fair.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If a woman perfumes herself and passes by people to please them, she will be adulterous.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If animals were aware of what men know about death, they would avoid weight- growing meat.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If anything could take precedence over fate, it would (definitely) be an evil eye.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If bad- temperedness were a man walking (living) among people, it would be a bad one, and the Exalted God has surely not created me an abusive man.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If believers knew about the punishment of God, no one of them would covet for Paradise, and if infidels knew about God's Mercy, they would not be hopeless of (being allowed to) Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If evil and abuse were creatures of Allah, they would be the worst of all.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If faith were in the firmament, (some) men of Persia would find a way to it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If God grants you wealth, the sign of His blessing and generosity should appear in you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If God's servants didn't commit sins, He would create a people who would commit sins to be forgiven by Him, for He is the most Merciful and Forgiving.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If hardship enters a hole, relief will do too to make the former vanish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If I had gold as much as Mount Uhud, I would like to have nothing of it with me within three days, save for a piece by which to repay my debts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If I were to command anyone to prostrate anyone else, I would command women to prostrate their husbands.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If I were to command anyone to prostrate anyone else, I would command women to prostrate their husbands, for God has invested the latter with rights in respect to the former.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If it is said to the dwellers of Hell that they will stay there to the number of sands on the earth, they will rejoice, and if the same is said to the dwellers of Paradise, they will feel sad, but God has granted eternal life to the latter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If it were not for beggars' telling lie, those who repelled them would not be praised.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If it would not cause trouble for my people, I would order them to brush their teeth at prayer times.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If it would not cause trouble for my people, I would order them to brush their teeth at dawns.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If knowledge were hanging from the firmament, a group of Persians would (manage to) acquire it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If modesty were a man, it would be a decent one.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If nothing remains save one single day from the life in this world, God will prolong it so much that a man from my household will rise to fill the earth with equity just as it was filled with injustice and enormity- a man whose name and whose father's are respectively mine and my father's.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If one of you happens to see something interesting in himself, in his own property or in that of his brother (in faith), he should ask God for His blessings, for the evil of eyes is a reality.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If patience were a man, it would be a generous one.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If people knew what I know of loneliness, no one would ever ride (travel) alone at night.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If people were asked not to break the anciculan dung of camels, they would break it, saying, They have asked us not to do so to spare us its benefits.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If somebody slanders you with regard to what he knows of you, you should refrain from so doing with respect to what you know of him. Thus, you will be rewarded, and he will be punished (by God).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If someone has a piece of advice for his brother (in faith), he should mention it to him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If son of Adam had a valley of gold, he would long for a second one, and if he had two valleys as such, he would long for a third, for his belly (hunger) will not be satiated save by soil, and God will accept the repentance of whoever He wishes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If son of Adam had a valley of palms, he would long for the like of it to an unbounded extent, for his belly (hunger) will not be satiated save by soil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If the Resurrection fell upon one among you while having a sapling in his (her) hand, he should plant it, if possible.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If the world were as valuable to Allah as a wing of a mosquito, He would never give a sip of water to an infidel.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If the world were as valuable to Allah as a wing of a mosquito, He would never give a sip of water to an infidel.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If there were no hope, no mother would milk her child, and nobody would plant a tree.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If there were no women, (all) men would be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If there were no women, God would be duly worshipped.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If vanity were a man, it would not be a nice one.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If women knew about their husbands' rights, they would stand at their service till finishing lunch and supper.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you could see death and its course, worldly desire and its happiness would turn worthless for you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you didn't commit sins, God would create a people who would do so in order to be forgiven and, thus, sent to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you didn't commit sins, I would be worried about you as to something worse… selfishness… selfishness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you expect your children to treat you equitably in beneficence and affection, treat them equally in generosity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you have at your disposal what suffices you, refrain from seeking what makes of you a rebel.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you have four things, do not regret for the worldly things you have not: truthfulness, trusteeship, good manners, and abstaining from the unlawful in what you eat.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you knew about the extent of God's Mercy, you would rely on it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you knew what I know about the world, you would feel safe against its sorrows.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you knew what I know, you would laugh less and weep more, with food and drink being distasteful to you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you knew what I know, you would laugh less and weep more.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you knew what I know, you would weep more and laugh less and climb to high places to entreat to God, being fearful about your (eternal) safety or ruin.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you knew what I know, you would weep more and laugh less, for discord will come to pass, honesty will disappear, trust will be eliminated, honest men will be charged (of dishonesty), the treacherous will be regarded honest, and seditions will overcome you just as dark nights do.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you knew what was behind questioning, nobody would ever make a request to anybody else.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you knew what would befall you after death, you would have no appetite to eat, would never drink tastefully, would never enter a house to take rest, but would (instead) climb to summits hurting your hearts and bewailing your souls.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you look (deeply) at death and its course, you would hate worldly longing and its joys.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you pour the water (semen), which is destined to be a child, on a piece of stone, the Exalted God will bring a child out of it, for He will surely create whoever is to be created.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you seek the love of God and that of the Prophet, return the things given to you in trust, be honest in speaking and treat your neighbors well.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you were afraid of the Exalted God, as you should, you would acquire knowledge untainted by ignorance; and if you knew the Exalted God, as He deserves, mountains would be shaken at your command.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: If you wish to be a favorite to God, dislike the (material) world, and if you wish to be a favorite to people, offer them your excess.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Ignore the sins of the generous, the shortcomings of the learned and the awe of the just kings; for whenever they slip, the Exalted God gives them a hand.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Ill- speaking guys will not be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Improvement of living shows man's deep knowledge, and seeking what improves you is not mammonism.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In Day of Judgment, God will not make one immune from fear, if he has terrified a believer, and will make one suffer humility, if he has backbitten a believer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In order to keep women at home, spare them (variegated) dresses.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In Paradise, only names of the things belonging to this world exist.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In Paradise, the whip of one of you will be preferred to whatever is there between the earth and sky.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In the Day Judgment, the Exalted God will call (His) believer servant to His presence and while keeping him covered and saved from people and making him acknowledge his sins, asks him questions like this: Do you know such and such a sin ? The servant answers in the positive and continues doing so until it occurs to his mind that due to his (boundless) sins, he will surely perish. Then, God says: I covered your sins in the world and I forgive you today, and He places the book of his good deeds in his right hand. As to the disbelievers and hypocrites, He openly states: these are the ones who belied their Lord. God's damnation be on oppressors.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In the Day of Judgement when there is no shelter, three groups of people will reside beneath God's shadow: those who are kind to their and are thus gifted with increased sustenance and long life, women whose husbands die, leaving them with little orphans, who avoid getting married to bring their children up to maturity or let them die, and those who prepare food to serve their guests in perfect hospitality, calling the poor and orphans to their table tHereafter to feed them for the sake of the Great and Powerful God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In the Day of Judgement, God will bestow the reward of seventy- two truthful men on a child who spends his pre- maturity life in the acquisition of knowledge and in worshipping Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In the Day of Judgement, God will not attend the one who collects his dress (from people) out of vanity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In the Day of Judgement, God will not cast a look at the one who has committed adultery with his neighbor's wife, will not make him purified, and will order him to enter Hell with Hell-dwellers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In the Day of Judgement, people are first called to account concerning blood (shed).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In the Day of Judgement, the Exalted God addresses man, saying: O son of Adam! I got sick, but to Me you didn't pay a visit! Man asks, How could I visit You, Lord of the worlds? God says: Don't you remember that such and such a servant of me was sick, but you didn't visit him? Had you visited him, you would have met Me with him. Then, God continues, O son of Adam! I requested you to give me food, but you didn't do what you could! Man asks, How could I offer food to You, Lord of the worlds ? God says: Don't you remember that such and such a servant of Me asked you for food, but to him you were rude? Had you offered him food, with Me you would have found it. Then, God continus, O son of Adam! I demanded you to give me water, but you hesitated to offer! Man asks, How could I give water to You, Lord of the worlds? God says: Don't you remember that such and such a servant of Me asked you for water, but you refused to offer ? Had you offered him water, with Me you would have found it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In the Day of Judgment, all affluent people will wish to have only possessed their daily bread in worldly life.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In the Day of Judgment, God will forgive a leader who forgives (people) in anger.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In the Day of Judgment, God will surely avoid saving the one who has frightened a believer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In the Day of Judgment, judges would experience an hour when they would wish for not having had judged between two persons even on a date.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In the Resurrection, a caller will call out, saying, whoever has done something for anyone other than God, should ask him for reward.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In the sight of God, seeking knowledge is superior to prayer, fasting, pilgrimage to Mecca, and jihad (struggling in the way of God, the Greatest and the most Powerful).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In usury, both parties are equally sinful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: In whatever state one dies, in the same way will God resurrect him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Increase in knowledge with lack of increase in reluctance to the world results in one's further remoteness from God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Inform the rulers of the needs of those who cannot do so, for whoever performs such an action will be granted steadfast feet by God to pass over the Bridge in the Day of Resurrection.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Insulting a Muslim is wickedness, fighting him is blasphemy, and his wealth is as worthy as his blood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Is there anybody to walk on water without getting wet? That's why a man of the world will not be safe from sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Islam (submission to God) is an overt (phenomenon), but faith is (hidden) in heart.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Islam is based on the following five (pillars): bearing witness that there is no god but Allah and Muhammad (P. B. U. H.) is His Messenger, setting up prayer, paying the poor due, making pilgrimage to Mecca and keeping fast in the month of Ramadan.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Islam is clean (pure). Be clean, therefore, for nobody will be allowed to Paradise save the clean people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Islam is superior (to all things) and nothing will take precedence over it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It happens that a servant (of God) commits a sin, but he is given entrance to Paradise for he minds it time and again and remains penitent thereof.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is a capital treachery to tell your brother (in faith) something that he takes as truth, while it's not.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is a right for a child that his father should choose him a good name, provide him with good opportunities and teach him the best acts of civility.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is a right for a man that his wife should avoid keeping away from his bed, should act upon his promises, should obey his orders, should avoid leaving his house without his permission, and should avoid inviting to his house those whom he dislikes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is a right for a man that his wife should avoid keeping fast without his permission, excepting obligatory fasting; otherwise, she will be sinful and her fasts unacceptable, that she should avoid donating of his property anything to anybody without his permission; otherwise, she will be sinful and the husband will be rewarded for that, and that she should avoid leaving his house without his permission (though he is a cruel man); otherwise, God and the angels of wrath will curse her until she returns home or repents.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is a right for a son that his father should choose him a good name, help him marry as he matures and teach him (the skill of) writing.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is a right for a son that his father should teach him (the skills of) writing, shooting and swimming, feed him with good (lawful) food and help him marry when he gets mature.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is a right for a woman that her husband should share with her what he eats, should clothe her as he clothes himself, should avoid slapping her on the face and slandering her, and should avoid leaving her alone save in his own house.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is allowed to amuse oneself with training one's horse, shooting with one's bow and jesting with one's spouse.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is as if those other than us had to follow the truth, as if death were only destined for other than us, and as if the dead whose funeral procession we witness (everyday) were travelers who would soon return to us, for we bury their bodies and divide their wealth as if we would be immortal after them. We have (in fact) connived at all admonitions and feel that we are safe against all events.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is better for a man to give a Dirham in charity in his lifetime than to give a hundred Dirhams at the verge of death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is better for a man to train his child well than to give a handful (of food) in charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is better for a man's mind to be filled with infection than with poetry.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is better for a woman to pray in a room (of her house) than in the veranda, to pray in the veranda than in the yard, and to pray in the yard than in the mosque.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is better for any one of you to take in a piece of earth than to take in unlawful things.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is better to nail on your head than to touch a woman not legitimate for you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is blasphemy to dispute about the Quran.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is clear what is lawful and what is unlawful. Thus, keep distance with what you doubt about, and stick to what you don't.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is hard for God to put to Hell a Muslim servant who has lost two daughters.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is not abstinence to abandon the lawful or to waste one's wealth. Abstinence, in fact, lies in trusting not what you possess more than what God possesses, and in being more desirous for its (eternal) reward when calamity befalls than for its non- occurrence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is not good for a believer to belittle himself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is not telling lie to bear tales intending to make two persons rejoin.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is not your enemy whose murder by you brings you prosperity, and your murder by him brings you Paradise; rather, your worst enemy is (perhaps) your own child and the wealth you have earned.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is of humility to associate with the needy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is permissible to backbite the one who tears off the screen of chastity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is quite probable that envy (evil eye) overcome fate.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is the right of a neighbor to pay him a visit in sickness, to attend his funeral procession, to lend him money in times of need, to congratulate him in happiness, to console him in sadness and to avoid constructing your building higher than his, lest you should block up the wind blowing to his house.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is undesirable for a ruler to accept gifts, and blasphemous for a judge to do so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It is unlawful for the men of my people, but not for women, to dress themselves in silk and gold.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It may happen that a man beseeches the Exalted God to settle his need, but He does not grant his request on account of a reason and thus, he charges people of being unjust to him, saying, who has taken away my share?
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It may happen that a man is raised in Paradise, and on asking how this happened, he will be told, Your son has asked forgiveness for you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It may happen that a man or a woman worships (obeys) God, the Exalted, for sixty years, but at the time of death, he doesn't act properly concerning his (her) testament and thus, Hell will be indispensable for him (her).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It may happen that a man performs deeds, which seem heavenly to others, but he is, in fact, a dweller of Hell, and it may happen that a man performs deeds, which seem hellish to others, but he is, in fact, a dweller of Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It may happen that a man performs heavenly deeds for a long time but his deeds end up with those of the dwellers of Hell, and it may happen that a man does hellish deeds for a long time but his deeds end up with those of the dwellers of Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It may happen that a servant (of God) gives a loaf of bread in charity but it turns out to be great as Ohod to God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It may happen that one of you is used to performing heavenly deeds so that there remains only a cubit between him and Paradise, but (suddenly) his fate outruns his deeds and he commits a hellish deed which earns him Hell, and it may happen that one of you is used to performing hellish deeds so that there remains only a cubit between him and Hell, but (suddenly) his fate outruns his deeds and he commits a heavenly deed which earns him Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It was quite probable that poverty end in blasphemy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It was quite probable that the patient be appointed to prophethood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It will be sufficient for a man if the Exalted God know his dissatisfaction as to what he sees indecent but is unable to change.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: It would be much better for one to give a penny in health (in the way of God) than to emancipate a salve at the point of death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Jealousy eats away good deeds just as fire eats away firewood, and charity puts out (the flames of) sins just as water puts out fire.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Jealousy ruins (one's) faith Just as aloe decays honey.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Jesus, son of Mary beheld a man stealing (something). Did you steal anything?, he asked him. No, by the God save Him no god exists. The man retorted. I believe in God and my eyes have erred. Jesus asserted.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Jins will not make idiot those who have horses of noble birth at home.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Join the one who has renounced you, do good to the one who has deprived you and forgive the one who has oppressed you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Join the one who has renounced you, do good to the one who has wronged you and tell the truth, though it might be against you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Joining a servant's meal shows one's humility.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Joking is not allowed in the following three: divorce, marriage, and emancipation of slaves.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Justice is good but it's better with rulers, generosity is good but it's better with the rich, abstinence is good but it's better with the learned, patience is good but it's better with the poor, penitence is good but it's better with the youth, and chastity is good but it's better with women.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keen is the one who rules over his (evil) soul and makes provisions for the Hereafter, and weak is the one who obeys his carnal desires and asks God for (unrealizable) longings.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep away form the unlawful to be the most (obedient) servant of God, and be convinced with your destined share to be needless of all people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep away from a leprous as you do from a wild animal. Should he settle somewhere, you do settle somewhere else.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep away from oppression, for it will bring (you) darkness in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep away from the (material) world and women, for Satan lies is ambush in all mastery, and none of his traps is more reliable than women to hunt holders of piety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep away from the slips of an scholar, for it will cause him fall into the Fire.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep away from the world (materiality), for I swear by Him who has authority over my soul that it is more sorcerous than Gog and Magog.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep close connections with your relatives even through greeting.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep company with good people, for if you do good, they will praise you, and if you do evil, they will not be hard on you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep company with people for (the sake of) their good manners, and keep distance with them for (evil) deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep company with the hungry and learned men, for wisdom flows out through their tongues.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep fast and be healthy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep harms away from Muslim's path.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep silent when you get angry.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep up with good deeds, for it saves you from bad falls, and give covert alms, for it puts out the wrath of God, the Greatest and the most Powerful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep your hands under control.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep your relationship with your father intact and do not cut it off; otherwise, God will make your (spiritual) light vanish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep your tongue under control.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keep yourself intact by being suspicious about people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keeping company is void with the one who avails you no worldly or otherworldly gain, and do not observe respect for the one who is not respectful to you, and there is no greatness for such a person.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keeping disasters, diseases and alms in secret is among the treasures of goodness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Keeping silent is better than dictating evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Kindness requires the following three: self- sacrifice, using good words, and tolerating (others') bothering.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Kindness to parents is tantamount to struggling in the way of God (Jihad).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Kindness to parents prolongs one's life, telling lie reduces one's sustenance and praying wards off (bad) accidents.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Kindness will not fade away, badness will in the minds stay, and the Just God will not die. Do, therefore, what you can do, for the like of it will be given back to you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Kinship hangs from heavens, saying, God will extend His bond to whoever keeps me intact, and disconnects His link with whoever severs me
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Kinship is a divine link. Whoever keeps it intact, will enjoy God's bond, and whoever severs it, will lose it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Kinship will have a tongue in the Day of Judgment, saying, O God! Whoever cut me off, cut him off, and whoever kept me intact, keep him intact(today).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Know for sure that anger is a fire burning in man's heart. Don't you see the redness of his eyes and the inflammation of his veins when he is cross. When one of you happens to experience such a feeling, you should better take a sitting position.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Know for sure that people are Adam's offspring, and Adam was created from soil. Verily, the most honored of them are the most virtuous.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Know for sure that Satan is the third party to the illegitimate privacy of a man and a woman.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Know for sure that sons of Adam have been created into different classes: some are born believers, living and dying as believers; some are born disbelievers, living and dying as disbelievers; and some are born disbelievers, living as disbelievers but dying as believers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Know people by knowing their friends, for men love the like of themselves.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Know that in man's body there is a lump of flesh which corrupts or rectifies the whole body, being it corrupt or rectified respectively. That is man's heart.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Know that the best businessman is the one who is good both in paying debts and demanding credits, and the worst is the one who is bad in both. If a man is good in the former but bad in the latter or vice versa, that is something in its own right.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Know that the best of men is the one who becomes enraged hardly and gets pleased easily, and the worst of them is the one who gets pleased hardly and become enraged easily. If a man hardly becomes enraged and hardly gets pleased or easily becomes enraged and easily gets pleased, that is something in its own right.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Know that those who will reside in Paradise climb a hard rocky mountainous road (in this world), and those who will dwell in Hell tread an easy path on the steeps of a non- mountainous land.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowing your faults should stop you recounting people's faults. Control your tongue, save for well- wishing, for this can make you defeat Satan.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge and the learned dwell in Paradise and thus, if the learned do not act upon their knowledge, action and knowledge will in Paradise dwell, and the learned in Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge and wealth keep all faults covert, but ignorance and poverty make them overt.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge is a believer's friend, fortitude being his minister, intellect being his guide, action being his leader, moderateness being his father, kindness being his brother, and patience being the commander of his army.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge is a believer's lost one. Whenever he learns a bit of it, he demands another.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge is acquired through learning and forbearance is achieved through practicing it. Whoever seeks good will be offered good and whoever fears evil will be saved from it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge is better than deed, and the best of all deeds is a moderate one.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge is of three kinds: a manifest book, a practiced tradition and I don't know.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge is of two kinds: the one lying in man's heart, i.e. beneficial knowledge, and the one being on (the tip of) one's tongue and, thus, being God's proof for Adam's sons.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge is superior to deed, religion is founded on abstinence, and a (true) scholar is he who practices what he knows.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge is superior to worship, and abstinence is the basis of religion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge is the heritage of me and my predecessors (in prophethood).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge is the spirit of Islam and the pillar of faith, and God will give perfect reward to he who acquires some sort of knowledge, and if he happens to practice it, He will let him know what heknows not.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge is treasures, and the key to them is asking. So, question to gain God's Mercy, for God rewards four groups in so far as knowledge is concerned: seekers of knowledge, teachers, listeners, and those who love the first three groups.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge should not be stopped (being learned or taught)
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge without use is like unto a treasure untouched.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Knowledge without use is like unto untouched treasure. For everything there is a poor- rate, and for the body, fasting.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Lambs are blessings (of God.)
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Laughing is of two kinds- that which God likes, i.e. a man's smiling at his brother's face out of pleasure to see him, and that which the Exalted God dislikes, i.e. a man's saying something false or unjust to laugh or make people laugh and thus, falling to Hell for seventy autumns.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Learn shooting and horsemanship, but I love you shoot more than ride on horseback. Whatever makes you busy is idle, save shooting an arrow, training your horse or playing with your wives. All these are among your rights, and whoever abandons shooting after having learned it, is guilty of ingratitude to his teacher.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Learn whatever you like, for God will not let you avail yourself of your knowledge unless you put it to practice.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Learning in childhood is like unto carving (something) on stone, and learning in old age resembles writing on water.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Learning knowledge, putting it to practice and teaching it to others is a form of charity for man.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Leave people on their own, (for) God bestows sustenance on some through others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Leave the world to the secular, (for) whoever takes of the world beyond his need, is unknowingly ruining himself (indeed).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Leave the world to the seekers of the world, for those who pick up from it beyond their need, are surely trying to ruin themselves, but they know it not, indeed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Leaving a receiver of daily bread on his own suffices to make the provider sinful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Lending something is better than giving it in charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Lending something twice is better than giving it in charity once.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Leniency decorates its host but degrades it, taking distance with it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Leniency leads to covetousness, and severity to inauspiciousness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Let me inform you of people's affairs and manners: He who is quickly raised to anger but quickly cools down is neither good nor bad, he who is hardly raised to anger and quickly cools down is good not bad, he who claims his rights and pays his debts is neither good nor bad, and he who claims his rights but postpones securing people's rights is bad, not good.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Let not people's awe make you ignore the observance of the rights you know about.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Let not the signs of the kind appear in you, without yourself being kind; for you'll be a company to hypocrites (in the Hereafter).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Let people avail themselves of one another, and when one of you counsels his brother, to him should the latter his views offer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Let water flow amiss your fingers in ablution so that God might keep Fire from flowing there.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Let your fellow travelers be lucky, well- to- do people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Let your time- aged friendship continue, for God the Exalted loves this continuation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Light- minded is the one who makes his (her) guest serve him (her).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Light up lanterns early in the morning, for it brings you the greatest of rewards.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Little (wealth) for which one can thank (God) is better than a lot for which one falls short in so doing.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Live as a stranger or wayfarer in this world, and see yourself among the dwellers of graves.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Live as guests in this world, consider mosques as your houses, make your hearts accustomed to leniency, think and bewail a lot, and try to be not deviated by carnal desires. Many a building you make wherein you will not reside, many a kind of food stuff you prepare which you will not be able to eat, and many a yearning you have which you will not be able to realize!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Live as long as you wish, for you will finally perish, love whoever wants your heart, for from him you'll finally depart, and do whatever you wish to do, for it will finally come back to you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Loneliness is better than having a bad companion, and a good companion is better than loneliness. Uttering good words is better than silence, and silence is better than uttering bad words.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Longing for people's praise blinds one's eyes and deafens one's ears.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Look at the graves (of men) and from the resurrection (of the dead) learn a lesson.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Look at those who are lower that you (in material possessions), not at those who are higher, and thus you (can) better appreciate God's blessings.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Look! You are not superior to the black or red in anything but piety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Looking (dispassionately) at beautiful women and at green grass strengthens eyesight.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Looking at the bright side of everything comes from proper worshipping.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Looking at the letter of one's brother without his permission is looking at Hell indeed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Lose your modesty and do whatever you want to.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Loser is the one in whose heart the Exalted God has not placed sympathy towards other human beings.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Loving a servant, God deprives him (her) of the world, just as you deprive your patients of drinking water.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Loving a servant, God puts him (her) to test to see him (her) supplicating.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Loving a servant, God puts him (her) to test, and loving him (her) more, He chooses the servant for Himself. How ? the people demanded. The Holy Prophet replied: By leaving him(her) without property and heir.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Loving a servant, God throws His love for him in the angels' hearts, and detesting him, He sets His hatred in their hearts as well as in men's hearts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Lustful music makes hypocrisy in one's heart show, just as water makes sown seeds grow.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Lying darkens one's face, and tale bearing entails chastisement in the grave.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Make a pilgrimage to Mecca, needlessness to gain; and travel, healthy to remain.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Make friends with each other and rectify yourselves. Whatever happens to a Muslim is a kind of atonement, even if he is afflicted with disaster or hurt by a thorn pricked into his foot.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Make friends with your but do not live in their neighborhood, for it causes grudge among you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Make greeting open, and bonds of friendship strengthen.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Make the most of an afflicted believer's supplications.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Make the most of four things before four others: Youth before old age, health before illness, richness before poverty and life before death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Make the most of supplication in times of tender- heartedness, for it gives rise to (God's) grace.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Make the most of your chances to do good deeds before a time when sedition comes to pass as gloomy as parts of dark nights, when man happens to be a believer in the morning but a disbeliever in the evening and vice versa, and when he exchanges his faith for the insignificant worldly fame.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Make the most of your chances to do good deeds prior to the occurrence of the following six: the rule of the ignorant, the trade of ranks and positions, belittlement of bloodshed, breaking bonds of kinship, the recitation of the Quran by the newcomers (in religion) who appoint a singer to imamate (leadership), though he is the least in understanding the religion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Make your food cold to bring you bliss (health).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Make your minds accustomed to the remembrance of God, and meditate a lot.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Make your world thrive, and for the other world in such a way try as if tomorrow you would die.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Making friends with your father's friend is a form of kindness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man does not fill up anything worse than his stomach.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man does not satiate anything worse than his belly (stomach). For sons of Adam, that which keeps them strong (and healthy) would suffice.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man follows the creed of his fellows, and thus you should see the friend of whom to be.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man follows the path of his friend's religion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man has a kind of wisdom in his head, supervised by an angel. Showing humility, the angel is ordered to lift it up and showing vanity, he is ordered to let it fall.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man is a company to what he loves.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man is in line with his friends, and the result of his deeds to them he sends.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man should help his brother, being he oppressed or an oppressor. If he is an oppressor, the former should prevent him from oppression, for this is in itself assisting him; and if he is oppressed the, former should help him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man should not sit between someone and his son in a meeting.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man should save something from himself for himself, from this world for the next, from youth before old age, and from this life before death, for there will be no dwelling save Heaven and Hell beyond this world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man will be under the shield of his charitable acts until he is judged among people (in the Day of Judgement).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man will see a day when all people would be involved in usury; and if not, they would at least be affected by its results.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man will see a day when people will not care for the way to earn money- lawfully or unlawfully!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man's beauty lies in his eloquence of speech.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man's beauty lies in his tongue.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man's deeds are presented to God on Mondays and Thursdays, and to prophets and parents on Fridays. They rejoice by (their children's) good deeds and turn brighter in their faces. Fear God, therefore, and hurt not your dead ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man's deeds are presented to the Exalted God on Mondays and Thursdays, and He forgives all sins save the sins of belligerent people and those who break bonds of kinship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man's dress shows his riches, fragrant oil makes poverty disappear, and benevolence to (one's) subjects causes God to put (your) enemy to shame.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man's faith lies in his wisdom and thus, whoever is devoid of wisdom is bereft of faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man's greatness, fairness, and dignity lie respectively in (the extent of) his faith, thought and manners.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man's heart is like unto a king with soldiers. Being good, its soldiers will turn out to be good too and being corrupted, they will be likewise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man's is not hurt, but with his own hand.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man's request will not be rejected in three places: in a desert where nobody but God witnesses him standing to prayer, in war where all his companions escape but he stands steadfast, and at midnight when he rises up to pray (to God).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man's soul will always be hanging on his debt (after death) till it's repaid.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man's stability lies in his wisdom, and whoever is bereft of wisdom is devoid of faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man's word is entirely to his loss not benefit, unless it is used for bidding to good and forbidding evil or for remembering the Exalted God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Manliness requires a Muslim to listen to the words of his brother (in faith) when he speaks to him, and proper companionship requires a Muslim to stop going when his brother (in faith) has a torn off shoe- lace stopping him to move.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Man's nature demands brushing his teeth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Many a dusty disheveled people who possess nothing but two ragged pieces of dress, unpleasant in people's sight, whose swears will work, should they swear by God!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Many a fast person whose fasting avails them naught but hunger, and many a worshiper at night whose prayers avail them naught but vigilance!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Many a holder of knowledge who are not deeply knowledgeable! He whose knowledge is of no avail to him, will suffer from his ignorance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Many a man are satiated and pleased here but will be hungry and naked (poor) in the Hereafter, and many a man are hungry and naked here, but will be satiated and pleased in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Many a man are there who arrive at a day which ends without them or await a tomorrow which never begins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Many a man are there who experience humiliation through glorifying themselves, and many a man are there who experience honor by showing humility.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Many a man are there whose vigilance at night avails them naught but wakefulness, and many a man are there whose fasting during the day avails them naught but thirst and hunger.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Many a pious person who are ignorant, and many a learned person who are corrupt. Beware of them both!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Many a time an hour of indulging in lust has resulted in prolong sorrow!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Many a wise person who are held in contempt and are ugly in face, but will be saved, and many an eminent, beautiful and sweet- tongued person who will be ruined in the Day of Judgement .
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Many a worshiper at night whose prayers avail them naught but vigilance, and many a fast person whose fasting avails them naught but hunger and thirst!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Many an unfast, but grateful person who will be rewarded more than fast, patient people!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Markets are the worst places of cities.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Marry but don't divorce (your wife), for verily the Divine Throne shudders (with anger) when divorce occurs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Marry kind, fertile women, for I pride myself over other prophets for the largeness of your population.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Marry women of equal status, and give in marriage (your daughters) to men of equal status with you, thus choosing the appropriate place for your sperms.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God bless a father who gives his child a hand in being kind to him (i.e. his father).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God bless the eyes, which shed tears out of fear of God, and bless the eyes, which keep awake for God's sake.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God bless those who control their tongues, know their time, and walk in the straight path.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God curse three persons: the one who eats his (her) provision alone, the one who rides (on a horse) in a desert alone, and the one who sleeps in a house alone.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God damn (curse) the one who makes separation between a mother and her child or between two brothers!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God damn a woman who calls her husband to bed but by denying him immediate sex causes him to fall asleep.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God damn a woman who dresses up like men and a man who dresses up like women.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God damn both sides of a usury affair as well as the one who writes the contract for it, and damn the one who blocks the way to charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God damn mohallels and those for whom someone plays the role of a mohallel.[1]
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God damn the giver and receiver of bribe, as well as the mediator between them!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God damn the giver of bribe as well as its receiver.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God damn the one who makes his face! [1] In Islam, when a man divorces his wife three times he is not allowed to remarry her unless a second person marries the divorced woman for a certain period of time. The second man is called mahallel.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God damn the slaves of Dirhams and Dinars.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God damn usury and usurers as well as the writer of a usury contract and the witness to it, should they be aware (of it's being unlawful).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God damn wine as well as the drinker, the cupbearer, the vendor and the purchaser of wine and the presser of date or grape as well as the carrier and recipient of wine and those who benefit by it in money.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God damn women who behave like men, and men who behave like women.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God damn women who behave like men, and men who behave like women.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God damn women who behave like men.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God help the one who hears a word of ours and communicates it to others as it is.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God help the one who hears a word of ours, keeps it in his mind and communicates it to others. Many a carrier of knowledge who carry it to someone more learned than themselves, and many a carrier of knowledge who are themselves not learned.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God provide you with piety, wash away your vices, and bring good to you easily wherever you may happen to be.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God shower His mercy on those among my people who brush their teeth when making ablutions, and after meals.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God shower His mercy on those who are easy- going in selling, buying, judging and asking for the payment of debts?
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God shower his Mercy on those who hear us saying something, keep it in their own minds and convey it to those better than them in that.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God shower His mercy on those who lawfully earn, moderately spend, and what remains, to the day of poverty and need (the Day of Reckoning) in advance they send.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God shower His mercy on those who oppress their brethren in so far as their respect or wealth are concerned, but happen to meet them with the request of forgiveness err they are called to account, for then if they will possess no Dirham and Dinar (with which to expiate their oppression), their good deeds (if any) will be taken away from them, and the oppressed's evil deeds will be loaded on them if they are devoid of any good deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God shower His mercy on those who utter good words and thereby receive good, or stop uttering bad words and thus ensure their (own) safety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God shower his Mercy on those who withhold the excess of their words, but spend the excess of their wealth (in the way of God).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May God shower His mercy on well- speaking people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: May the sunrise of a day be not blessed for me when I fail to acquire the knowledge which might draw me nearer to God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Measure (your) friend by his friend.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Mediation between two persons in marital affairs is among the best forms of mediations.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Medicines are the Exalted God's destined creatures, and only with His permission they exert their effects.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Meditate on anything, save God's nature.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Meditate on creatures, but not on the Creator, for you will face failure in understanding His nature.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Meditate on God's blessings, but not on His nature.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Meditate on God's creatures but not on His nature, for you will perish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Meditate on what you do. Should it end in good, let it continue; but let it cease, if a source of worry it will be to you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Men's hearts naturally like those who do good to them and dislike those who do evil to them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Mendacity of tongue is one of the greatest sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Mention not (the names of) three persons: a man who has kept distance with people disobeyed his leader and died in that disobedience, a slave (man or woman) who has escaped from his master and died thereof, and a woman whose absent husband pays her expenses, but beautifies herself (for others) in his absence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Mentioning God's blessings is thankfulness (to Him) and abandoning it is ungratefulness, and whoever is ungrateful to little will be as such to great (blessings), and whoever is thankless to people is thankless to God. Unity brings good and discord, agony.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Might does not lie in fight (wrestling), but in keeping cool when wrathful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Mind your mother, your mother, your mother, then mind your father and then, your close relatives.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Mind! everyone of you has a greater liking for the wealth she (he) inherits than for that of his (her) own. Your wealth is what you send forth, and your heir's wealth is what you leave behind.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Mind! patience is coupled with victory, pain with relief and hardship with ease.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Mind! the pen of fate has recorded all possible things.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Mind! what has occurred to you was destined to occur to you, and what hasn't, was not.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Mind, people cannot grant you anything if God doesn't wish so, and they cannot spare you anything if God wishes the reverse. Thus, offer your requests to God and ask Him for help.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Misers won't be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Moderateness in living (livelihood) shows man's deep knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Moderateness in spending (money) is on half of sustenance, friendship with people is one half of wisdom and asking questions properly is one half of knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Moderateness in spending (money) is one half of sustenance and good- temperedness, one half of faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Moderateness is beneficial to any household upon which it is bestowed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Moderateness stands at the peak of one's intellect, and the benevolent of the world will be the benevolent of the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Moderation to people is (an act of) charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Modesty and good- temperedness form the basis of one's intellect, besides believing in God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Mosques are the homes of all the virtuous.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Most people face loss in two blessings: good health and peace of mind.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Mourning (for the dead) is an act of ignorance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Move in the early morning to seek your sustenance and settle your needs, for early rising brings felicity and blessing.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Moving in the way of God in early morning or at night is better than the world and whatever belongs to it, and the ark of the bow of anyone of you and his footprint in Paradise are better than the world and whatever belongs to it. If a woman among heavenly women moves toward the earth, she will fill up the distance between heavens and the earth with her pleasant perfume, and her veil is better than the world and whatever belongs to it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Muslims are a unified hand against others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Muslims are bound to their promises as long as they agree with truth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Muslims are brothers (in faith). None is superior to others, save for piety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Muslims are mirrors of one another. When one of them sees something good in the mirror, he acts upon it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: My (Islamic) nation will experience a time with the largest number of the poor and the least number of the learned (in religious jurisprudence), when knowledge decreases and sedition increases. Then they will see a time when some men of my nation recite the Quran, but it won't rise beyond their very throats (i.e. it won't affect their minds). They will still see a time when polytheists argue with the believers, using the same words (and reasoning) as they do.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: My eyes fall asleep, but my heart doesn't.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: My God damn (curse) the one who curses his parents.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: My intercession belongs to the noblemen of my people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: My people are like unto rain whose beginning and ending benefits nobody can explain (foresee).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: My people will not be called to account for mistake, oblivion and helplessness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Narrating whatever you have heard suffices to show your mendacity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Needlessness does not in abundance lie; on needless souls does it rely.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Needlessness lies in being hopeless of what people possess, and whoever walks in the way of greed, should slow his speed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Neighborhood extends to forty houses.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Neighbors have priority (to others) in buying their neighbors' houses.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Never leave your job for tomorrow, for each day has it's own share.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Never long for death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Never will God put to Fire the flesh of a servant to whom He has given good countenance and character.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: New dresses wear, and good fame (try to) bear.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nice hair is one of the two beauties God bestows on a Muslim.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nice handwriting adds to the clarity of truth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No act of worship is superior to acquiring deep knowledge in religion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No believer is allowed to look harshly at his brother (in faith), bothering him thereof.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No body loves being praised more than God, and nobody accepts excuses more than Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No charity is superior to people's diffusion of knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No charity weighs over remembering the Exalted God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No combination is better than that of knowledge and patience.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No deed will be heavier in man's scale (of deeds) than good- temperedness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No drink is superior to God than a sip of anger a servant of God drinks to please Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No expiation can make up for the following five sins, and faithless is the one who lacks any single one of them: surrendering to the will of God, being pleased with His decrees, leaving one's affairs to Him, relying on Him, and keeping patient when one first faces a disaster.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No good can you find in the company of the one who does not count himself equal to you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No good deed is of any benefit if coupled with the following sins: taking a partner with God, displeasing one's parents and escaping from battlefield.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No good is there in the company of the one who does not observe the rights you do for him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No good is there in the one who does not invite guests.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No good is there in the wealth without loss and in the flesh without pain.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No grief is like unto that of debt, and no pain is like unto that of eyes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No humility and no piety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No joy can escape being followed by grief.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No man will sit with a woman in privacy, unless Satan is the third party to them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No matter if the pious is wealthy, but piety is better for them than riches, and peace of mind is among (God's) blessings.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No migration will be there after the conquest (of Mecca).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No Muslim is allowed to encroach upon another Muslim's possessions including his blood, fame and wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No Muslim is allowed to encroach upon other Muslims' blood, fame and wealth. Belittling a Muslim brother suffices (to show) one's evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No obedience to God fruits in quicker reward than observing bonds of kinship, and no disobedience to Him results in quicker punishment than oppression.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one achieves the state of virtue unless he connives at the permissible, out of fear for the impermissible.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one achieves true faith unless he comes to know that both what he gains and what he doesn't are predestined for him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one achieves true faith unless he controls his tongue.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one but the wicked are deprived of (God's) mercy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one can gain anything better than the knowledge leading its holder to guidance or saving him from danger, and no one's faith gets perfected unless his wisdom is improved.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one is allowed to put himself into trouble in serving his guests.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one is deprived of the world (secular benefits) without being rewarded in good.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one is more capable of making a living than others, for God has predestined calamity, death, business and sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one is more superior to God than a leader who tells the truth when speaking, and administers justice
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one is superior to others save for faith and good deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one is to wish for death when suffering (something).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one is to wish for death, for if you are on the right path, your good might increase, and if you are astray, you might go the way of salvation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one of my people is there to look kindly after three daughters or three sisters of his, unless God will keep him intact from Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one of you will be perfect in true faith unless he controls his tongue.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one oppresses people, save the son of adultery or the one with a hue of it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one should reject his brother's gift; rather, he should compensate for it, if possible.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one will be afflicted with calamity in this world, save in lieu of a sin he has committed, and God is too generous to call him to account for that very sin in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one will eat anything better than what he has himself earned. Verily, David (the Messenger of God) ate what he himself earned.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No one will perish out of counseling with others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No people will fall to deviation after having been guided unless they get into constant dispute among themselves.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No reward for a Muslim is greater than that of a qualified minister who obeys a king and makes him obey God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No servant (of God) is a (true) believer unless he wishes for his Muslim brother what he does for himself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No sin is (counted) capital with deprecation, and no sin is venial with insistence (to commit it repeatedly).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No trustworthiness, and no companionship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No wealth of a father for his child is better than courtesy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: No wealth will decrease through charity, and no one will sustain a loss through abandoning sins; rather will God make his dignity increase.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nobody becomes unlucky for consultation and lucky for obstinacy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nobody belongs to me save the knowledgeable and the seekers of knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nobody has ever suffered as me in the way of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nobody hoards (goods), save a wrongdoer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nobody is allowed to abandon the following three: kindness to parents, being them Muslims or non- Muslims, keeping one's promise for Muslims and non- Muslims, and returning Muslims' deposits.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)
