quotes.quote: Nobody is allowed to obey (others) in disobedience of God. Obedience is only (permissible) in good deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nobody is more zealous than God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: None of you is a (true) believer unless he wishes for his brother what he does for himself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nothing as Hell do I know with its haters not being negligent, and nothing as Paradise do I know with its lovers not being asleep!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nothing can bring a servant of God more proximity to Him than hidden (private) prostration.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nothing can ward off one's predestined fate save praying, and nothing can prolong one's life save benevolence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nothing has been left of Prophethood, save the givers of good tidings, i.e. true dreams.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nothing is better than feeding a hungry stomach.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nothing is more beloved to the Exalted God than the penitent youth, and nothing is more hated by Him than the aged indulged in their sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nothing is more entitled to be imprisoned than (man's) tongue.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nothing is more favorable to God than a sip of anger or a sip of patience one drinks, and no drop is more favorable to God than a drop of tear dripped out of fear of God or a drop of blood shed for the cause of Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nothing is more favorable to the Exalted God than a sip of anger one drinks, and He will load with faith the heart of whoever does so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nothing is worthier than a believer to the Exulted God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nothing is worthier to God than praying.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nothing ruins Islam as much as miserliness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nothing save man is better than a thousand like himself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nothing will be easy unless one takes it easy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Nothing will be heavier than good temper in one's Balance of deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! Add something to us and reduce not (anything) from us, keep us in honor and make us not humiliated, bestow (something) on us and deprive us not of (anything), give us superiority (to others) and subject us not to others' superiority, and make us pleased and be pleased with us.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! Be hard on the leaders who are hard on my people, and treat with moderation those leaders who treat my people in like manner.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! Beautify my temper as You beautified my face.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! befriend me to put up with the pains and agonies of death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! Enrich me with knowledge, adorn me with forbearance, endear me with piety and beautify me with health.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! expand Your sustenance for me in old age and last days of my life.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! forgive my sins, expand my house and bestow your blessing on my sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! forgive my sins, grant me expansion in my house and give me abundance in sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! forgive my sins, ignorance, prodigality and what you know of me better than I do. O God! Forgive my intentional and non- intentional slips, my serious and non- serious acts (and sayings) and all my faults. O God! Forgive my past and future sins and my overt and covert ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! Grant me health of body, ears and eyes. O God! I take refuge in You from poverty and blasphemy and from the chastisement in grave. There is no god but You.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! Grant me two tearful eyes to cure my heart through tears shed out of your fear, before tears turn into blood and teeth into fire.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! grant us a good ending in all affairs, and save us from humiliation here and chastisement in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I beseech you to grant me guidance, virtue, chastity and needlessness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I beseech You to grant me health coupled with faith, faith coupled with good- temperedness and safety accompanied by prosperity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I beseech You to grant me the good which I know and which I know not, and I take refuge in You from the evil which I know and I know not.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I swear you by Your unseen knowledge and Your power in creation to keep me alive as long as You see life to my good and make me die as long as You see death to my good. O God! I beseech You to grant me the fear of You in public and privacy, to bestow on me sincere exprssion in pleasure and displeasure (anger), and to confer on me moderation in richness and poverty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I take refuge in You from a bad neighbor in my permanent abode, for the neighbor of desert will soon change place.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I take refuge in You from a deceitful friend, whose eyes watch me out and whose heart is on the track of me, seeing good, he will hide it and discovering evil, he will spread it out.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I take refuge in You from bad morals, evil deeds, sinful desires and dangerous diseases.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I take refuge in You from excessive debts, the victory of enemies and the taunting of adversaries.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I take refuge in You from ill- omened days, nights and hours, from bad friends, and from undesirable neighbors in the permanent abode.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I take refuge in You from indolence, senility, transgression, debt, the blight and chastisement of Hell, the blight of indigence and that of affluence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I take refuge in You from poverty, indigence and abjectness, and from being oppressed or being an oppressor.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I take refuge in You from the decline of Your blessings, the reversal of health, Your sudden wrath, and all the things which give rise to Your dissatisfaction.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I take refuge in You from the knowledge with no use, the action not accepted and the prayer not granted.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I take refuge in You from the seditions of women and the chastisement in grave.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I take refuge in You from useless knowledge, immodest heart, prayers ungranted and the unquenchable soul. O God! I take refuge in you from the evil of these four (things).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I take refuge in You from vitiligo, insanity, leprosy and (all) bad diseases.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I take refuge in You from weakness, laziness, fear, misery, old age, hard- heartedness, negligence and indigence, I take refuge in You from poverty, infidelity, debauchery, hypocrisy, conflict and dissimulation, and I take refuge in You from deafness, dumbness, madness, leprosy, vitiligo and (all) bad diseases.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! I take refuge in You from weakness, laziness, fear, misery and old age, I take refuge in You from chastisement in the grave and punishment in Hell, and I take refuge in You from trials in life and in death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! improve my faith for it saves my affairs, improve my worldly life for in it my sustenance lies and improve my eternal life for towards it is my return. O God! conjoin my life with increase of the good, and my death with relief from all evils.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! Leave me not on my own for a twinkling of an eye, and deprive me not of the best of Your gifts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! Make early rising blessed for my nation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! make it up among us, unite our hearts, lead us to peace (of mind), guide us from darkness to wards light and save us from overt and covert indecencies. O God! bless our ears, eyes, hearts, wives and children and accept our repentance, for you are assuredly the Merciful one who accepts repentance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! Make me benefit from what You have taught me, teach me what is of benefit to me and increase my knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! make me fear You (in such a way) as if you were in my view. O God! grant me felicity through piety and spare me adversity due to disobeying Thee. O God! determine for me your (good) destiny and bless me with your decree, so that I would not like to ask you for a change in what you have put first or last. O God! enrich my soul.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! make me live a poor life, die a poor man and associate with the poor in the Hereafter. The most wretched of all the wretched is the one who conjoins worldly poverty with otherworldly punishment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! make me thankful, patient, insignificant in my own sight and great in people's.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! place me among those who feel happy when doing good and seek forgiveness when doing wrong.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! Provide us with such a fear (of You) that saves us from disobedience to You, such an obedience (of You) that entitles us to Paradise, and such a certainty that renders worldly disasters easy for us. (O God!) make us avail ourselves from our ears, eyes and power as long as You keep us alive and to the last moment of our life, avenge those who oppressed us, give us victory over our enemies, let not our calamities be those of our faith and our greatest sorrows be for worldly affairs, let not our knowledge end in materiality and the merciless our rulers be.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! save me through Islam in sleeping, sitting and standing (positions), and save me from the blames of the jealous and envious fellows. O God! I ask you to give me of all the good the treasures of which you keep and I take refuge in you of all the evils the treasures of which you hold.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God! You created my soul and You make it die- its life and death are Yours. If You keep it alive, save it and if You make it die, forgive it. O God! I beseech You to grant me health and safety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O God, Our Lord! Bestow upon us good here and good in the Hereafter, and save us from the torment of Fire.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O merchants! God will resurrect you among evil- doers in the Day of Judgment unless you tell the truth and are good trustees.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O my people! I am worried about you as to what you know not, but be careful about practicing what you know.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O people! Be moderate, be moderate; for verily, the Exalted God will not be fed up unless you are fed up.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O people! Do not attribute anything to me. I declared nothing as lawful or unlawful save what the Exalted God had ordered me.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O people! Fear God and be moderate in seeking your sustenance, for no one dies before receiving his sustenance in full, though late. So, fear God and be moderate in seeking your sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O people! Fear the Exalted God, for by Him I swear that He will avenge, in the Day of Judgement, any believer who oppresses another believer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O people! Verily, I am a human being who will meet the messenger of my Lord in near future and follow his call (i.e. die). I leave with you two grand things: the Book of God and my Household. The former abounds in light and guidance. Whoever grasps at it and discerns it, will be guided aright and whoever falls short in that, will go astray. So, grasp at the Exalted God's Book and (try to) discern it. As to the latter, I remind you of God! I remind you of God!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O people! What is narrated to you on my authority is mine if it accords with the Quran, and what is narrated to you on my authority is not mine if it is in discord with it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O people! Your Lord is one and your father is one. You are all sons of Adam, and Adam was created from soil. The most pious among you is verily the most worthy of honor to God. No Arab is superior to a Persian, save for virtue.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O poor people! If you knew about the saved things for you, you would not feel sad for what you lack now.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O poor people! If you knew what you have with God, you would like to fall into more poverty and need.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O servants of God! I advise you to prayers, for praying efficaciously affects what has already happened and what has not.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O son of Adam! Be obedient to your Lord to be considered wise, and refrain from disobedience to Him, not to be regarded unwise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O son of Adam! When you have health of body and peace of mind and your sustenance you easily find, what use of the (material) world to mind!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O son of Adam! You have at your disposal what suffices your needs, (but) continuously you seek what to rebellion in you leads! O son of Adam! You're not convinced with less, nor are you satiated with more!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: O sons of Ishmael! Practice shooting, for your father was an archer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Obedience to a creature is not allowed, if it's disobedience to the Creator.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Obedince to fathers is obedience to God, and disobedience to them is disobedience to Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Observe equality in gifting your children. Were I to give priority (on this respect), I would prefer women (i.e. daughters).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Observe God's (orders and prohibitions) to see Him ahead of you (as a guide).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Observe the rights of your slaves and share them in your own food and clothing. Should they commit sins you do not wish to forgive, sell them to (other) servants of God and stop torturing them thereof.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Observing the bonds of kinship leads to abundant wealth, affection among families and the postponement of death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Observing the bonds of kinship prolongs one's life and expels bad deaths.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Observing the bonds of kinship prolongs one's life, and hidden charity cools down God's wrath.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Observing the bonds of kinship, good- temperedness, and good neighborliness make lands flourish and prolong people's lives.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Of all people, the poorest (indeed), are holders of greed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Offer gifts to each other to enhance your friendship, migrate to leave glory for your heir and connive at the faults of your great ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Offer gifts to each other to strengthen your friendship, for gifts enhance love and make spite and hatred perish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Offer gifts to each other, for it doubles your friendship and makes pique perish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Offer gifts to each other, for it makes pique perish. Should I be invited to a party where lamb trotters are served, I will haste to it, and should that be gifted to me, I will accept it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Offer gifts to each other, for it makes pique perish; and do not consider a gift insignificant, even if it is a goat's trotters in half.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Old age spent for the cause of Islam, will bring man a (heavenly) light in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: One difficulty will not prevail over two reliefs, for Verily, with every difficulty there are two reliefs, and Verily, with every difficulty there are two reliefs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: One Dirham will be more valuable than one hundred thousand Dirhams when we compare two men, one of whom having only two Dirhams but giving one in charity, and the other having great wealth but giving one hundred thousand Dirhams of it in charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: One hour of (doing) justice is superior to one year of worshiping (God).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: One hour of a learned man, who rests in his bed, meditating about his knowledge is worthier than seventy years of praying by the pious.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: One night of being on the look- out in the way of God, the Great and Powerful, is better than one thousand nights of praying and one thousand days of keeping fast.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: One who fights his own self in obedience to God is a (true) struggler in the way of Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: One who insists on adultery is like unto an idolater.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: One who testifies to falsehood won't step in the road before God makes Hell his unavoidable abode.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: One who testifies to falsehood won't step in the road before God makes Hell his unavoidable abode.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: One's faith will not get perfected save by three characteristics: giving alms in poverty; doing justice even if it's against one's own self, and greeting (people) a lot.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: One's older brother is like unto his (her) father.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Oppression is (the source of) darkness in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Oppression ruins (the value of) bravery; self- pride ruins familial dignity; conferring favors spoils (the worth of) generosity; selfishness ruins (the value of) beauty; telling lie breaks (the validity of) speech; forgetfulness ruins knowledge; ignorance ruins fortitude; extravagance ruins generosity, and carnal desires ruin (one's) faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Our Lord laughs (amazingly) at His creatures' hopelessness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Out of mercy is shedding tears and out of Satan, shouting.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Paradise belongs to the penitent, and (Divine) Mercy to men of endowment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Paradise beneath mothers' steps lies.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Paradise buildings are made of gold and silver bricks, its clay is musk, its sand, pearl and ruby and its soil, saffron. Whoever arrives at it will enjoy its blessings forever, will be free from calamities, will live to eternity, never experiencing death, and will have unending youth and constantly- new dresses.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Paradise has a hundred levels, and each level is vast enough for the population of the whole universe.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Paradise has a hundred levels, and it takes five hundred years to cover the distance between each two levels.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Paradise has a hundred levels, and the distance between each two levels is that of heavens from the earth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Paradise is in pledge of swords.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Paradise is the city of the holders of generosity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Paradise will be the reward of the one with three daughters, who trains them in good manners, gives them in marriage and is kind to them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Passionate love of the world is the source of all evils.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Patience and prudence are superior to setting slaves free, and the holders of them will be allowed to Paradise without being called to account.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Patience beautifies its host, and violence degrades it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Patience belongs to God, and haste to Satan.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Patience belongs to Heaven, and haste to Satan.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Patience is half of faith, and certainty is faith in its entirety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Patience is the cause of contentment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Patience to faith is like unto brain to body.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Pay a visit to cemeteries to recall Hereafter, wash the dead (ritually), for moving a motionless body to the sides is a manifest piece of admonition, and say prayer for the dead, for it may make you sad, and a sad man will in Day of Judgement enjoy God's shade (protection) as well as all sorts of good.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Pay a visit to patients and ask them to pray for you, since their praying will be granted and their sins forgiven (by God)
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Pay a visit to patients and take part in funeral processions to be reminded of eternal life.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Pay a visit to the graves (of all), Hereafter to recall.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Pay a visit to those who do not visit you, and gift something to those who do not gift you anything.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Paying respect to women whose husbands struggle in the way of God (in the battlefield) by men who stay back at home, is like unto honoring their own mothers, and anyone of the latter who takes upon himself the guardianship of a struggler's family but betrays them in any way, will be made to stand on his feet in the Day of Judgement, with the struggler being made aware of his treachery and asked to make his own whatever he likes of the treacherer's good deeds. What do you think?!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Peace of mind is gain and missing it is loss.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People are Adam's sons (anyway), and Adam was made of clay.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People are all dependents of God, and the most favorite of them to God is the most beneficial to His dependents.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People are like unto camels- a hundred of them you see, but not even one among them for a load to carry.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People are like unto the teeth of a comb.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People are mines, mines of gold and silver.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People are mines, with their race (origins) affecting them, and bad training is like unto bad race.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People are two groups: teachers and learners, and there is no good in other than these two.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People do good deeds, but their reward in the Day of Judgment will be to the extent of their wisdom.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People perish through the offshoots of their tongues.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People resemble their own time the most.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People who entrust the administration of their affairs to a woman will never be saved (prosperous).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People will be resurrected with respect to their intentions in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People will face a time when a believer will be meaner than his sheep.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People will face a time when holding fast to one's faith will be as hard as holding burning fire in one's hands.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People will not perish till they are forgiven.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: People will not perish unless they are given a final warning.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Perfect bravery is to get extremely furious, with reddened face and trembling hair, but still managing to quench one's fury.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Perfect kindness lies in doing in privacy what you do among the public.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Perform acts of worship to the extent of your ability, for weariness in you will annoy God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Piety stands at the peak of all deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Piety suffices (to show) man's sagacity and self- conceit, (to show) his ignorance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Pilgrimage to Mecca is Jihad (struggling in the way of God) for the weak, and a woman's Jihad is to take care of her husband well.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Pleasing and displeasing God rest on pleasing and displeasing one's own father.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Pleasing and displeasing God rest on pleasing and displeasing one's own parents.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Poetry is a piece of discourse - it can be either a good or a bad one.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Polytheism among my people is more concealed than an ant's movement on Mount Safa at dark night, and the closest thing to it is to like a bit of injustice and dislike a bit of justice, for isn't religion but liking and disliking for God's sake? The Exalted God says: Say, if you love God, obey me, and so He will love you
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Poverty is a believer's gift in this world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Poverty is a trust and an act of worship, if not revealed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Poverty is humiliation to people, but beauty to God in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Practice by truth though you see in it your destruction, for in reality it brings you prosperity, and refrain from falsehood though you see in it your prosperity, for it surely results in your destruction.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Practice divine precepts, refrain from the unlawful and be content with your divine lot in order to be respectively the most worshipping, the most abstinent and the most needless servant of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Practice shooting, for it's among your best endeavors.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Praise your (dead) children, for they are your pioneers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Praising (people) other than one's own parents and just leaders is not allowed, and kindness to people other than religious and noble men is not permissible.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Pray to (your) Lord a lot, for it stops the occurrence of your destined lot.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prayer blackens Satan's face, charity breaks his back and loving for God's sake demolishes him. If you act upon the last one, he will keep aloof from you as far as East from West.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prayer in a sitting position is half a prayer in a standing position.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prayer is a believer's light.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prayer is a key to (God's) mercy, ablution is a key to prayer, and prayer is a key to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prayer is like unto a scale, whoever sets it properly, will earn perfect reward.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prayer is one among God's armies, and thus when granted wards off indispensable events.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prayer is proximity (to God) for all the pious.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prayer is the first deed for which men will be called to account.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prayer is the pillar of religion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prayer to religion is like head to body.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prayers are believers' weapons.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prayers not preventing those who pray from indecency and evil will make them take more distance with God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prayers of a Muslim for his absent brethren will be granted, for an angel accompanies him to say `amen' whenever he prays thus, and it is the same for you too.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prayers repel bad luck, benevolence adds to one's sustenance, and servants of God will be deprived of their daily bread, with sins should they be fed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prayers repel plagues.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Praying for one's absent brethren will certainly be granted.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Praying for oneself is the best (kind of) praying.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Praying for the benefactor by the receiver of benefaction will certainly be granted.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Praying is worshipping.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prepare yourself for death before it befalls you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prior to committing the sin, Adam's death was in front of his eyes and his wishes were behind his head, but as soon as he committed the sin, the Exalted God reversed these two and, as a result, he always wished to die.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prolonged life spent in obeying God is prosperity in its entirety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Proper charity, beneficence, kindness to parents, and keeping the bonds of kinship will turn misfortune to prosperity, prolong one's life, and ward off hard deaths.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prophethood ended, and so there will be no prophet after me, save the givers of good tidings, i.e. good visions one dreams for himself, or others dream for him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prophets are tried harder than others, and next to them in this matter are the like of them (the righteous). Man is tried in proportion to (the strength of) his faith. If he has a strong faith, he will be tried harder, and vice versa. He is constantly subjected to tests and trials in order to be purified of his sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prosperous is the one who is guided through Islam, and who has sufficient means of life with which he is convinced.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prostrate yourself, for verily every prostration makes God wipe out one of your sins and elevate you one more degree.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Providers (of goods) receive their daily bread, and hoarders with damnation are fed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Prudence is half of sustenance, friendship is half of wisdom, sorrow is half of old age and small family is half of richness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Public obscenity, rulers' oppression and treachery to the people of the Book result respectively in earthquake, drought and the rise of enemy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Punish not Muslims, to the extent possible; for a mistake in forgiveness is (much) better than one in punishment for a leader.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Punish your servants to the extent of their intellect.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Purify your faith, for a little bit of worship suffices you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Put the Divine laws into effect concerning friends and foes alike, and pay no attention to the blames of beraters for that.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Putting on your patchy piece is better than picking up a new one belonging to others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Read the Quran and act upon it. Do not leave it, do not exaggerate about it, do not earn your living through it, and do not seek superiority (abundance) by means of it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Read the Quran as long as your hearts are in agreement with each other in respect to it, but as soon as disagreement arose among you, rise up.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Read the Quran if it keeps you away from evil; if (you feel) it doesn't, you are not a true reader of it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Read the Quran, for the Exalted God does not torture the heart which has perceived it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Real patience is realized when one suffers a calamity for the first time.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Receive the one who takes refuge in you in the name of God, give something to the one who begs you in the name of God, accept the invitation of the one who invites you, and be kind to the one who is kind to you; if you cannot do so, pray for him instead as long as you make sure you have made up his kindness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Receiving alms is not permissible for the wealthy, nor is it for the high- minded.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Recompense rudeness with forbearance and deprivation with munificence to gain dignity before God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Reconcile people even through telling (a harmless) lie.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Rectify yourself and seek proximity (to God).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Redness is the beauty of Satan.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from adultery, for it takes away the brightness of countenance, cuts off (the adulterer's) sustenance, makes the Merciful (God) furious and causes eternal punishment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from aggression, for its punishment is the most immediate.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from anger.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from avarice, for it ruined your predecessors. It led them to misery and they became misers, it led them to breaking the bonds of kinship and they did so, and it led them to wickedness and they became wicked.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from backbiting, for it is worse than adultery. Verily, when someone commits adultery and repents, God accepts his repentance, but a backbiter will not be forgiven until he is first forgiven by the backbited.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from bad friends, for you are identified through them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from begging, for it is immediate meanness, and the poverty towards which you haste.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from borrowing, for it leads to the sorrow of night and meanness of day.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from eulogy, for it is like unto cutting off one's head.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from foolish friends, for they'll cause you evil, though good they intend.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from going to extremes in matters religious, for it ruined your predecessors.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from greed, for it is immediate poverty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from hidden passion: it is when a scholar likes people to sit in his presence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from liars, for they are mirage in resemblance, drawing near you what's far in distance and brining what is remote to your presence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from lust, for it makes man blind and deaf.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from minor sins, for God will call you to account for them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from minor sins, for they are like unto a group of people landing in valley, each gathering little pieces of wood which might finally make a huge heap for baking bread. Minor sins, too, will (finally) be so great to cause one's ruin when he is called to account.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from misery, for it led to the ruin of predecessors and caused them to shed the blood of one another and to consider the unlawful as lawful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from obstinacy, for it begins with ignorance and ends in repentance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from polytheism and telling lie.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from red color, for it is the most favorite ornament to Satan.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from slackness, for you live for today, not for tomorrow. Should there be a tomorrow, pass it as you do today, and should there be no tomorrow, you will not regret today's slackness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from talebearing, causing disunity and spreading rumors among people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from talking to women (in privacy), for a stranger having a private meeting with a woman will assuredly be stirred to avail himself of her.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from telling lie, being it serious or joking. You should not give a promise to your child and break it afterwards. Telling lie leads people to wickedness and wickedness brings them the Fire (of Hell), while honesty leads them to goodness and goodness guides them to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from telling lie, for it is not in agreement with faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from the dirty green. What is it ? They asked. It is a beautiful woman in a bad family. replied the Holy Prophet.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from the little of the much, which makes you drunk.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from two traits: weariness and laziness. Verily, the former makes you intolerable of truth and the latter stops you acting upon it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from vanity, for as soon as one gets accustomed to it, the Exalted God says: Reckon him among the refractory.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from vanity, for it induced Satan to avoid prostrating to Adam. Refrain from greed, for it made Adam eat the fruit of the (forbidden) tree. Refrain from jealousy, for it caused Cain to kill Abel. Verily, these are the origins of all vices.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from whatever makes you drunk.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from whatever sounds bad for (your) ears.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from whatever you have to pardon for.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Refrain from wine, for its sin gives birth to (other) sins, just as its tree gives birth to new vines.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Release Muslims, from their trouble and let Your good deeds increase.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Reliance on man in worldly and otherworldly affairs suffices to show his prosperity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Religion (faith) starts with abstinence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Religion is not strengthened, save with manliness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Religious zeal originates from faith, and debauchery from hypocrisy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Relive your hearts time and again (by remembering God).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Remember death all the time, for it purifies you of your sins and reduces your greed for the world. If you remember death when you are rich, it reduces the worth of wealth, and if you remember it when you are poor, it causes you to be pleased with your life.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Remember death all the time, for it relieves your other sufferings.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Remember death all the time, for its remembrance makes abundance to seem little, and little to seem enough.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Remember God as to the one who has no helper save Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Remember God in treating your servants. Dress them, feed them and talk to them gently.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Remember God when you are at ease, and He will remember you in hardships.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Remember God, for He is your supporter in (all) affairs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Remember the good deeds of your dead ones and connive at their evil actions.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Remember your own faults when you want to mention others'.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Remembering God heals (people's) hearts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Remembering God weighs over giving charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Remorse is just as repentance, and whoever repents for his sins is like unto a sinless person.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Remove obstacles from the path of Muslims.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Renew your faith by expressing, There is no god but Allah, time and again.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Repent after committing a bad deed - hiddenly for a covert sin and openly for an overt one.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Repent to your Lord before death, and do good before life involvements stop you doing so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Repentance expiates sins. If you did not commit sins, God would create other people to commit sins to be forgiven by Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Repentance from a sin is to stop committing that sin again.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Repentance has a door in the west, open as long as seventy years, till some verses of your Lord come down, and then the Sun will rise from it's west.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Respect those who teach you as well as those whom you teach.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Restore your patients to health through charity, for it wards off all sorts of illness and evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Retelling what one hears suffices to make of him a liar, and claiming to take back one's rights without conniving at any part of it suffices to show his stinginess.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Retelling what one hears suffices to make of him a liar.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Retelling what one hears suffices to make of him a sinner.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Return the residue of thread and cloth (to their owners), for whoever commits treachery in these, will be demanded in the Day of Judgement to provide the like of them, without being able to do so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Return to the Exalted God for forgiveness, for I myself do so a hundred times a day.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Revealing all you know suffices to show your ignorance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Revealing God's blessings is one way of thanksgiving to Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Ruin is the end of men who obey women.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Safeguard the earth, for it is your mother who will report (to God) the good or evil any one does on it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Satan tries to deceive one or two persons (when sitting together) but leaves them as soon as they turn out to be three.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Save the Almighty God, a believer does not have anything better than an abstinent wife who obeys his orders, makes him cheerful when he casts a look at her, observes his oath whenever he swears, and keeps his wealth and her own modesty intact in his absence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Save your face by your wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Save yourself from Fire, even through half a date; or by good words, if lacking the former.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Say a good (word) to derive benefit, and avoid speaking evil words to be safe.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Say: O God! I beg You to bestow upon me a confident heart, believing in Your visit (in the Last Day (, pleased with Your predestination and content with Your blessings.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Say: O God! make my inner self better than my outer self, and rectify the latter. O God! I beg You to give me the good you have bestowed upon people, of wealth, family and children that are neither deviated nor deviating.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Saying prayer with one's teeth brushed weighs over seventy prayers said with unbrushed teeth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Scholars are God's trustees for people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Scholars are God's trustees on earth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Scurrility incites enmity, and malice brings meanness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Search for knowledge even (if it is to be acquired) in China, for seeking knowledge is a precept for all Muslims, and angels spread their wings for the seekers of knowledge (to sit on) and derive pleasure from what they search for.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Search for lore from the birth shore to the grave door.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Secure your properties by giving alms, cure your patients through charity, and resort to praying to guard yourself against calamity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Security and health are two (divine) blessings most people lose.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Sedition will arise before the Hour, as gloomy as parts of dark nights.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seditions will soon arise. When believers in the morning will turn out to be disbelievers at night, save those whom God has enlivened their hearts with knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: See where you place your child (cultivate your sperm),for nature leaves its effect.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seek (something), even if it is an iron ring.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seek (your) sustenance through marriage.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seek good deeds with holders of good faces.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seek knowledge, for it is a believer's friend, his minister being forbearance, his guidance being intellect, his guardian being (good) deeds, his father being moderateness, his brother being gentleness, and the commander of his army being patience.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seek your sustenance in the hideouts of the earth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seekers of knowledge are seekers of God's Mercy and pillars of Islam, who will be rewarded by prophets.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seeking knowledge is a must for all Muslims and whoever issues forth his knowledge to incompetent people is like unto the one who beautifies pigs with jewels, pearls, and gold.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seeking knowledge is a must for all Muslims; and everything, even fish in seas, ask forgiveness for the seekers of knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seeking knowledge is obligatory for all Muslims- men and women alike.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seeking knowledge is the atonement of one's past sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Selfishness ruins one's worship of seventy years.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Sense of duty, fidelity and praising God stand at the peak of all religious affairs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Serving your wife is a kind of charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Set prayer humbly, as if you see God. If you do not see Him, He (surely) sees you. Expect nothing from people to live free from want, and avoid whatever requires your later pardoning.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seven (groups of) people will be allowed (to rest) under the shade of God's Throne in the day when there will be as shade but His: one who is whole- heartedly fond of mosques, one who rejects the sensual request of a high- rank woman for (his) fear of God, one who makes friends (with people) for God's sake, one who controls his (her)eyes against the unlawful, one who acts as a watchout in the way of God, and one who weeps out of fearing God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seven events are there between a servant of God and Paradise, the easiest one being death and the hardest, arriving at the presence of the Exalted God, when the oppressed call the oppressors to account.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seven persons will be allowed (to rest) under God's Throne in the day when there will be no shade but His: a just leader, a youth grown at in serving God, a man who whole- heartedly wishes to return to the mosque whenever leaving it, a man who makes friends and breaks friendship for God's sake, a man who remembers God in privacy and sheds tears, a man who rejects the sensual request of a beautiful, high- rank woman out of fearing God- the Lord of the worlds- and a man whose left hand knows not what his right hand has hiddenly given in charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seventy ranks separate a learned man from a (simple) worshipper.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Seventy times a day, the Earth calls out, O human beings, eat whatever you like and wish for, by God, I will eat your skin and flesh!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Shake hands (with each other) to make grudges leave your hearts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Shaking hands is the perfect form of salutation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Shall I inform you of one of the kings of Paradise? It is a weak, oppressed and poorly- dressed person to whom nobody pays attention, but whose swears come true when he swears by God for something to happen.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Shall I inform you of the dwellers of Hell? They are the proud, selfish, arrogant, greedy and avaricious people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Shall I inform you of the easiest acts of worship? - silence and good- naturedness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Shall I inform you of the female dwellers of Paradise?. The faithful women who give birth to a lot of children, who make peace before long, and who tell their husbands immediately after a wrongdoing, My very hand is in yours, I will not sleep until you get pleased with me.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Shall I inform you of the most precious treasure of a man? It is a wife who makes him cheerful when he casts a glance at her, who obeys his orders, and who keeps his trusts intact in his absence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Shall I inform you of the strongest people? those who can reign their rage better than others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Shall I inform you of the worst of all people?. Those who eat food lonely, give nothing to anybody, travel alone and hit their servants. Shall I inform you of the one who is worse than them? - - those whose evil people are worried about and in whom no goodness can be found out. Shall I inform you of those who are (even) worse than them? - - those who barter their eternal life for others' worldly life. Shall I inform you of those who are (even) worse? - - those who sacrifice religion to enjoy the world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Shall I inform you of those for whom the Fire will be banned Tomorrow? The gentle, tender- hearted and easy- going people who get sweet on people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Shall I inform you of what is better than fasting, prayer and charity? It is making it up among people, for conflict among them results in annihilation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Shall I inform you of your worst and best ones? The best of you is the one whose good you can be hopeful about and from whose evil you can find a way out, and the worst of you is the one whose good you cannot be hopeful about and from whose evil you cannot find a way out.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Shall I teach you some virtues by which the Exalted God makes you profit? - acquire knowledge, for it is a friend of a believer, forbearance being his counselor, wisdom his guide, action his guardian, moderateness his father, leniency his brother and patience, the commander of his army.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Share your food with each other and be not divided among yourselves, for the food of one person is sufficient for two and that of two persons is enough for three. Share your food with each other and be not divided among yourselves, for blessing is a company to community.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Share your guest in food, for he may be shy to eat alone.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Shooting is the best hobby for you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Should a bucket of the hellish drinks be poured on the world, it would putrefy people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Should a club of hellish iron be laid on the earth and all the people gather to lift it up, they will not be able to do so, and should it strike a mountain just as it does with the dwellers of Hell, the former will be chopped into dust.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Should a mountain oppress another mountain, God will punish the aggressive one.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Should a spark of Hellish flames be in the east, the one who is in the west will feel its heat.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Should hardship be in a hole, relief would enter and force it out.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Should man escape from his sustenance as he escapes from death, his sustenance will come upon him just as death does.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Should man have two gold territories, he will seek a third one, for nothing will fill his belly but soil, and God will accept the repentance of whoever repents.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Should one among you do something whatsoever inside a hard rock having no door and opening to it, it will spread out among people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Should one look at those who are superior to him in matters divine and follow them, and look at those who are inferior to him in matters secular and thank God for His grace, God will consider him patient and grateful. Conversely, God will neither consider patient nor grateful the one who follows those who are inferior than him in matters divine and looks at those who are superior to him in matters secular and pity himself for his less abundance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Should one of the Paradise women make her appearance on the earth, her aroma of musk will fill up the earth and take away the light of the Sun and the Moon.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Should someone give me a sheep's arm for gift or invite me, I will accept both.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Should someone rub his face against the earth from birth to death for the pleasure of the Exalted God, he will surely find his action insignificant in the Resurrection.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Should the dwellers of heavens and the earth take part in slandering a believer, the Greatest and the most Powerful God would turn them upside down in the Fire.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Should you make so many mistakes piling up high into the sky, and then repent, even then will God accept your repentance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Should your reliance on God be, as it deserves, He will expand your sustenance as He does for birds, being hungry in morning and satiated at night.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Silence is beauty for the wise and covering for the fool.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Silence is safety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Silence is sagacity, but few people can keep silent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Silence is the first stage of servitude.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Silence is the most lofty (form of) worship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Silence stands at the peak of morality, and joking reduces its value.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Since his creation, the son of Adam has not experienced anything harder than death, but the world after death is even harder.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Sins cause evil to the sinless too, for if he blames the sinners, he will happen to commit sins himself, if he backbites them, he will be a sinner himself and if he agrees with them, he will get a share in their sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Slackness is Satan's slogan, which he throws into believers' hearts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Slandering people, committing evil deeds, abandoning bonds of kinship, and considering honest people as dishonest and dishonest ones as honest are among the signs of the Hour (Resurrection).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Sleeping with knowledge is better than praying with ignorance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Slowness is good in everything save in performing deeds for the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Slowness, economy and good fame comprise one of the twenty- four parts of prophethood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Smiling at your brother (in faith), enjoining good and forbidding evil, guiding the lost ones and removing stones, thorns and bones from (people's) path, are all different forms of charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: So long as the drunkenness of ignorance and that of the love of the world do not appear in you, you can be sure about your Lord.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: So many times did Gabriel recommend to me to observe neighbors' rights that I came to think of them inheriting each other.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Solomon was given the option to choose one among wealth, rule and knowledge. He chose knowledge and was, as a result, bestowed upon the other two.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Some of you can detect a tiny thorn in your brother's eyes, but not a tree branch in your own.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Some sins are irremissible, some are not left of account, and some are forgiven, i.e. taking partners with God, oppressing one another, and one's deeds known only to him and the Exalted God respectively.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Some sins are remissible, some are irremissible and some punishable, i.e. your deeds known to you and God, taking partners with God and oppressing your brethren respectively.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Sons of Adam are entitled to no more than the shade of a house, a dry loaf of bread and a piece of cloth to cover their privy parts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Sons of Adam do not have any deed better than saying prayer, reconciling people and behaving well.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Sons of Adam will in the Day of Judgment be surely regretful for times of forgetting God in this world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Souls are like disciplined armies- familiar souls are allied and unfamiliar ones, aliens.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Speak well and feed people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Spend (in the way of God) but do not count the amount, for God will then count (your sins); and do not be stingy (towards people), for God will do the same to you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Start being charitable to yourself and then proceed to your household, your relatives and others respectively. Again, begin it from your household.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Staying at home saves man from seditions.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Stomach is the home (source) of all illness, and abstinence from gluttony is the best drug.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Stop griefs and sorrows through charity so that the Exalted God save you from them and grant you victory over enemies.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Strengthen marriage contract and make it known to people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Strengthen ties of kinship by remembering your family frequently.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Strengthen your control of women through (providing them with) insufficient clothing, for when a woman comes to have excessive dresses and ornaments, she tends to roam outside home.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Strong is the one who has self- control.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Struggle (in the path of Deity), healthy and needless to be.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Struggle against polytheists through your wealth and souls and words.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Struggle against your passions to gain control over your souls.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Struggling in the way of God is the nearest of all deeds to Him, and nothing is equal to it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Stupidity is inauspicious and moderateness is auspicious (in nature).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Suffice it for death to admonish and for certainty to (make man) needless.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Suffice it for death to decline your love for the world and to incline you towards eternity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Suffice it for time to advise and for death to separate.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Support your affairs through secrecy, for all holders of blessings are subject to others' jealousy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Suppose you have given a Dinar in the way of God, another to free a slave, another in charity to the poor, and still another to settle the needs of your household. The last one is worthy of more reward than others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Surprised am I of the negligent who is not to be neglected, and of the seeker of the (material) world who is sought by death, and of the one who laughs boisterously but knows not weather God is pleased or displeased with him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Suspend the punishment of Merciful people, unless they are condemned to divinely- ordered penalties.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Suspicion is far- sightedness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Sustenance reaches a generous family faster than a knife hits a camel's hump.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Sustenance seeks God's servants more than their death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Swearing (in trade) makes goods sold, but blessing ruined.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Swearing ends either in violation or remorse.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Swords are keys to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Take refuge in God from (your) eyes, for eyes have a claim on you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Take refuge in God from disaster, wretchedness, bad destinies and blames of enemies.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Take refuge in God from indecent women and refrain from their decent ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Take refuge in God from poverty and being encumbered by a large family, and from doing injustice or being oppressed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Take refuge in God from the evil of (your) permanent neighbor, for a passing neighbor will part with you when he wishes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Take refuge in God from the following destructive three: a bad neighbor who covers your good and spreads out your evil, a bad wife who is foul- mouthed in your presence and trecherous in your absence, and a bad leader who ignores your good deeds and does not forgive your wrong doings.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Taking a rope and carrying fire- wood on your back is easier than making a request to a man, whom God has given something out of His Mercy, being him generous or not.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Taking one's ropes, going to mountains, and collecting bushes to sell for food and for giving charity is better for any one of you than making request to people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Taking up man's soul by the Angel of Death is harder than a thousand strokes of sword.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Talk less and be not enticed by Satan.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Talk to people about what they can understand. Do you want them to deny God and His Prophet?
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Talking about something to a people with deficient intellect causes evil for some of them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Teach (your knowledge to others). Be easy- going and do not be hard on people. Be open- faced and do not treat people harshly. When one of you gets angry, he should keep silent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Teach and do not be hard (on the learners), for an (easy- going) teacher is better than a crude one.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Teach your children shooting, for it is the cause of disgrace for your enemies.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Teach your children swimming and shooting, and your women, spinning.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Teach your children swimming and shooting. What a good hobby is spinning wheel at home for a pious woman! When your mother and your father call you (simultaneously), respond to your mother (first).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Teachers and learners equally share the good, and nothing is there for other people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Teaching (your) knowledge every morning and night is better in the sight of God than Jihad (Holy war.)
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Tell what's true, even if it is bitter (to you.)
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Thanking (God's) grace makes it ruin, not face.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: That by which man maintains his honor is considered charity for him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The (Islamic) punishment for a sorcerer is a stroke of sword.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The abstemious remain healthy and the gluttonous grow sick and hard- hearted.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The adultery of eyes is an unlawful look.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The adultery of the tongue is indecent talk.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The angel of the Divine punishment will push the lewd scholars of the Quran to Hell before idol- worshippers. They'll ask for the reason, and the angels will reply: Is the one who knows equal to the one who knows not ?
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The basis of one's intellect, besides believing in God, is friendship with people, and benevolence to the good and bad of them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The basis of one's intellect, besides believing in God, is friendship with people. Nobody is needless of consultation. The benevolent of the world will be the benevolent of the Hereafter, and the wrongdoers of this world will be the wrongdoers of the next.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best (form of) abstinence is being pleased with one's (destined) sustenance, and the best thing for which to beseech the Exalted God, is the safety of this world and the next (to reach).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best (form) of your faith is the most easy- going face of it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best act of worship in respect to (heavenly) rewards is to cut short your visit to patients.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best action is (to have) pure intention.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best action is moderation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best among my people are the hot- tempered who are quickly quieted down when they rouse to anger.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best among my people are the learned, and the best of them are the forbear ant.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best among my people are the learned, and the best of them are the Merciful. Verily, the Exalted God will pardon a learned man for forty sins before pardoning an ignorant for a single one, and in the Day of Resurrection, the Merciful learned will accompany their own light extending as stars from the east to the west.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best believers are the content and the worst, the covetous.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best business is a flawless bargain, and what man accomplishes with his own hand.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best business is the one which with man's own hand is done.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best charity aims at the death of poverty, a donator's hand is worthier than a beggar's, and charity should start at home.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best charity is coupled with generosity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best charity is the one given with out any expectation: The giver's hand is better than the receiver's. Start giving alms with those who are more needful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best companions in the sight of God are best to their friends, and the best neighbors to Him are best for their own neighbors.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best daily bread is daily sustenance in adequate.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best deed is a hungry man, to feed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best deed is the fruitful, and the best guidance, the one followed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best deed is to make your brother (in faith) happy or to pay his debts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best deeds to God are ) feeding an indigent person, ) repaying his debts, and ) relieving him from distress.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best deeds to God, the Exalted, are setting prayers on time, being kind to parents, and struggling in the way of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best form of charity for a Muslim is to acquire (some sort of) knowledge and teach it to his (her) brothers in faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best form of charity is giving alms to a relative, though being one's enemy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best form of charity is that of man's tongue.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best form of charity is to control one's tongue.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best form of charity is to give alms when you are healthy and indigent, hoping for wealth and fearing poverty, not to wait until your death approaches to say (in your last will) that for so and so this much and for so and so that much, (then to address your heir, saying) that such and such an amount of your wealth belongs to such and such a person.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best form of charity is to make it up between two persons.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best form of faith is the belief that God is with you wherever you are.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best form of faith is to like and dislike for the sake of God, to engage your tongue in the remembrance of God, to wish for others what you wish for yourself and to stop wishing for others what you don't wish for yourself, and to express good words or to keep silent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best form of faith lies in having patience and being generous.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best form of litany is remembering God in privacy, and the best daily bread is sustenance in adequate.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best form of spoken charity is the oral intercession by which to release a captive, to prevent bloodshed, to direct kindness and goodness towards your brothers in faith, and to ward off evil from them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best form of worship is waiting for relief (the reappearance of the twelfth Shiite Imam).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best fragrance is that of musk.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best friends, the best scouts and the best armies amount to four, four hundreds and four thousands respectively.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best gain for a Muslim is the share he is given of the spoils (of a holy war).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best gift bestowed on people is good- temperedness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best gift given to a man (believer) is good- temperedness, and the worst thing given to him is an evil character behind good looks.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)
