quotes.quote: The best Jihad (struggling in the way of God) is to struggle against one's evil (soul) and concupiscence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best job is the one which, with a worker's hands, is carefully done.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best kind of Jihad (struggling in the way of God) is to begin a day without thinking about oppressing others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best kind of Jihad (struggling in the way of God) is to speak a word of truth to a cruel king.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best marriage gift is the least.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best marriage is the simplest.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best money is that which a man spends for his family.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best Muslim is the one from whose tongue and hand, Muslims at rest stand.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best odor for men is that which is overt in smell but covert in color, and the best odor for women is that which is covert in smell but overt in color.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of (your) friends are those who help when you remember God and remind you of God when you forget Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of all deeds are three: humility when having wealth and authority, forgiveness when being in power and generosity without holding people under obligation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of all deeds is earning money lawfully.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of all deeds is the most durable of all, though in quantity being small.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of all deeds is to acquire the knowledge of God. Verily, that deed is useful which is coupled with knowledge, being great or small in amount, and that deed is harmful which is coupled with ignorance, being great or small in quantity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of all deeds is to like and dislike for the sake of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of all deeds, apart from believing in God, is making friends with people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of all friends is the one who helps you when you remember him and remembers you when you forget about him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of all good deeds is to endear (your) companions.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of all people is a man who tries his best.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of all people is the one who remains humble in glory, abstinent in affluence, just in strength and forbearent in power.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of all virtues is to reestablish your connection with the one who has broken it, to bestow on the one who has deprived you (of something), and to connive at the faults of the one who has done injustice to you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of man's heritages are three: a child who will pray for him, constant charity for which he will be rewarded continuously, and a sort of knowledge people will avail themselves of.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of men's lines (in social dealings) are the first, and the worst of them are the last, while the worst of women's lines are the first, and the best of them are the last.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of Muslims' homes is the one wherein an orphan is treated well, and the worst is the one wherein an orphan is mistreated. The supporters of orphans will accompany me in a Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of my people is the one who calls people towards God, the Almighty, and makes them lovers of Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of people is a poor believer who expends (in the way of God) to the possible extent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of people is the one who benefits them the most.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of people is the one who lives a long life of good deeds, and the worst is the one who lives a long life of evil deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of people is the one whom others profit by.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of women is the one with a more beautiful visage and the less gift of marriage.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you are for their wives and daughters the best.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you are for women the best.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you are in age the oldest and in deeds, the best.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you are in age the oldest and in manners, the best.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you are the best for their families, and I am the best among you for my household. The respectful alone respect women, and the mean alone offend them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you are the best to their family.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you are the best to their wives.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you are the most good- tempered who associate with people, and with whom people (tend to) associate.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you are the most reluctant to here and the most inclined towards the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you are those who defend their clan without committing sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you are those who learn and teach the Quran.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you are those who neither abandon here for the Hereafter, nor do the reverse, nor stand a burden on others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you are those whose good we can be hopeful about and from whose evil we can find a way out, and the worst of you are those whose good we cannot be hopeful about and from whose evil we cannot find a way out.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you are, in refunding their debts, the quickest.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you in faith has the best manners (in rate).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you is not the one who abandons this world for the next or the next for this in order to avail herself of both, for this world is a bridge to the next. Try not to be a burden to others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you is the one whom God has given a hand, and who has on his own `self' full command.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of you is the one whose meeting reminds you of God, whose words increase your knowledge, and whose deeds incline you towards the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of your homes is the one wherein an orphan is kept in respect.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of your leaders are those whom you love and pray for, who love and pray for you, and the worst ones are those whom you hate and curse, and who hate and curse you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of your women are the affectionate, childbearing ones who are assistant and obedient to their husbands and pious at the same time, and the worst of them are the arrogant ones who use makeup (for other than their husbands). The latter are hypocrites (in reality) who will not be allowed to Paradise, save to the number of crows with red feet and beaks.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of your women are the chaste, passionate ones who observe chastity in respect to their privy parts, and love passionately their own husbands.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best of your youth are those who follow the path of the aged, and the worst of your aged ones are those who copy the patterns of the youth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best people are the most good- tempered.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best people are those who recite the Holy Quran better (than others), who are deeper in matters religious, who fear God more, who bid good and forbid evil more often, and who have relations with their families.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best place of worship for women is a corner in their own house.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best places of meeting are the vastest.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best poetical Arabic expression is Labid's, i.e. All things are false save God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best practice for a man (believer) is swimming and for a woman, spinning.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best provision is piety, and the best state of heart is certainty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best servants of God to Him are the most good- tempered.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best servitude is (done) in utmost solitude.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best state is to be expressing the name of God when you are at the point of death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best struggle to God, the Exalted, is to utter a word of truth in the presence of a tyrant ruler.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best testimony is that which is borne before its bearer is required to.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best thing infused in (man's) heart is certainty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best wife is the one who gladdens you when you look at her, obeys your orders, and preserves her body and your property in your absence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best witness is he who bears testimony before being required to.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best wives have the least marriage portions.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best woman is an affectionate one who bears many a child.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best woman is the one who gladdens her husband when he looks at her, obeys his orders, and avoids doing anything he dislikes through her body and property.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best women of my nation are those with nicer faces and less marriage portions.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The best word to me, the truest (I see).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Blessed and Exalted God showers His Mercy on the Merciful. Be Merciful, therefore, to those on the earth to receive the Mercy of the One in the sky.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The bravest are those people who (can) reign their carnal passions.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The camel tie, and on God rely.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The carelessness of a rich man (to repay his debts) leads to his disgrace and (God's) punishment for him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The companions to God in the Hereafter are the pious and abstinent people here.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The dead suffers in the grave from the groans and shouts of others on his death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The deeds of three groups will not be recorded: the insane who lack control on their intellect till they recover, sleepers as long as they are asleep, and children till they reach maturity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The disgrace of this world is more tolerable than that of the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The divine Mercy is of one hundred parts, one of which He has showered on people, and the rest He has saved for the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The doer of good is better than good, and the doer of evil worse than evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The doers of the following five will suffer immediate heavenly punishment: oppression, breach of promise, mistreatment of parents, disconnection of bonds of kinship and ungratefulness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The doors of heavens open at the time of prayers as well as the time of preparation fight in way of God, and at these two times the supplications of those who pray are less likely to be rejected.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The doors of heavens open on four occasions, and prayers are granted: when warriors in the way of God join hands, when it rains, at times of prayer, and on visiting Kába.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The doors of heavens open on Mondays and Thursdays and all servants of God are forgiven, save those who are hostile to their brethren.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The double- faced and the double- tongued are both damned.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The double- faced in the world will suffer double- flamed fire in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The double- faced will not enjoy respect.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The earth is God's and the people are His servants. So, settle in the land where good you find.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The earth is God's earth, and the people are God's servants. Whoever enlivens (cultivates) a dead (barren) piece of the earth will be its owner.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The earth will be filled with inequity. Then, a man will rise from my household to fill it with equity just as it was filled with injustice and enormity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The earth will be filled with inequity. Then, God will appoint a man to fill it with equity just as it was filled with injustice and enormity- a man whose name and whose father's are respectively mine and my father's.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The easiest pressures of death are like unto a hundred strokes of sword.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God has appointed no prophet with a language other than that of his people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God has created three classes of jinn. Snakes, scorpions and insects comprise the first class. The second class is like unto wind in the air, and the third are those who will suffer reckoning and retribution. He has also created three classes of human being. The first class are like unto beasts of burden. The second class has human bodies but devilish spirits, and the third will enjoy the shade (patronage) of God the day when no shade but His exists.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God has prescribed His creatures' fate fifty thousand years prior to the creation of heavens and the earth, when His Throne was on water.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God postpones to the Day of Judgement (the punishment of (the sins He wishes, save the sin of displeasing one's parents, which He hastes to recompense in this very world before the sinner's death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: By my Glory and Honour I swear that I do not grant a servant two states of security together with two states of fear, i.e. if he feels secure from Me in this world, I will frighten him in the Resurrection and if he is afraid of Me in this world, I will secure him in the Resurrection.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: Grandeur is My prerogative and I will demolish anybody who (tries to claim it as his own.)
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: I am a company to My servant's thinking about Me- being it good, I will benefit him and being it bad, I will bring him loss.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: I am the most needless of all partners when people take partners with Me, and so when someone takes a partner with Me in an act (of worship (, I leave him on his own with his polytheism.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: I will be cross at anybody who does not pray to Me.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: I will forgive the one who believes in My power of forgiving sins, and nothing matters so long as he takes nothing as a partner with Me.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: My forgiveness is more bountiful and greater than covering a Muslim's deed in this world to reveal it afterwards; and thus, so long as my servants ask my forgiveness I will forgive them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: O son of Adam! Every day your sustenance is given to you but you are sad, and everyday your life gets shorter but you are happy. You have what suffices you but you ask for what makes of you a rebel. You are neither content with less nor satiated with more.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: O son of Adam! There are three things of which one is specifically mine, i.e. you should worship Me and take nothing as a partner with me, one is specifically yours, i.e. I will reward or punish you for what you do (if I forgive you, it is because I am the most Compassionate, the most Merciful (, and one is between Me and you, i.e. you should pray to and ask Me, and I should accept and grant what you request.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: Purity (of intention) is the best form of worship My servants can offer Me.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: Son of Adam annoys Me by blaming Time, for I'm Time with all affairs in My authority. I'm the One who changes day and night.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: when a servant approaches Me to the extent of one span, I will get close to him one meter, if he does so to the extent of one meter, I will draw near him more than two meters, and if he approaches Me slowly, I'll go towards him quickly.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: when I inflict my servants with a calamity concerning their bodies, children and wealth and they happen to welcome it patiently, I'll be ashamed to spread out their books of deeds or to call them to the scales of justice in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: when one of My servants intends to perform a good deed but he stops doing so, I will record a good deed for him, and if he performs it, I will record ten to seven hundred good deeds for him. (Conversely), if he intends to perform a bad deed, but stops doing so, I will not record it. However, if he puts it into action, I will record for him only one bad deed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: who is crueler than he who wishes to create a creature as Mine? Let those who claim the ability of so doing create a single grain, an ant or a barley seed!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God says: whoever is not satisfied with what I have destined, and not patient in calamities, should seek a god other than Me.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God shelters anyone who does the following three, and lets him (her) to Paradise: being moderate towards the poor, being kind to parents and being kind to subordinates.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God will avenge anyone who oppresses somebody in this world, if the latter is not able to revenge the former in person.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God will definitely help three groups of people: strugglers in the way of God, slaves struggling for their freedom and men getting married to keep their chastity intact.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God will dress a Muslim with green heavenly clothes if he provides a naked (poor) Muslim with worldly dresses. The Exalted God will let a Muslim taste heavenly fruits in the Day of Judgement, if he feeds a hungry Muslim. And the Exalted God will let a Muslim drink the untouched drink in the Day of Judgement, if he quenches the thirst of another Muslim.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God will expose a leader's face to fire in the Day of Judgement, if he undertakes an affair of my people but carries it out without the care and effort he has for his own affairs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God will forgive the sins of the one who terminates the contract with a regretful man.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God will increase the wealth of the one who opens the door of generosity through giving charity or gifts (to people), and will decrease it should he open the door of (excessive) requests, seeking an increase in his wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God will let a Muslim to Paradise if four people testify to his being good.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God will make a Muslim associate with an act of worship, feeling its pleasure in his heart, when he casts a first glance at a woman but immediately turns his eyes away from her.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God will not put two swords on this (Islamic) nation simultaneously- one from themselves and the other from their enemies.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God will punish a group of people who are greater in number and stronger than the sinners among them, but do not manage to stop the latter committing sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God will surely undertake to grant the requests of anyone who lifts up his hands in request to Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Exalted God's covenant is the most entitled thing to accomplish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The existence of good neighbors leads to the development of cities and long life of communities.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The expiation for backbiting someone is to ask God to forgive him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Fire will eat away all man's body save the place of prostration (on his forehead), for the Great, Powerful God has forbidden it to do so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The first step towards religion is well- wishing for the sake of God, His religion, His Prophet and His Book as well as for Muslims and Muslim leaders.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The first thing to be weighed (in the Day of Judgement) is good- temperedness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The first thing to lose of your religion is honesty and the last one, prayer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The first things to be weighed in favor of (God's) servant are the expenses of his family.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The first things which will fade away from amongst this (Islamic) nation are honesty and chastity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The first things, save idol- worship, which my Lord forbade me to do were drinking wine and (men's) slandering.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The following six things ruin one's deeds: preoccupation with people's faults, hard- heartedness, excessive love of the world, insufficient modesty, ambitious desires, and unending oppression.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The forbearant are invested with glory here and in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The forebearant have surely slipped, and the wise are surely experienced.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The forerunners (in religion) and the moderate people will be allowed to paradise without reckoning, and an easy reckoning will there be for those who do cruelty to their own souls, before they are allowed to paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The fortunate have been created fortunate in their mothers' wombs, and so are the unfortunate.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The fragrance of Paradise will not reach three groups of people: those who attribute themselves to other than their real fathers, those who tell lie about me, and those who belie what they have witnessed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The friends of the accused are the most entitled to be accused.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The gates of Paradise will be open to the truthful traders.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The generous is close to God, people and paradise but remote from Fire, and the miser is remote from God, people and paradise but close to Fire, and the ignorant generous is more beloved to God than the knowledgeable miser.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The generous practice generosity for thinking optimistically of God, and the stingy follow miserliness for thinking pessimistically of Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The good of a horse lies in its brown color.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The good of early men (of Islam) lied in abstinence and faith, and the annihilation of the people of the end of the times lies in stinginess and long desires.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The good of hear and the Hereafter in knowledge lies, and in ignorance the evil exists likewise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The good- tempered, generous youth are more favorite to God than the bad- tempered, miserly old pious.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Great and Powerful God loves three groups of people: those who rise (from sleep) at night, God's Book to recite, those who settle people's demands with charity hidden even from their own hands, and those who stand against enemy in battle while their friends manage to flee.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Great and Powerful God will remove His veil from a woman who uncovers herself outside her home.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The greatest among my people are those who are not much wealthy to feel proud, and those who are not much poor to beg others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Greatest and the most Powerful God has predestined the death, sustenance and resting place of each of His servants, being him fortunate or unfortunate.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Greatest and the most Powerful God will forgive a man's past and future sins, if he removes a thorn bush from people's path.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The greatest form of oppression is to occupy a meter of someone's land, for any piece of sand seized in this way will as a chain wrap one's neck in the Judgment Day.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The greatest losers are those who spoil their lives in seeking (unfulfilable) desires and reach them not, and die without any provision (for the Hereafter), entering the presence of their lord without any proofs (reasons for their doings).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The greatest of all capital sins are polytheism, homicide, mistreatment of parents and testifying falsely.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The greatest of all capital sins is to have a wavering belief (suspicion) in God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The greatest women in abundance are those with the least allowance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The guide to good is just as a good- doer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The head of a people is their servant and cupbearer, and should thus drink last.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The heart of sons of Adam is more flexible (changeable) than a boiling pot.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The hidden weighs over the manifest, but the manifest will be better if one does it as a pattern (for others).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The highest degree of calamity is the least patient to be.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The highest degree of calamity is to have a large family in a state of poverty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The highest status in Islam is struggling in the way of God, which is not achieved save by the best Muslims.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The honor of three groups of people is not to be observed: those who commit vice in public, tyrant leaders and heretics.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Hour (Resurrection) is subsequent to the prevalence of three things: Constructions are ruined and ruins are settled in, good is considered as evil and evil as good, and trusts are played with just as trees are played with by camels.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Hour has come indoor, and people's greed for the world has grown more and more, but the world moves away from them all the more.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Hour will not come until children turn out to be the cause of (their parents') anger, the noble decrease and the ignoble increase in number, the youth become rude to the elderly, and the ignoble revolt against the noble.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Hour will not come until man passes by a grave and wishes to be therein.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Hour will not come until men decrease and women increase in number.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Hour will not come until the ignoble turn out to be the most fortunate of all people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Hour will not come until virtue and piety turn out to be pretentious (in nature).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Hour will only come for (the judgment) of the wicked.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The humble to the truth is too dignified to seek greatness through falsehood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The ignorant generous is more beloved to God, than the knowledgeable miser.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The ill- tempered will face torment, the sorrowful will suffer physical pain, and the contentious will encounter loss of greatness and generosity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The ill- tempered will not be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The impolite is unwise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The jealous enjoy (the world) less than others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The justest of all people is he who likes for himself what he likes for others and dislikes for others what he dislikes for himself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The knowledge not taught is a treasure not used.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The lawful and the unlawful are crystal clear, but between them lie dubious things of which most people are unaware. Whoever refrains from the doubtful will keep his faith and face intact, and whoever falls into them, will indulge in the unlawful, just as a shepherd who pastures his cattle around a preserved field might find himself on it. Know that just as a king has restrictions, the Exalted God has restrictions, i.e. what He has made unlawful. Know that in man's body there is a lump of flesh which if rectified, the whole body will enjoy rectification, and if corrupted, the whole body will suffer corruption. That's man's heart'.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The lawful is what God has announced lawful in His Book, and the unlawful is too, and what He has left unjudged, will be forgiven (if acted upon).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The learned are heir to prophets and (thus), whoever acquires knowledge avails oneself greatly of the prophets' heritage.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The learned are leaders and the pious are masters (of the people) and the company of both brings abundance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The learned are of three kinds: those whose knowledge is of benefit to people and to themselves, those whose knowledge is of benefit to people but of ruin to themselves, and those whose knowledge is of benefit to themselves but not to others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The learned are the lights of earth, the caliphs of the prophets, and the successors of the prophets and me.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The learned's ink and the martyrs' blood will be weighed in the Day of Judgment, and the former will turn out to be weightier (worthier.)
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The learned's sin is considered one and that of the ignorant, two.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The least punished of people in the Day of Judgement are those on whose soles two flames of fire will be placed, which will make their brains boil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The light of faith will vanish from the heart of those who drink wine.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The little work done with knowledge is great, and the great work done with ignorance is little.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The lonely of this world are the following four: the Quran in a tyrant's memory, a mosque wherein its neighbors do not say their prayers, a holy Book kept in a house but not read, and a pious man among the impious.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The longer a Muslim's life, the better for him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The maladies of your predecessors such as envy and enmity have penetrated into your (souls), wearing away not your bodies, but your faith. By the One in whose hands Muhammad's soul stands, you will not be allowed to Paradise unless you turn out to be (true) believers, and you will not achieve that save by loving one another. Shall I make you aware of something that would help you so doing? Greet each other.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The meanest of all people is the one who considers people mean.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The measure of faith is virtue.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Merciful among my people are the moderate ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The merciless will not be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The misled is only liked by the misled.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The moderate will not suffer poverty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The money spent for one's family is (considered an act of) charity for him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The more one speaks, the more follies he commits and the more sins he will have, and thus Hell will be the best abode for him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most abstinent of all people is the one who does not forget (his) grave and trial, who ignores the best worldly beauties, who prefers unending to ending blessings, who does not regard tomorrow of his lifetime, and who considers himself (herself) as dead.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most beloved creatures to God are the unknown pious.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most blasphemous and oppressive is the one who hears the Exalted God's caller to prayer and salvation, but gives no response.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most capital sins on a liar's tongue begin.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most dangerous enemy of yours is your wife who shares your bed, or your maid servant whom you possess.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most daring among you in taking oath, will be the most daring in respect to the Fire.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most despised lawful action to God is divorce.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most easily- punished dwellers of Hell are those with a pair of fire shoes which cause their brains to boil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most extended sustenance given to servants (of God) is patience.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most faithful believer is the one who helps (others) when he is asked to, and who resorts to needlessness when not helped.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most favorite deed to God, the Exalted, is to control one's tongue.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most favorite deed to God, the Exalted, save performing (divine) precepts, is to gladden a Muslim.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most favorite deeds to God, the Exalted, are friendship and enmity for His sake.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most favorite deeds to God, the Exalted, are the most durable of all, though insignificant in quantity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most favorite of God's servants are the most beneficial of them to others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most favorite of your houses to God, the Exalted, is the one wherein an orphan is honored.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most favorite prayer of women to God is the one they say in the darkest places of their houses.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most favorite sites of cities to God are mosques, and the most despised, are shopping centers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most graceful God will not reconsider what He has forgiven, when one commits an evil deed which He veils (from others) and forgives him for that in this very world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most hated creature of the Exalted God is the world. It is so much despised that He has not looked at it since its creation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most hateful men to God are the most tenacious and obstinate of all.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most hateful person to God is he who believes in Him, then turns out to be a disbeliever.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most hateful servant (person) to God is the one whose dress is better than his deed, i.e. the one whose appearance is that of the prophets and whose deeds, those of tyrants.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most honorable man is the most virtuous one.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most hungry of people are seekers of knowledge, and most satiated of all are the most reluctant towards it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most immediately given reward is that of goodness and keeping the bonds of kinship, and the most immediately given punishment is that of evil and breaking the bonds of kinship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most immediately granted praying is that of the one who prays for others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most learned of all is the one who adds people's knowledge to his.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most negligent of all people is the one who does not take a lesson from the changes in the world conditions.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most perfect of all believers are the most good- mannered, and the best of you are the best for their wives.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most powerful of all is the one who controls himself when he gets furious, and the most patient of all is the one who connives at other's faults when in power.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most powerful people to put punishment to effect are the most entitled, forgiveness to erect.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most provident of people is the one who outruns others in controlling his anger.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most quickly rewarded deed, requiring obedience to God, is the observation of bonds of kinship, and the most quickly retributed deed is oppression and breaking off the ties of kinship, and taking false oath ruins lands.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most reluctant towards a learned man are his household and neighbors.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most severely punished in the Day of Judgement is an scholar who does not avail himself of his own knowledge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most severely punished man in the Day of Judgement is a tyrant leader.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most sinful people in the Day of Judgement are those who speak about things out of their concern.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most steadfast (permanent ) deeds are three: remembering God continually, observing justice even when it entails loss (to thee), and sharing with brothers (in faith) one's property.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most thankful man (to God) is the most thankful to people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most unfortunate of all is the one who lives long enough to see the Resurrection.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most virtuous man is the one who tells the truth, being it for or against him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The most wretched man is the one who couples world poverty with eternal punishment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The noble will be asked of their knowledge. Should there be any sort of knowledge with them, write it down, for they do not tell lie.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The odor of Paradise can be smelled from a distance of five hundred years long, but those who seek worldly things through (performing) otherworldly deeds will lose it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The one in whom people see some (imagined) good but who is characterized by no good, will be the most severely punished in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The owner of something is more entitled to carry it (than others) unless he is unable to do it and so, his Muslim brother gives him a hand.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The patient achieve their wishes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The pen (of creation) has recorded (the names of) the wretched and the prosperous.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The people of the Fire will neither enjoy life nor death, but those who have been put to Hell due to their sins, will die therein and as soon as burnt into coal, they will be led to (the righteous ones') intercession and thus, they will be carried in groups and left at Paradise streams. Then, the dwellers of Paradise will be asked to pour water on them, and thus they will grow afresh as seeds left in the pathway of flood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The pious bring good news and the impious, bad ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The pious pass away with their good deeds and nothing remains from them but a flake just as date and barley flakes (little sins), which God disregards.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The prayers of five persons will be granted: the prayers of the oppressed till they are helped, the prayers of the pilgrims to Mecca till they return home, the prayers of the strugglers in the way of God till they go back to their places of residence, the prayers of patients till they recover, and the prayers of brothers (in faith) for one another, and this last one is the most immediately- granted type of prayers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The prayers of the oppressed will be granted, though evildoers they might be, for their evil is their personal property.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The prayers of the oppressed, travelers and fathers (for their children) will without doubt be granted by God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The prayers of three groups of people will not move beyond their own ears (will not be accepted): escaped slaves unless they return home, women who pass a night with their husbands being angry with them, and leaders whose subjects detest them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The prayers of three persons will not be accepted and their good deeds will not ascend the heavens: an escaped servant (slave) unless he returns home, a woman whose husband is dissatisfied with her unless she makes him pleased, and a drunk man before coming to his senses.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The prayers of two groups will not be granted: servants who've escaped their masters till they return, and women who've disobeyed their husbands till they repent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The prayers said between Adhan and Iqama will definitely be granted.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The present one observes things which the absent doesn't.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The pretentious poor will (finally) fall into poverty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The price of wine, the marriage gift of an adulteress woman, the price of a dog, and playing chess are all religiously unlawful. Should the owner of a dog ask you for its cost, you will be allowed to fill his hands with soil. Drinking wine, gambling and any intoxicating thing are unlawful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The punishment of Muslims lies in what they themselves do in this very world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The punishment of two deeds will be experienced in this very world: tyranny and abusing one's parents.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Qur'an is like unto a tied camel whose owner may keep it intact by holding it as it is, or let it go away by releasing its rope.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Quran is healer (of man's spiritual maladies).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The Quran is wealth proper beyond which there is no riches.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The range of my peoples' age is sixty to seventy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The realm of religion will be opened to God's servants unless they drink wine, and should they do so, God will remove His support from them, and thus Satan will make friend with them, dwelling in their ears and eyes to push them towards all evils and keep them away from all the good.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The reduction in your servant's tasks will be a reward added to your book of deeds in the Day of Doom.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The refractoriness of a child in childhood will result in the development of his intellect in adulthood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The reward of the one who donates something in affluence does not exceed that of the needy receiver.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The rewards of the fallowing seven will reach one after death and will continue unceasingly: teaching a stream of wader flow, digging a well, planting a date- palm, building a mosque, endowing a mosque, endowing the Book of God, and leaving behind a child to ask God's forgiveness for him (her).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The richest of all people is the one who is free from avarice.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The right of God on every Muslim is that the latter should bathe himself (herself) once a week (at least).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The robbed accuse the innocent so much that their sins turn out to weigh over those of the thief.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The satan of a young man who marries at his prime of youth, cries out: woe is him! He saved his (religious) faith from me.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The seekers of knowledge will not feel satiated until they finally enter Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The share of every one of you from this world is as much as a passenger's provision.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The sightless are not blind; the insightless are blind.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The sign of loving the Exalted God is interest in remembering Him, and the sign of hating the Greatest and the most Powerful God is unwillingness towards His remembrance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The similitude of me to you is that of a man who has made a fire and tries to save locusts and butterflies from falling into it. I'm (in fact, firmly) holding your girdles to save you from fire, but you try to release yourselves from my hands.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The similitude of my household is the similitude of the Ark of Noah, saving those who get on board and leaving to drown those who don't.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The similitude of the world is the similitude of man' food is. See what finally happens to it, even though more and more he salts and spices it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The simplest form of bribe is like unto marrying one's own mother, and the worst form is like unto talking with the purpose to damage the honor of one's brother (in faith).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The slip of the learned will before long become overt, and that of the ignorant with his ignorance will be covered.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The son of Adam commits most of his sins through his tongue.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The son of Adam has an unavoidable share in adultery. Looking lustfully, listening to evil talks, uttering bad words, encroaching upon people's property, walking in unlawful ways, having carnal desires and wants, and acting upon such desires while denying it are respectively the adultery of his eyes, ears, tongue, hands, feet, heart and privy parts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The son of Adam hates two things: death which is better for him than sedition, and shortage of wealth which entails easier reckoning (in the Hereafter).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The son of Adam reaches old age but two of his traits grow young: greed for wealth and greed for life.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The son of Adam reaches old age with two things staying with him: avarice and ambition.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The statement, I will take all my right and will not leave any part of it to anybody, suffices to show one's stinginess.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The steadfast pillars of Islam will collapse one by one. Whenever one collapses, people will hang onto another, with God's commands being the first and prayers being the last to collapse.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The story of the world and me is like unto a horseman who sleeps under the shade of a tree in a hot day, then sets out and leaves there.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The superiority of a learned man over a (simple) worshipper is like unto that of the full moon over other stars.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The superiority of a learned man over a (simple) worshipper is (to the extent of) seventy degrees, with the distance between each two degrees as far as heavens from the earth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The superiority of a learned man over a (simple) worshipper is like unto mine over my people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The superiority of a learned man over an ordinary one is like unto that of a prophet over his people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The superiority of the learned over (simple) worshippers is like unto mine over the lowest among you (in rank.) Verily, the Greatest and the most Powerful God, His angels, the dwellers of heavens and the earth, and even ants in their holes as well as fish, all pray for the one who teaches people (the ways to) goodness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The superiority of the pious youth who have started worshipping God from early childhood over the aged who have done so only after old age is like unto that of the prophets over ordinary men.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The testimony of a Bedouin concerning a citizen is not valid.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The thankless to people are thankless to God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The treasures of good and evil are with God, and its keys are men. So, blessed is the one whom God has made the key to good and the lock for evil, and woe is the one whom God has made the key to evil and the lock for good.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The truest dream can be dreamt at dawn.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The validity of a letter lies in its seal.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The value of everything lies in what it entails.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The virtue of knowledge weighs over that of worship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The virtuous doesn't do dubious deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The water- carrier of a tribe should drink last.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The weakest of all people is the one who is incapable of performing worldly tasks, and the most stingy of all is he who hesitates to greet others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The wicked have been created wicked in their mothers' wombs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The wicked will not attain the status of the pious, just as thorns do not fruit grape. Thus, go whatever way you wish, for you will (finally) arrive at the rovers of the way you choose.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The wise are saved.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The wise tolerate the ignorant, forgive the cruel, show humility to inferiors and supersede superiors in doing good. They meditate before saying something- being it good, they express and enjoy it, and being it evil, they keep quiet and remain safe thereof.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The wisest of all people is the most moderate towards them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The women who are pregnant or have children, who milk their children and are kind to them and who set prayers, will enter Paradise if they don't treat their husbands badly.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The words of a judge amid two paths dwell, leading him to Paradise or Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The world and whatever it possesses are damnable, save bidding to good and forbidding evil as well as the remembrance of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The world and whatever it possesses are damnable, save that in which the most Powerful and Glorious God's consent is sought.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The world and whatever it possesses are damnable, save that which (is used) for God, the most Powerful and Glorious.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The world and whatever it possesses are damnable, save the remembrance of God and what it entails as well as teachers and learners.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The world is a piece of goods, and the best in it is a pious wife.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The world is believers' prison and unbelievers' Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The world is green and sweet. Whoever a lawful share of it earns and duly spends, will enjoy God's reward and in Paradise will dwell, and whoever an unlawful share of it earns and unduly spends, will be made by God to reside in Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The world is home for those without home and wealth for those without wealth, and unwise are those who amass wealth for worldly life.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The world is in the move. Your share of its benefits will reach you even if you are weak and your share of its losses you will not repel through your strength.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The world is sweat and green. Whoever takes of it a due share, blessed will it be for her (him). Many a man who plunges into their carnal desires and, in the Hereafter, no share will be theirs but fire!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst (form of) vilification is slandering people's fame and the worst type of slandering is lampooning others, and the narrator of lampoons is considered among the slanderers too.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst among my people is he who undertakes judgment but does not consult in case of being doubtful about (a case), who is proud of himself for issuing a sound judgment, and who acts harshly when roused to anger. Whoever writes down cases of evil is like unto the one who acts upon them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst among you are bachelors, and the most ignoble of your dead ones are bachelors too.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst food is the one served in feasts, to which the needless are called, not the needy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst food is the one served in feasts, to which the satiated are called, not the hungry.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst form of calamity is to be in need of what others have but refuse to give it to you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst of all affairs is originating heresy, the worst blindness is blind- heartedness, the worst repentance is that of death time, the worst regret is that of Doomsday, the worst edible thing is an orphan's property, and the worst business is usury.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst of all people are corrupt scholars.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst of all people are those who are hard on their families.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst of all people are those who do not offer what they are demanded in the name of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst of all people is a double- faced man who encounters a group of people with one face (i. e. external behavior) and another group with the other.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst of all people is he who hates others and is hated by them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst of all people is the one honored out of fear of his evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst of all people is the one who accuses God of having predestined (everything for his creatures.)
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst of all people is the one who barters his eternal life for his worldly one, and worse than him is the one who barters his eternal life for others' worldly lives.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst of man's attributes are excessive envy and intense fear.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst of my people are the boastful, garrulous ones, and the best of them are the most good- mannered.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst of people is he who eats alone, without sharing his food with his servants, who beats his servants, and worse than him is the one who neither forgives a fault nor accepts any excuse, and even worse is he whose good no one is hopeful about, and from whose evil and malice no one can find a way out.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst place (situation) in the Day of Judgement will belong to the one who frightens people through his tongue or evil (in this world.)
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worst places to sit in are roads and bazaars (markets).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worth of a Muslim's properties is as much as his blood's.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worthiest (form of) worship is the most hidden one.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: The worthiest of all people is the one who avoids interfering with what concerns him not.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There are four groups of people; namely, the munificent who feed themselves and others, the generous who feed others but not themselves, the miserly who feed themselves but not others, and the mean who neither feed themselves nor others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There are no better characteristics than the following two: having faith in God and being beneficial to God's creatures.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There are no sins like unto breaking the bonds of kinship, treachery and telling lie, for which the Exalted God will punish the sinners both here and in the Hereafter. The reward of keeping the bonds of kinship will be so quickly given to the one who acts upon it (in comparison to that of any other good deeds) that a corrupt family who observe it will (quickly) increase in wealth and number.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There are six good traits as follows: fighting God's foes with sword, keeping fast on summer's days, being well- patient when calamities befall, abandoning disputes, giving hidden charity; and making friends for God's sake.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There are things in Paradise not seen by any eyes, not heard by any ears and not felt by any hearts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There are three books of deeds (for people's doings): the book whose contents God will not forgive, i.e. the book of polytheism, the book to which God pays no attention, i.e. the book of man's evils to his own soul, of which he and his Lord are aware, e.g. breaking one's fasts and forsaking (obligatory) prayers which God will forgive should He will, and the book of which God will not forgive anything, i.e. men's oppressing each other, which has to be retaliated.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There are three kinds of neighbors: a neighbor who has the least claim on you- only one, a neighbor who has two claims on you, and a neighbor who has three claims. The first one is the polytheist neighbor who merely enjoys the right of neighborhood but not that of kinship, the second one is the Muslim neighbor who enjoys the right of neighborhood as well as that of Islam, and the third one is the Muslim relative neighbor who enjoys the rights of Islam, neighborhood and kinship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There are two kinds of debts: the one which man intends to repay, but before doing so he passes away, which I (the Holy Prophet) will compensate for, and the one which man intends not to repay upon passing away, which will be refunded through his good deeds in the Last Day when he has no Dinar or Dirham.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is a right for a beggar, though coming on horseback.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is no barrier between God and two sorts of prayers: the prayers of the oppressed and the prayers of one for his absent brother (in faith).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is no barrier between Hell and three groups of people: those who twit others for favors, those with whom their parents are dissatisfied, and drunkards.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is no calamity (trial) harder than polytheism for God's servants; other than that, there is no calamity harder than blindness, and whoever is afflicted with it but keeps patient, would be blessed by God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is no charity better than (uttering) good words.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is no charity more favorable to God than a word of truth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is no distance, save abandoning prayer, between a servant of God and polytheism, i.e. as soon as one abandons prayer, he turns out to be a polytheist.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is no intellect as wisdom, no abstinence as self- control, and no dignity as good- temper.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is no malady worse than being stingy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is no organ (of the body) complaining not about the harms of the tongue.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is no poverty harder than ignorance, no wealth more profitable than wisdom, no loneliness more frightening than vanity, no dignity as good- temper, and no worship as meditation. There is no support firmer than consultation, and no faith like unto modesty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is no precious gift for a Muslim's fellow than a piece of wise saying through which God brightens the latter's way or from danger keeps him away.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is no retribution quicker than the one for oppression.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is no reward but Paradise for an accepted pilgrimage to Mecca.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is no reward not saved by God, and no (true) deed not based on (good) intention.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There is no way to apology after death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There was a businessman who always advised his young son to be Merciful to the poor in hope of God's Mercy. Then, he died, and God bestowed his Mercy upon him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: There will be times of anarchy prior to the Hour (the Resurrection).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: They have the upper hand- women, I mean.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: This evil suffices a man to be notorious in worldly or otherworldly affairs, save him whom God saves.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: This religion will be consolidated by people who have no avail of divine grace. The end of the times will face a reduction in people's faith, false accusations and metamorphosis, when musicians and hairdressers abound in number and drinking wine is made lawful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: This religion will permanently be steadfast, and a group of Muslims will (always) fight for it to the Day of Resurrection.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: This world compared to the next is like unto what one of you picks up from the sea when touching it with his forefinger.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: This world is a ban for a spiritual man, and the next is a ban for a secular one, and this and the next worlds are forbidden for the friends of the Hidden.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: This world is like unto a garment torn thoroughly, hanging on an almost parting string.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: This world to the Hereafter is like unto sand to the sea.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: This world's duration is as long as seven days of the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Those servants of God whose neighbors are not safe against their evil, will not be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Those sitting together in remembrance of God, will not leave before they are told, Stand up, for God forgave you and changed your evils to good.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Those who are more learned than you, precede you in value.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Those who are under the reign of women will not reach salvation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Those who bear false witness will be resurrected hung on their tongues in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Those who sever the relations will not be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Those who call to prayer will be credited more than all people in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Those who eat and thank (God) are like unto those who fast and keep patient.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Those who possess two Dirhams or two Dinars will have to bear a severer account than those having one Dirham or one Dinar (in the Day of Judgement).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Those who pray and those who say `amen' are equally rewarded. This is true with those who recite and those who listen to the Quran as well as with teachers and students.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Those who seek knowledge for God's sake are superior to the strugglers in His way.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Those who will be first called to Paradise are praisers of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Though the bad deeds of someone might go to extremes, heas still his (her) eyes at his (her) disposal to shed tears (i.e. there is always an opportunity to repent).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three groups of people will converse with each other in safety under the shade of the Divine Throne, while others are being called to account: those who do not fear the blame of blamers in matters divine, those who do not extend their hands towards the unlawful, and those who connive at what God has made unlawful for them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three groups of people will never be allowed to Paradise: men who connive at their wives' unfaithfulness, women who pretend to be men, and drunkards.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three groups of people will not be allowed to Paradise: drunkards, those who break the bonds of kinship, and those who approve of sorcery.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three groups of people will not be allowed to Paradise: those with whom their parents are dissatisfied, those who connive at their wives' disloyalty, and women who pretend to be men.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three people have a claim on God to grant their prayers: a fast person till he breaks his fast, an oppressed person till he gains victory and a traveler till he returns home.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three people pray to the Great and Powerful God, but their prayers are not granted: a man who has a bad- tempered wife and divorces her not, a man who entrusts his property to someone without calling somebody to witness, and a man who entrusts his wealth to silly persons; and indeed, the All- mighty God has said, Do not entrust your wealth to the silly.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three people will converse with God in the Day of Judgement: he who refrains from tale bearing, he who never thinks of adultery, and he who does not allow usury in his job.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three persons are beloved of God and three persons are hated by Him. The former are those who hiddenly help a man whose request (for the sake of God, not kinship) to a group of people is rejected, who stand up to prayer and recitation of the Quran in the dark of night when their companions in trip lie their heads on earth to enjoy their most favorite sleep, and who stand against enemy in war to kill or to be killed, while their friends manage to escape. The latter are the adulterous old, the arrogant poor and the cruel rich.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three persons are loved by God, and three persons are hated by Him. The former are those who stand against an enemy to the point of death or victory for their friends, who walk on foot on a trip in the company of a group of people and at night, when they go to sleep, stand up to prayer till morning to wake them up for departure, and who tolerate their neighbors' annoyance to the time when death or trip set them apart. The latter are the traders who swear a lot, the arrogant poor and the twitting misers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three persons gave charity in the following way and were equal as far as (heavenly) reward is concerned, for each of them paid one tenth of his property indeed: one dinar out of ten dinars, one Ukiah (equal to dirhams) out of ten Uqiahs, and ten gold Uqiahs out of hundred gold Uqiahs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three persons ruin religion: a wrongdoing jurisprudent, a cruel leader and an ignorant struggler in religion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three persons will not avenge three others: a free man, a learned man and a powerful person in respect to a slave, an ignorant person and a weak man respectively.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things are among the greatest moral values: forgiving the one who has oppressed you, being generous to the one who has deprived you (of something), and joining the one who has disconnected relations with you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things are among the treasures of goodness: giving alms hiddenly, concealing calamity, and hesitating to complain (of me). God says: When I make My servant suffer a disease, and he keeps patient, refusing to complain about me before his visitors, I will offer him flesh and blood better than his own. Thus, should I restore him to life, he will be freed from all his sins, and should I take back his soul, he will be led to My Mercy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things are among the treasures of goodness: hiding pains, calamities and diseases. He who publicizes his calamity, patient can never be.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things are among the world's blessings, although the world is basically bereft of any (real) blessings: a well- branded horse (or camel), a pious wife, and a big house.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things are characteristic of a hypocrite: he feels happy when among people' he feels sad when lonely, and he likes to be admired in all his affairs
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things are characteristic of a hypocrite: telling lie, breaking one's promises and committing treachery in trusts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things are hung up from the divine Throne: kinship which says, O God!I 'm dependent on you, let me not be disconnected, trusteeship which says, O God! I'm dependent on you; let me not be violated, and blessing which says: O God! I'm dependent on you, let me not be subjected to ungratefulness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things are inherent in my people: suspicion, jealousy and divination. When suspicion came unto you, do not consider it true; when jealousy picks, from God forgiveness seek; and when you managed to presage disregard it and proceed in your passage.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things are necessary for every Muslim: Friday ritual bathing, brushing one's teeth and applying odors.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things bring about blessings: time selling, lending money and mixing wheat with barley for consumption, not for bargain.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things bring happiness to a Muslim in this world: a pious neighbor, a vast house and a tamed horse.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)
