quotes.quote: Three things bring you prosperity and three things, adversity: the former being a pious wife whose presence makes you pleased and in whom you can trust as to her chastity as well as your property when you are absent from her, a swift animal which gives you a (quick) ride to join your companions, and a vast, spacious house; and the latter being a wife whose presence makes you displeased, who extends her tongue at you and in whom you can not trust as to her chastity as well as your property when you are absent from her, a slow animal which makes you suffer if you beat it and carries you not to your destination if you leave it on its own, and a small unspacious house.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things enlighten one's eyes: watching green (plants), looking at current water, and catching sight of beautiful faces.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things follow a dead person, two of which to return and one to stay- family and property return and deeds stay with him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things I know will definitely come true: the Exalted God will add to the dignity of the one who connives at the oppressions having been brought on him, will expand the poverty of the one who stretches his hand of need towards others out of excessive wishes, and will increase the wealth of the one who gives charity for the sake of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things lead to prosperity: controlling one's tongue, shedding tears for one's sins, and being good- tempered at home.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things make a servant (of God) realise his worldly and otherworldly requests: keeping patient in calamities, being pleased with one's destiny and praying at times of prosperity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things make of man a perfect being: fearing not the blame of blamers in matters divine, refraining from dissimulation in his actions, and preferring eternal affairs to worldly ones when they co- occur.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things originate from true faith: generosity in poverty, observance of justice (even if it brings you loss), and sacrifice in teaching for (the sake of) learners.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things purify your friend's love (for you): honoring him in visits with greetings, finding him a seat in meetings and calling him by his best names.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things ruin and three things save you. They are respectively as follows: the misery acted upon, the passion being depended on and self- conceit; and fear of God in public and privacy, moderateness in wealth and poverty, and justice in anger and pleasure.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things show one's hypocrisy though one might set prayer, keep fast, and make minor or major pilgrimages to Mecca: telling lie, breaking promises and being treacherous to trusts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Three things will finally come back to their holders (doers): oppression, deceit and breach of promises.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Throw earth at the flatteres' face.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Thunder is one of the divine angels with mastery over clouds and with fiery scourges to push them wherever God wishes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Times of discomfort here sweeps away times of discomfort in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: To be a (true) believer, wish for others what you wish for yourself, and to be a (true) Muslim, be kind to your neighbors.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: To be loved by God, spread the love of Him among people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: To God, the most favorite food is the one which satiates many (in the neighborhood).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: To God, the most High, the best hobbies are horsemanship, and archery.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: To me, the most prosperous person is a believer who has less dependence, availing himself more of prayer, who enjoys sufficient sustenance with which he keeps satisfied till he joins God, who worships his Lord in the best manner and away from people's sight, and who leaves less behind when he dies and less people offer him their cries.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: To most people, two conditions are the best: health and rest.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: To rich people pay less frequent visits, for appreciating God's blessings brings you more benefits.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Tolerating a learned man is harder for Satan than that of a thousand (simple) worshippers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Toleration entails abundance and blessing, and those lacking it are devoid of any good. Toleration is the basis of wisdom (indeed).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Toleration is auspiciousness, and violation, inauspiciousness, and when God wishes good for the members of a family, He opens on them the gate of toleration, for it leads to adoration in everything it occurs, while violation is the cause of humiliation wherever it befalls.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Toleration is the basis of wisdom.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Touch the earth, for it is kind to you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Traders await sustenance, and hoarders of foodstuff await (people's) curse.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Trading wine is unlawful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Transferring knowledge to incompetent people is like unto hanging pearl and gold on pigs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Travel to find health and sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Travel to find rest and riches.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Traveling is a pieced (kind) of suffering.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Treachery results in poverty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Treat women well. Verily, women have been created out of a crooked rib with its most crooked part being the upper one. Wishing to remove the crookedness, you will break it, and refraining to do so, it will remain as it is. So, treat women well.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Treating people moderately is charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Treating people moderately is half of (one's) faith, and being lenient to them is half of (one's) pleasure.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Troubles, diseases and griefs are this world's punishments.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: True faith lies in advice.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Truth of the tongue leads to truth of the heart and that, in turn, leads to truth of one's faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Truthfulness is a heavenly act. When a man tells the truth, he is led to do good which will (in turn) lead him to safety, and this will lead him to Paradise. Telling lie (on the contrary) is a hellish act. When a man tells lie, he is led to wrongdoing, which will (in turn) lead him to disbelief, and this will direct him to Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Truthfulness is peace; lying is anxiety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Try to be kind, for a kind person wants people to be at good and in abundance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Try to get rid of sorrows for worldly matters, for he whose greatest sorrows turn round material concerns will receive more wealth but poor will he remain, and he whose greatest worries concern otherworldly issues will face the Exalted God's management of his affairs as well as needlessness of his heart.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two (groups of) judges will dwell in Hell and one in Paradise: the one who recognizes the truth and judges according to it will reside in Paradise, but the one who knows the truth and deviates from it knowingly as well as the one who judges unknowingly will both be the dwellers of Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two (real) friends enjoy each other's company.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two brothers are like unto two hands, one bathing the other.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two characteristics do not dwell in a believer: avarice and ill- temper.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two groups of people will be the most remorseful in the Day of Judgement: a man who has all possibilities at his disposal to acquire knowledge but he doesn't, and a man who teaches (some sort of) knowledge to others, thereby providing benefit for everybody who comes to know about it, save himself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two groups of people will lead people to righteousness or wickedness, should they turn out to be righteous or wicked themselves: scholars and rulers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two groups of people will not be bestowed the divine mercy in the Resurrection: those who break off relations with their men and those who mistreat their neighbors.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two hungry persons will never be satiated: the seeker of knowledge and the seeker of wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two hungry wolves in a sheepfold are less dangerous to the sheep than ambition for position and wealth to a Muslim's faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two persons are preferable to one, three preferable to two and four preferable to three; so you have to gain the community of people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two sets of eyes will be safe against the fire of Hell: the eyes having shed tears out of God's fear, and the eyes having remained awake to watch Islam and Muslims against unbelievers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two sorts of deeds differ widely (from one another): one with its pleasures gone and consequences left, and one with its hardships to vanish and rewards never to finish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two sorts of drunkenness (can (make you negligent: that of loving life (excessively), and that of loving ignorance- and that's when you do not bid to good and do not forbid evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two things are amazing: a silly man's wise sayings, which you have to welcome, and a wise man's bad words which you should ignore.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two things are penalized (by God) in this world: tyranny and ungratefulness to parents.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two things entice me out of the world you love: sweet smell and women, but my utmost pleasure in prayers lies.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two things I have left with you to stop you going astray: the Book of God and my way (of life). They will remain inseparable to join me by the Pool (in the Resurrection Day).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two units of prayer by a married person weigh over eighty- two units by a bachelor.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two units of prayer by a married person weigh over seventy units by a bachelor.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two units of prayer by the learned weigh over seventy units by laymen.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two units of prayer by the one who knows God (well) weigh over a thousand by the one who knows Him not.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two units of prayer by the pious weigh over a thousand by the impious.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Two units of prayer set with brushed teeth weigh over seventy units unbrushed, one case of praying privacy is better than seventy cases in public, and a covert act of charity excels seventy overt ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Tyranny is of three kinds: one which God does not forgive, i.e. polytheism, God says, Verily, polytheism is great injustice, one which God forgives, i.e. people's oppressing their own souls (of which God) and they themselves are aware), and one which God does not ignore, i.e. people doing injustice to one another.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Tyrants and their supporters (will be the dwellers) of the Fire.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Unhappily lived the one who came to know the (intentions of the) people, and happily lived among them he who knew them not.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Unite with each other and be not divided among yourselves, for it causes separation in your hearts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Unite with each other to have unity of hearts and keep company with one another to share a feeling of compassion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Unity fruits in mercy, and discord in distress.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Use olive as food and lubricant, for it is (the fruit) of the Blessed Tree.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Using perfume for other than one's husband, brings a woman shame and fire (of Hell).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Usury is of seventy three forms, the best being like unto committing adultery with one's own mother, and the worst being (like unto) aggression upon a Muslim's fame.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Usury might lead to gain, but finally ends in loss.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Vanity originates from ignoring the truth and belittling people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Veil yourself after having intercourse with your wives, and be not naked like unto camels.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verilt, the Exalted God is zealous and believers are too. God's zeal arises when a believer commits the unlawful of Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily good- temperedness wipes out sins as sunlight melts ice.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily should a servant of God be fond of the eternal life, the Exalted God will grant him sufficient wealth and fill his heart with richness, so that he will constantly live in needlessness; and should he be attached to the (material) world, the Exalted God will grant him abundance in wealth, but will appoint poverty ahead of him, so that he will constantly live a life of poverty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, (man's) heart is like unto a string hanging from a tree in a desert, which is turned upside down by wind.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, (men's) hearts are containers, and the best hearts are the most capacious (to contain the knowledge of God).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, (men's) hearts are within God's two fingers, changing them (as He wishes).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, (men's) hearts rust as iron. What chisels them ? they asked. Remembrance of death and recitation of the Quran, replied the Prophet (P. B. U. H).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, (one single) man makes a large circle in the company of his brothers and cousins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, a banner will be raised for the treacherous in the Day of Judgement, and someone will call out, this is the treachery of so and so, son of so and so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, a believer can through good- temperedness reach the status of those who keep fast during days and stand up to prayer at nights.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, a believer emaciates the Satan appointed for him (her) just as you make your camel skinny in journeys.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, a believer struggles in the way of God by his sword as well as his tongue.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, a group of my people seek the knowledge of religion, recite the Quran and say, We join rulers to avail ourselves of their worldly possessions and we keep our faith intact in their company, but this is impossible, for as quatted fruits nothing but thorn, nearness to rulers avails them nothing but vice.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, a man of dignity doesn't practice misery.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, a present man beholds things, which an absent one will not. (Hearsay is no witness.)
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, a scholar whom God stops enjoying his own knowledge, will suffer the most in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, adulterers will appear (in the Day of Judgement) with faces flamed with fire.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, all the good is perceptible through wisdom, and he who lacks wisdom is bereft of faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, alms given to a relative entail a double reward.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, among (good) habits is to accompany guests to the house gate.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, among God's servants are the ones whose swears will prove to be true should they swear by God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, among the claims of a child on his father is to teach him how to write, to choose him a good name and to take a wife for him when he reaches maturity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, among the good deeds and actions of a believer, which will rejoin him after death are: the knowledge spread, a righteous child, a Quran left as inheritance, a mosque built, a house made for the wayfarers, a stream flown by one's assistance and a share of one's wealth set aside for the poor when one is healthy and still alive.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, among the indications of a woman's felicity are the ease in her engagement and the scantiness of her dowry.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, among the means of (God's) forgiveness is greeting and well- speaking.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, among the means of (God's) forgiveness is to please one's faithful brethren.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, among the mines of piety is the acquisition of what you know not and adding it to what you know, for the reduction in knowledge enhancement will make it defective, and (s) he who avails himself (herself) less of his (her) knowledge, will fall short in learning what (s) he knows not.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, among the most capital sins is to usurp someone's properties, and paying a visit to patients is among good deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, among the prerequisites of faith are to please nobody through causing God's anger, to thank nobody for what God has given you, and to berate nobody for what He has withheld from you, for (the destined) sustenance will not increase through the avarice of the avaricious, nor does it decrease through the displeasure of the displeased.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, among the signs of one's perfection of faith is to observe some degrees of exception (probability) in whatever one says.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, among the signs of the Hour (the Resurrection) are the fall of knowledge and the rise of ignorance, the prevalence of adultery, drinking wine and the increase in the number of women over men to the extent that one man might remain as the guardian of fifty women.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, an example of extravagance is to eat whatever one likes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, anger belongs to Satan, Satan was created from fire, and fire is put out by water. Therefore, make ablution when you are raised into anger.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, answering a letter is a must just as you have to reply greetings.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, being optimistic about God is an indication of being a good worshipper of Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, being pleased with what the seekers of knowledge seek, angels spread their wings in modesty for them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, believers should sorrowful at each other's suffering remain just as body feels head's pain.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, believers will be rewarded for all they expend, save what they amass under the ground or spend for building (a house).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, changing man's nature is like unto changing his outward creation. If you can change the latter, you will be able to change the former.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, charity adds to one's wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, charity pacifies God's wrath and wards off bad death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, charity reduces the charity givers' heat of grave, and believers will rest under the shade of their charity in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, chastity and faith are interrelated, when one fades, the other lasts on more.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, children are the cause of man's misery, fear, ignorance and sorrow.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, committing sins deprives man of his sustenance; divine decree is not changed but through praying and long life is not gained save by kindness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, creditors have dominance over debtors until their debts are paid.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, each of you is the mirror of your brothers (in faith), i.e. discovering any defect in them, you should (try to) rub it off.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, entrance to Paradise is in pledge of striking swords.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, every religion has a characteristic feature, and mine is characterized by chastity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, every tree has a (kind of) fruit, and the fruit of heart is a child.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, everything has a reality, and servants of God will not find access to the reality of faith unless they come to know that what has occurred to them or has not, has been out of necessity and unpreventable.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, evil eyes send man to his grave, and for the camel the path to table they pave.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, faith grows old in you, as your dress turns worn on you. So, ask the Exalted God to enliven faith in your hearts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, for every people there is a trial, and wealth is my people's trial.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, for every traveler there is a destination, and man's destination is death. Remember God, therefore, for it easifies your affairs and makes you fond of the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, for everything there is a basis and the basis of this religion (Islam) is knowledge, and one single holder of knowledge is more harmful to Satan than one thousand simple men of worship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, for everything there is a mine, and the mine of piety is the mystics' hearts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, fortune- tellers will be expelled to Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, friends are holders of the Exalted God's trusts and thus, they are not allowed to reveal each other's secrets.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, friendship and enmity are both inheritable.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God addresses the least chastised dweller of Hell, asking: Had you possessed all things on the earth, would you have bargained them with your release? Yes, she (he) replies. God says, When you were in the loins of Adam, I asked you to do something easier, i.e.taking nobody as a partner for Me, but you didn 't act upon it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God afflicts His faithful servant with a disease to let him find (of all his sins) release.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God bestows the world (on His servants) on account of their want of the next world, but bestows not the next world on account of their want of this world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God decrees low and high prices.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God detests a woman who falsely attributes a child to a people, and will not let her to Paradise. (In like manner), God keeps distance with a man who denies his relationship with his own child while being worried about him, and will put him to disgrace among the first and the last in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God detests cheeky beggars.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God detests the adulterous old, the cruel rich and the arrogant poor.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God detests those who are expert in worldly affairs but ignorant about otherworldly matters.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God does not accept (His) servants' deeds unless He gets satisfied with their words.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God does not give rise to any disease unless He first offers its cure.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God enlivens dead hearts by the light of wisdom as he refreshes the earth by the rain of heavens.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God gets satisfied with the servants who eat and drink and are thankful to Him for that.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God gives dominance over the son of Adam to the one whom he fears. If he feared no one except God, He would save him from such dominance. (In like manner), God leaves the son of Adam on the one whom he is hopeful about.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God has (special) angels on the earth, who speak as men speak and who report men's good and evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God has an (special) angel who calls out at the time of all prayers: Rise up, O sons of Adam! And put out by prayer the fire you have set your souls at.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God has blessed the demand for which a man prays a lot, being it granted or not.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God has created some of His servant for the settlements of people's needs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God has forbidden repentance for all heretics.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God has forbidden three groups of people to be allowed to Paradise: drunkards, those with whom their parents are dissatisfied, and those who connive at their wives' unfaithfulness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God has forbidden you to engage in idle talks.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God has forgiven for my sake the faults, and oblivion of my people as well as their deeds done out of helplessness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God has not given rise to any disease unless He has first offered its cure, save old age.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God has not given rise to any disease unless He has first offered its cure, (whether or not people know about it) save death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God has purified this religion (Islam) for Himself. It gets along with nothing but generosity and good- temperedness and thus, you should adorn your religion with these two.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God has sent me revelation on being humble to such an extent that no one (can) pride over another and no one (can) oppress another.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God has some servants who are able to know the inner character of people through cleverness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God has the claim on making something descend after having let it ascend.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God has trusted in some people blessings which they continue to hold as long as they use them to settle people's needs, but which are transferred to others as soon as they stop doing so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God is bashful to make hopeless a servant who has lifted his hands towards Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God is heedful of the tongues of all who talk and thus, (God's) servants should fear Him and care for what they say.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God is not Merciful to anybody but the Merciful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God is so just that He will not punish again a servant who has been punished in the world for his sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God is zealous about a Muslim and he should be zealous as well.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God likes people to do what He has made lawful as He likes them to connive at what He has made unlawful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God likes to see the effect of His blessings on the blessed, and detests poverty and declaring it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God loves an eye which is acute and critical at times of passion and sharp at time of suspicion. He loves generosity even if it is a date, and loves bravery even if it is killing a snake.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God loves noble affairs and detests cheap matters.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God loves sad hearts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God loves the unknown pious, benevolent people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God loves the youth who spend their lives in the worship of Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God loves those who insist in praying.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God out of his wisdom and grace has coupled rest and happiness with certainty and satisfaction, and sorrow and care with uncertainty and anger.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God showers Mercy on His Merciful servants.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God wards off seventy forms of bad death through charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God will bestow on you things better than what you connive at out of fear of Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God will not call to account a joker who is truthful in his joking.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God will support this religion through a sinful man.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God's forgiveness for man in this world is the concealment of his sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, God's Mercy will not shower on a nation among whom one has broken off ties of kinship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, he who asks nothing from God, will experience His wrath.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, he who eats and thanks will be rewarded the same as a fast, patient man.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, he who is pleased with someone's manners and deeds is like unto him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, he who makes the lawful unlawful is like unto the one who does the reverse.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, he who uses gold and silver containers for eating and drinking, fills his belly with the fire of Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, Hell will be the abode of tax- takers (of oppressive rulers).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, hidden charity quenches God' wrath, kindness to prolongs one's life, and benevolent deeds stop tragic death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, hope is God's blessing for my people. Were there no hope, no mother would (be inclined to) milk her child and nobody would (like to) plant a tree.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, humility adds nothing but sublimity to (God's) servants; thus be humble, and God will make you sublime, forgiveness adds nothing but dignity to (God's) servants; thus be a forgiver, and God will grant you dignity, and charity adds nothing but excess to one's wealth; thus give something in charity, and God will increase (your wealth).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, I am a human being like you, and doing right and wrong is quite presumable; but what I tell you is God's and I never belie Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, I am a human being like you, and you leave your cases to me for judgment. It may happen that one of you is able to express his reasons better than his party and based on that, I may issue a judgment in favor of him. (Know that) whoever takes a Muslim's right through my (incorrect) judgment, possesses a flame of Hell (in reality). He can with it abide or leave it aside.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, I am a human being like you. So, put to effect what I order you on account of the religion (Islam), but when I give you orders out of my own will, (know that) I am a human being.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, I am just as one of you in what is not revealed to me.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, I am not commissioned to dig through people's hearts or to split their minds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, I am not worried about what you know not, but see how you practice what you know.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, I am worried about my people as to three things to happen after my death: fall of the learned, rule of tyrants and indulgence in caprice.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, I detest a woman who leaves home, walking non- chalantly to complain about her husband.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, I warn you strictly about the rights of two classes: orphans and women.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, I was appointed (to prophethood) for the perfection of moral virtues.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, in Paradise there are one hundred places of residence, each so vast to contain the entire population of the world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, in Paradise there are things which have never been seen or heard, and have never to anyone's mind occurred.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, in Paradise there is a bazaar wherein nothing is bargained save pictures of men and women, and as soon as one becomes fond of a picture, he (she) turns like unto it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, in Paradise there is a house called `house of happiness' where nobody will be given entrance save those who have pleased the believers' orphans.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, in Paradise there is a status, which nobody reaches save the distressed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, inventing lies about me is not tantamount to that about others and thus, whoever belies me purposefully, will reside in Fire (in the Hereafter).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, ironic remarks save one from telling lie.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, Islam is (the religion of) cleanliness. Be clean, therefore, for nobody is given entrance to Paradise save the clean ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, Islam is free from vilification and scurrility, and the best Muslims are the best of them in good manners.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, Islam was lonesome in its infancy and will become lonesome again in future, and how nice for the lonely ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, it would be better for your offspring to be rich than poor after you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, jealousy eats up one's good deeds just as fire swallows firewood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, just judges will be called to account in the Day of Judgement and their accounts are so severely checked that they wish not to have passed judgment between two men concerning even a single date.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, keeping one's promise is indicative of having faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, kindness and observation of bonds of kinship prolong one's life, make lands flourish and add to one's properties, even though those who act upon these two are evildoers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, long life and being gifted a chance by God to repent are indicative of one's prosperity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, man lives between two days- a past and finished day, for which his deeds have been recorded, and a day left which he may not join. How does he know?
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, man will face shame in the Day of Judgement to such an extent that he will implore to God to send him to Hell as a better alternative, although he is aware of the severity of the infernal chastisement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, man's heart is like unto a sparrow. It changes seven times a day.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, manners belong to the Exalted God. When He wishes good for someone, He bestows good manners on him, and when He wishes evil for someone, He provides him with unpleasant manners.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, most of the dwellers of Hell will be those who have committed sins through their tongues and private parts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, most of the dwellers of Paradise are fools.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, most of the dwellers of Paradise will be the pious and the good- tempered.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, much more than anything else, I am worried about my (Islamic) nation as to what the people of Lot acted upon.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, much more that anything else, I am anxious about my (Islamic) nation as to the glib- tongued hypocrites.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, much more that anything else, I am anxious about my nation as to polytheism. I don't say that they worship the Moon, the Sun or idols, but that they perform actions for other than God, and indulge themselves in passions in privacy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, much more that anything else, I am worried about my (Islamic) nation as to misleading leaders.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, my Lord has ordered me in remembrance of Him to talk and to use my sight as a gazing stock.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, next to the capital sins prohibited by God is the greatest of man's vices, i.e. to die while leaving his debts unpaid.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, nothing (should) be more respectful to a woman than her husband.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, nothing better than good morals have been bestowed on people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, nothing is left over the world save sedition and calamities.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, nothing makes water defiled save what can change its smell, taste and color.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, observation of bonds of kinship will be rewarded sooner than all forms of kindness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, patience in (facing) the first harm is the real one.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, people will arrive at the Resurrection in company of their intentions.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, prayerers knock at the Lord's door, and whoever knocks at a door unceasingly, will find a way (to the house) finally.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, prosperous is he who has been granted wisdom.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, prosperous is the one who keeps aloof from sedition, and remains tolerant when afflicted with troubles.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, prosperous is the one who purifies his faith, makes his heart peaceful, his tongue truthful, his soul confident, his temper good, and his ears and eyes keen.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, refrain from three traits: Jealousy, avarice and vanity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, remembrance of God weighs over dispensing one's wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, Satan accompanies one and keeps distance with two.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, Satan approaches one of you and asks, Who has created you? And you reply, God, then, he asks, Who has created God? When this occurs to any one of you, say, I believe in God and in His Messenger and thus, such a thought fades away.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, Satan enjoys nearness to man and angels do too. The former suggests (to him) calling to evil and belying the truth, while the latter suggest calling to good and accepting the truth. Thus, whoever feels the second state of affairs should know that it is divine, and whoever finds in himself the first, should take refuge in God from the Satan.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, Satan flows like blood in man's body.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, Satan loves red color, and thus (you should) avoid it and avoid any dress, which makes you pretentious.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, Satan possesses (variegated) snares and traps which include being proud of the Exalted God's blessings, glorifying oneself for God's bounties, snubbing God's servants and following passions in matters not divine.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, Satan said, O Lord, I swear by your Glory that I will not fail to seduce your creatures as long as their souls run in their bodies, and the Lord said, By my Glory and Greatness that I will not fail to forgive them as long as they seek My Forgiveness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, Satan sends his strongest and most steadfast servants to deviate a man who performs good deeds through wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, Satan sets his throne on water and dispatches his groups (of satans) to every place, and those of whom who give rise to greater seditions are closer to him in residence. Then, one of his servants approaches him with a report of his great achievements, but Satan tells him that he has no great accomplishment. Then, another approaches him and reports of a man whom he has separated from his folk, and so Satan calls him to his close presence and tells him that he has achieved a lot.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, satans arrive at bazaars early in the morning with their banners, entering there with those who come earlier and leaving there with those who get out later than others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, sedition prevails to vanquish people, and only the learned can find a way out of it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, some people are the key to good and some others, the key to evil. Thus, how good for those on whom God has bestowed the key to good and how bad for those to whom He has given the key to evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, some sins cannot be wiped out through setting prayer; fasting and making minor or major pilgrimage to Mecca. They can only be wiped out through struggling to earn one's sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, some statements are enchanting, some poems contain wisdom, some sayings are defective and some ways of seeking knowledge lead to ignorance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, struggling in the way of God is the best of a believer's deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, sustenance looks for servants of God more than their death does.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, swearing ends either in disregard or regret.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the best (form of) kindness is to make friend with one's dead father's friends.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the best business is that of those merchants who do not tell lie when they speak, who do not betray trusteeships, who do not break their promises, who do not practice any procrastination in paying back their debts, who do not practice severity in demanding their claims, who do not exaggerate as to the quality of the goods they want to sell, and who do not underestimate the quality of the merchandise they want to buy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the best merit (for a man) is good- temperedness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the best servants of God are the keepers of promise and the users of perfume.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the cause of pride, which the seekers of the world, follow (in life), is wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the dead can recognize those who carry him (her), those who perform his (her) ceremonial wash and those who bury him (her).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the dwellers of Paradise see the residents of higher chambers as the stars you see in the sky.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God (asks) His believing servants to refrain from the world just as you make your patients refrain from eating and drinking, for you are worried about them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God (sometimes) lets a sinner benefit by his (her) sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God accepts (His) servants' repentace to the last moment of their lives.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God accepts charity, takes it in His right hand and brings it up (as you bring up your colt) until a morsel enlarges to the size of Mount Ohod.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God accepts none of (one's) deeds save what is sincerely done for Him, and for gaining His proximity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God admires a young person who keeps away from carnal desires.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God advises you thrice about your mothers and twice about your fathers, and He advises you first about your closer relatives.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God advises you to be kind to women, for they are your mothers, daughters and aunts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God appoints an angel for a (pregnant) mothere's womb, who reports the status of her embryo, saying, O God! now it is a drop of seed, now it is a clot, now it is a lump of flesh. Then, at the time of completing its creation by God's will, the angel asks, O Lord! Is it lucky or unlucky? Is it male or female? what is its sustenance and when is its death? The angel asks thus and God determineds the child's lot in the mother's womb.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God connives at the faults, oblivion and repulsive deeds of my people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God created His creatures in darkness and (then) threw His own light on them and therefore, whoever was at that time given a share of that light was guided and whoever was refused thus, was misled.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God created one hundred sets of mercy the day he created the heavens and earth, every one of which covering the distance between the earth and sky, and placed one of them on the earth for mothers to be kind to their children and for wild animals and birds to be used to each other. He has kept ninetynine sets of mercy for the Day of Judgement to be completed by the mentioned one.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God detests a seventy- year old man whose wishes and behavior are like unto a twenty- year old person.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God detests an unwise believer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God detests dirt and disorderliness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God detests foul- mouthed, scurrilous people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God detests the one who is stingy in life but becomes generous on the verge of death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God detests those who frown at their brethren's faces.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God dislikes divorce.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God does not ignore a believer's good deed and will reward it here and in the herafter, and a disbeliever enjoys the rewards of his good deeds here but doesn't have any good deed to avail himself of in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God does not punish any of His servants save a refractory one who rebels against Him and refuses to say, There is no god but Allah.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God forbids you to swear by your ancestors.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God grants help to the extent of one's need, and patience to the extent of one's calamity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God has appointed a group of His servants for goodness, making them lovers of it and lovers of acting upon it, guiding the seekers of it to them and making easy for them the task of doing good as He easily sends down rain to enliven barren lands and enliven people thereof; and He has made a group of His servants enemy of goodness, making them hate it and avoid acting upon it just as He avoids sending down rain to ruin lands and ruin people thereof.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God has appointed some of His servants to settle people's needs, to whom people resort for their requirements. These servants are safe against God's punishment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God has banned Hell for anybody who utters, `there is no god but Allah', and intends nothing but God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God has banned Paradise for the double- faced (hypocrites).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God has created (colored) Paradise white, and (thus) the most favorite colors to Him is white.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God has forgiven my people as to what occurs in their hearts, if not given expression to or acted upon.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God has likened the (material) world to the excrements of the son of Adam.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God has not appointed me to be fault- finding and trouble making but to be an easy- going teacher.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God has prescribed efforts for you. Make efforts, therefore.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God has prescribed for sons of Adam a share in adultery, which they commit willy nilly. The eye's adultery is an unlawful look and the tongue's, an illogical utterance. The (evil) soul requests (something) and invokes (man to answer it), and his private parts either put it into effect or not.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God has prescribed for women bearing rival wives, and for men struggling in the way of Him. So, any woman who, due to her faith in God, keeps patient in awaiting His reward for this suffering, will be rewarded as a martyr.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God has prescribed goodness, evil and whatever is there between them (for people). Thus, He will record a perfect reward for whoever intends to do good but falls short in doing that, and He will record for him ten to seven hundred (or more) rewards, if he puts it into effect. Also God will record a perfect reward for whoever intends to do evil but stops doing that, and He will record only one sin for him, if he puts it into effect. As such, whoever brings himself ruin, deserves it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God has special groups of people on whom He bestows His blessings to offer to His servants. He keeps His blessings with them as long as they practice generosity, but as soon as they turn out to be stingy, He withholds His blessings from them and shower them on others.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God hates men and women who marry a lot.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God hates scurrilous, foul- mouthed people as well as those who raise their voices in bazzars.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God hates the cruel rich, the arrogant poor and the ignorant aged.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God heeds not your wealth and appearence, but your hearts and deeds, He attends.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God informed the strugglers in (the Battle) of Badr, saying: Do whatever you wish, for I surely forgive you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God is a helping hand to a judge as long as he keeps away from purposeful injustice.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God is beautiful and loves beauty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God is chaste, loves glossing faults and loves secrecy. So, cover yourselves when you perform ceremonial washing.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God is conscious of the tongues of all who talk. Thus, (God's) servants should be virtuous and careful about what they say.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God is Forgiver and loves forgiveness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God is Fragrant and loves fragrance, is Clean and loves cleanliness, is Generous and loves generosity, and is Magnanimous and loves magnanimity. So, clean outside of your houses and be not like unto Jews.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God is Magnanimous and loves magnanimity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God is Moderate, loves moderateness, and through it He bestows (on people) things which he does not do through violence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God is pleased with ease, not hardship, for this Islamic nation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God is the most beautiful and loves beauty, is the most generous and loves generosity, and is the cleanest and loves cleanliness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God is the most generous and loves the generous. He loves high moral values and hates low morality.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God is the most kind and thus, you should try to be kind too.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God is the most modest and generous and thus, when a man raises his hands towards Him, (never) returns him hopeless and empty- handed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God is with a debter till he pays back his debts provided that He does not detest his borrowing.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God is Zealous and loves zeal.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God lets three people to Paradise on account of one single arrow: he who makes it with good intentions, he who shoots it and he who gives it to the shooter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God lets three people to Paradise on account of a loaf of bread, a handful of date and the like of them when benefiting the poor: the man of the house who issues the order, his wife who prepares what he orders and the servant who gives it to the poor person.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God loves broad- minded, easy- going people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God loves helping those who ask for help.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God loves his poor and chaste servants with a large family.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God loves His sensitive zealous servants.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God loves moderateness in all affairs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God loves skilled believers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God loves the pious, rich and Merciful servants.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God loves young penitent people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God prolongs man's lifetime on account of kindness to parents.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God provides his beloved servants with sufficient sustenance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God puts not to disgrace the one in whom of goodness there is a trace.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God sanctifies not a people who secure not the rights of the weak among themselves.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God says, I will be with partners( in a business) as long as one of them is not treacherous to the other, but as soon as this happens, I will abandon them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God says, Fasting is for Me, and I give its reward.The fast person enjoys a double happiness - at the time of fast - breaking and in the presence of God when he is rewarded.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God says, I am the best divider of the deeds of those who take a partner for Me, i.e. their deeds, great or small, belong to what they take as a partner for Me, (and) I am needless of that.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God says, I am with My servants as long as they remember Me and move their lips in My Name.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God says, I am with My servants ' opinions. If they have a good opinion of Me, they will face good, and if they have a bad opinion of Me, evil will they face.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God says, O son of Adam!Spend your time in My worship, and I will brim your chest with needlessness and remove poverty from you;otherwise, I will make you indulged in worldly affairs and leave poverty with you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God sleeps not, nor is sleeping apt for Him. He causes (people's) share to rise and fall. Nocturnal deeds are presented to Him before daily deeds, and daily deeds are presented to Him before nocturnal ones. A curtain of light covers Him. Should He remove this curtain, His light will cause to burn all the creatures towards Him their faces turn.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God takes pride in a young pious person over His angels, saying, see My servant conniving at his passions for My sake.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God wards off calamity from a hundred neighboring houses on account of a pious Muslim.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God who has created maladies has provided medicines too. (Try to) cure your diseases, therefore.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God will ask everybody about his subjects,i.e. having been saved or ruined. He even asks men about their households in like manner.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God will ask His servants about the increase of their knowledge as he will ask them about the excess of their wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God will cause to descend whatever people may cause to ascend (against His will).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God will subject to suffering, in the Day of Judgement, those who make people suffer in the world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God will support Islam through non- Muslim hands.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God would like you to observe justice in treating your children, even in kissing them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Exalted God would like you to perfect your deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the first reward for a believer after his (her) death is the forgiveness of God for all participants in his (her) burial procession.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the fool commit more sins on account of their foolishness than the debaucherous.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the good- doers in this world will be the good- doers in the Hereafter, just as the evildoers of here will be the evildoers of the Hereafter, and the good- doers will be the first group of people to enter Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Great, Powerful God loves a white lie and detests a sedition- inciting truth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the greatest liars will appear before the Resurrection. Avoid the company of them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the Holy Spirit inculcated the fact in my mind that nobody dies before a predetermined time and before receiving his (her) sustenance in full. So, fear God and be moderate in seeking your sustenance, and if it is left off, seek it not through unlawful means, for what is with God for you cannot be gained but through obedience to Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the hopeful for Paradise will enter it and the fearful of Hell will be saved from it. Verily, God's Mercy includes the Merciful alone.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the just (i.e. those who practice justice as to their judgments, their and their subordinates) will in the Day of Judgement stand on light pulpits in the presence of God, on His right side, and both His sides are right.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the knowledge, which nobody gains, is like unto a treasure, which untouched remains.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the knowledgeable (alone) know the knowledge of the knowledgeable.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the least number of the dwellers of Paradise are women.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the likeness of the learned on the earth is the likeness of the stars in the heavens through which people find their ways in the darkness of land and sea, but as soon as they disappear, the guided might lose their ways again.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the most beloved of you to me is the most good- tempered.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the most beloved servants of God to Him are those whom God has made lovers of good deeds and lovers of carrying them out.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the most capital sin to God is leaving one's dependents on their own.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the most detested servant of God to Him is an obstinate afreet who has faced no suffering as to his wealth and children.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the most favorite people to God are the kindest of them to His servants.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the most favorite people to God, the Exalted, and the closest of them to Him in the Day of Judgement are just leaders, and the most hated people and the farthest of them to Him are the unjust ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the most penitent of all people in the Day of Judgement will be the one who has bartered his eternal life for another's worldly life.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the most perfect prosperity is spending the entire life in worship of (and obedience to) God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the most perfected believer in faith is the most good- tempered and the kindest to one's family.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the most satiated of all people in this world, will starve the most in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the most stingy among people is he who hesitates to greet others, and the weakest is the one who falls short in praying.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the most thankful of all people is the one who is grateful to people the most.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the most truthful of all people believes in what others say the most, and the most untruthful of them denies what others say the most.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the most wicked people to God in the Resurrection Day are those who have lost their own eternal shares for others' worldly affairs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the most wretched of all wretched people is the one who enjoys poverty here coupled with punishment in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the oppressed are the prosperous in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the punishment of this (Muslim) people is given in this very world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the remedy to ignorance is asking questions.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the satiated people of this world will be the hungry ones of the next.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the seven skies and earths as well as mountains curse an old adulterer, and the fetid smell of an adulterer's privy parts will annoy the dwellers of Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the similitude of he who commits evil deeds followed by good deeds is the similitude of the one who has a tight armor on, exerting pressure on his breathing, who does something good causing one single chain to loose and then goes on doing so until the whole armor drops down.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the similitude of the one who requests back his gifts is the similitude of a dog which eats food to satiety, vomits it and then eats again what it has vomited.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the son of Adam is highly desirous for what is banned on him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the strongest handhold in Islam is to like and dislike for God's sake.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the value of deeds lies in (the doer's) intentions, and in their results.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the world is green and sweet, and God has made you (His) caliphs in it. He watches you to see how you act. Thus, as to the world, keep yourself intact and from women refrain, for the Sons of Israel's troubles began with matters concerning women.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the world is sweet and green, and God has placed you in it to see how you act.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the worst ones to God in the Day of Judgement are those with whom people keep distance due to their scurrility.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, the worst people to God in the Day of Judgement are those whom others fear the most (in this world).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, there is a claim on one's wealth besides poor rate.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, there is a door to Hell, which nobody passes through save those who quench their anger by committing sins against God's will.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, there is a door to repentance, vast to the extent of East from West, which gets closed only if the Sun happens to rise from the West.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, there is a house in Paradise called `house of the generous.'
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, there is a lump of flesh in the body, which will guide the whole body if guided aright, but will ruin the whole body if misled- - - it is man's heart.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, thighs are one's privy parts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, this (worldly) fire of yours is one of the seventy flames of the Fire of Hell which could not have been beneficial to you, had it not been extinguished twice with water. Verily, the worldly fire calls unto God to return it not to Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, this religion is firmly- based, wherein you should proceed without haste in order not to make the worship of God an object of hate, for an impatient wayfarer (can) neither hike a lot (in fact), nor can he keep his horse intact.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, those who engage in idle (false) talks the most will have the heaviest sins in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, those who love for God's sake will rest under the shade of the (Divine) Throne.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, three times God rejected my request, concerning (the forgiveness of) the killer of a believer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, through good- temperedness, servants (of God) can attain the status of fast persons who stand to prayer at nights.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, truthfulness leads (man) to kindness and leads (him) to Paradise; and man tells the truth (to the extent that) he is reckoned truthful in the presence of God, but falsehood leads (man) to wickedness, and wickedness leads (him) to Fire (of Hell); and man tells lie (to the extent that) he is reckoned a liar in the presence of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, venesection brings cure.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, water is (ceremonially) clean and nothing can make it defiled.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, wealth ruined your predecessors' health, and will (surely) cause you to melt.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, what equals a traveler's provision is sufficient for you in this world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, whatever is destined (for man) in mother's wombs will come to pass.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, when a servant (of God) commits a sin, a dark spot appears on his heart. If he abandons it, repents and asks God to forgive him, that darkness will be rubbed off his heart. But if he commits sins again, dark spots will increase in number to overdominate his whole heart. And it is this overdominace that the Exalted God mentions (in the Quran) when He says, No indeed;but what they were earning has rusted upon their hearts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, when God becomes enraged with a nation but He subjects them not to His punishment of metamorphosis or being swallowed by the earth, they will face high prices, drought and the rule of their wicked ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, when God bestows His blessing on a servant (of Him), He likes to see it apparent in him (her).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, when God destines something for a creature, his destiny will not change.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, when God makes the good of someone to be achieved by someone else, but the former shows no gratitude to the latter, he is actually not thankful to God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, when God wishes good for a people, He puts them to trial.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, when God wishes something to be done, He deprives the wise of their wisdom.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, When God wishes something to be done; He deprives men of their wisdom till His will gets accomplished. Then, He gives their wisdom back to them, and regret follows.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, when God wishes the fall of a servant, He makes him part with modesty and thus, he hates and is hated, thereby becoming bereft of trusteeship which makes him in turn to commit treachery and to be subjected to it as well, thereby turning out to be merciless which causes him to be stoned and damned and thus, freed from the yoke of Islam.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, when God, the Exalted, offers his blessing to a servant, He would like to see its effect on him (her), and He detests pretended poverty. He dislikes bold beggars and loves chaste servants who keep aloof from the unlawful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, when people come across a tyrant and do not stop him from oppression, God will undoubtedly punish them all (for his tyranny).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, when sending down a disaster from the heavens on the people of the earth, the Exalted God excludes the founders (and developers) of mosques.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, when the Exalted God created Mercy, He made it into a hundred parts, holding ninety- nine parts for Himself and bestowing the last part on all his creatures. Thus, were the unbelievers aware of the amount of Mercy kept with God, they would (never) be hopeless of (entering) Paradise, and were the believers aware of the extent of God's punishment, they would (never) feel immune of the Fire.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)
