quotes.quote: Verily, when the Exalted God loves a servant, He calls Gabriel and tells him about that, asking him to do so, and Gabriel does so and calls out in the heavens, saying verily, God loves so and so, you do the same, and the dwellers of the havens too start loving him (her), and as a result, that servant becomes a beloved to the dwellers of the earth as well, and when the Exalted God is displeased with a servant, the same happens, and that servant becomes an object of displeasure to the dwellers of the earth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, wisdom enhances the dignity of a noble man.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, women are married for their wealth, faith and beauty. Do marry a faithful woman.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, women come (upon you) and leave you in the guise of satans. Thus, when you see a woman who impresses you, approach you wife, for this causes the disappearance of what has occurred to your heart.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, women have a crooked mould. If you wish to remove this crookedness, you will ruin them. So, get along with them to continue living with them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, women have been created in such a way that can never in the straight path stay. If you get along with their perversion, that will be all right but if you wish to release them from crookedness (perversion), you will break them, and breaking means divorce.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, you cannot please people with your wealth. So, please them with your good manners.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, your best daily bread is the one earned through business, and your children are of your business.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, your Lord is pleased with (your) praises.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, your Lord loves (His servant's) praise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, your most pleasant food is the one cooked with fire.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, your mouths are paths of the Quran- brush them clean.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily, your predecessors' fall was due to the fact that they connived at the thieves of the nobility but punished the thieves of the poor.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Verily,in the Day of Judgement, the Exalted God will forgive the masses but not the elite for the same doings.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Victory follows patience, relief follows grief, and verily every difficulty is followed by ease.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wagering on horses is (religiously) permissible.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: War is deceit.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Washing dishes clean and cleaning courtyards cause needlessness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Watching green grass strengthens eyesight.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: We have four types of Jihad (struggling in the way of God): bidding to good, forbidding evil, being honest in times of patience, and detesting the wicked.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wealth will not decrease for giving alms, and God will increase the glory of whoever pardons (people's faults) and will uplift those who are humble to Him (or for His sake).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wealth will not decrease for giving alms.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wearing clean clothes and being pleased with little are among the pre- requisites of a believer's honor before God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: What a nice intercessor will be the Qur'an in the Day of Judgment for those who have availed themselves of it!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: What a nice stew is vinegar!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: What a nice support is wealth for man to keep him pious before God!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: What a nice wealth is a date palm, firm in the ground!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: What a strange status has a believer! All his deeds are to his good, and no one is like unto him in that. Should hardship befall him, he will keep thankful to God and that's to his good, and should he suffer sickness, he will keep patient and that's likewise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: What a strange status has a believer! I strongly swear by God that He does not decree for a believer a non- beneficial destiny.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: What do I have to do with the world? To it, am I like unto a traveler who rests a while under the shade of a tree but leaves it (finally).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: What do you expect from the world, save the wealth leading to rebellion, the poverty bringing about oblivion, the disease ending in corruption, the old age resulting in humiliation, and the death ruining (you) immediately?
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whatever a believer despises is calamity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whatever is decreed to come (occur) is close to us.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whatever of good you do to the rich or the poor is (a form of) charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whatever you dislike to utter in your brother's presence, is backbiting him (in essence).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a believer is afflicted with a suffering, he gets purified of sins just as iron gets refined of impurities in forge.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a dead person is buried, he can hear the walking sound of those leaving his (her) grave.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a door of goodness is opened to someone, he should make the most of it, for he will not know when it gets closed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a faithful, good- tempered man asked your daughter in marriage, marry her to him; otherwise, trouble and corruption will spread (everywhere) on the earth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a group of people falls into evil, they (extravagantly) decorate their mosques.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a guest comes upon a people, he is accompanied by his own sustenance, and when he leaves them, he is a company to (God's) forgiveness for them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a man casts a (kind) look at his wife, and the wife does the same, the Exalted God, casts a Merciful glance at them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a man dies, his good deeds come to an end save in three cases: continuous charity, beneficial knowledge and a pious child praying for him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a Muslim draws his sword against his brother (in faith), angels curse him till he sheathes it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a Muslim pays a visit to his brother in faith, he is actually walking in Paradise until he returns.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a needy man demands, put something in his hands, even if it is a burnt hoof.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a noble man of a people comes to you, treat him with respect.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a problem ascends to its peak, a solution will leak.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a ruler is filled with rage, Satan will dominate (him).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a scholar wishes to please the Exalted God by his knowledge, everything will stand in reverence to him, and when he wishes to pile up wealth through his knowledge, he will be dreadful of all things.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a servant (of God) dies, people ask, What did he put behind? and angels ask, What did he bring forth?
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a servant (of God) is negligent in carrying out his duties, God will afflict him with sorrow.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a servant of God commits adultery, faith leaves (his soul), stands as a shade above his head and returns (home) only when he abandons the action.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a servant of God fears Him, God makes everything fearful of him, and when he fears Him not, God makes him fearful of everything.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a sin is committed on the earth, he who is a witness to it but disagrees with it is like unto the one who has not seen it (at all), and he who does not see it but agrees with it is like unto the one who has been a witness to it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a sin is kept hidden, it hurts nobody but the sinner, and when it is unfolded and uncontrolled, it hurts everybody.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a woman says to her husband, You didn't do me any good, her good deeds fade away.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When a woman sleeps the whole night away from her husband's bed, the angels curse her to the break of dawn.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When an inexpert person is made responsible of doing something, bad results are to be awaited.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When anyone of you consults with his brother (in faith), the latter should offer him benevolent consultation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When anyone of you happens to lead the congregational prayer, he should set it as short as possible, for there might be children and aged, weak and sick or preoccupied people among the participants, and when anyone sets his own prayer individually, he can prolong it as he wishes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When anyone of you hires somebody, he should tell him how much his wage is.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When anyone of you is engaged in passing judgment among Muslims, he must avoid judging in anger and refrain from discrimination as to watching and pointing to the sides of quarrels, and as to their place of sitting (in the court).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When aroused by jealousy, keep away from tyranny, when fallen into suspicion, put it not into action, and when something you weigh, on it an extra amount lay.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When comes the end of Time, death culls out the good among my people just as you handpick the best of date.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When death makes of the learned a prey, as a martyr he passes away.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When doing something bad, do good (immediately), for good deeds make evil deeds vanish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When faced with severe hunger, take in a loaf of bread and a sip of water, and forget about the rest which the world contains.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God bestows a blessing on someone, and he praises God for it, his praise is better than that blessing though the latter might be greater in quantity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God comes to know about a servant's regret for his sins, He pardons him prior to his request for forgiveness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God covers up someone's sins in this world, He will not berate him for them in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God fills one's heart with the desire to marry a woman, he is allowed to have a glance at her.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God grants anyone of you much (lawfully- earned) wealth, he should give priority to himself and his household in spending it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God wills good for a people, He lengthens their lives and inspires gratitude (of Himself) in them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God wishes good for a family, He grants them wisdom in religion, respect of the younger for the elder, moderateness in living and temperance in spending and (in addition), He mirrors their faults to them to make them refrain from them, and when God wishes for a family other than these, He leaves them on their own.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God wishes good for a person, He grants him deep thought in religion.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God wishes good for his servant, He gives him punishment (for his wrongdoings) in this very world, and when He wills evil for him, He leaves off his sins to be punished in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God wishes good for somebody, He makes him suffer a calamity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God wishes good for someone, He grants him a deep understanding of religion, makes him heedless of the world, and discloses his defects for him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God wishes good for someone, He guides people towards him for their needs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God wishes good for someone, He makes the grateful avail his good deeds, and when He wishes evil for someone, He makes the ungrateful avail his good deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God wishes good for someone, He sets up needlessness in his soul, piety in his heart, and when the reverse He wishes, He makes poverty maneuver in his sight.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God wishes goodness for someone, He unlocks his heart and sets therein certainty and honesty, making his heart conscious of his behavior, giving him a peaceful mind, as sincere tongue, sound morality, heedful ears and watchful eyes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God wishes greatness for a people, He bestows munificence and chastity on them, and when his grace ceases to be theirs, He opens the doors of treachery to them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God wishes someone good, He grants him deep knowledge of religion and inspires him the right way of growth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When God, the Exalted, finished creating people, a relative rose. How come? God asked. The relative replied, I take refuge with You from the breach of the bonds of kinship. God asked (anew), Well! Will you turn content, should I join the one who joins you and leave the one who leaves you ? Yes, O Lord, replied the relative. God said, That 's yours.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When I grew up I started hating idols and poetry. I didn't wish to do what the people of the Age of Ignorance did, save in two cases when my God kept me intact, and no more.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When making your last will, leave only one third of your wealth to poor people, and one third is too much. It would be better if you could make your heir needless of people, rather than leaving them poor and in need of others. Whatever you spend in the way of God will be back to you as (heavenly) reward, even if it is the food you prepare for your wife.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When mourning comes upon Adam's son, all organs of his body bow down to his tongue, saying: Fear God in respect to us, for the good of our affairs depends on you if you move in the straight path, we will do likewise, and if you go astray, we will do too.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When my Lord, the Greatest and the most Powerful, took me to heavens, I saw a people who had copper nails scratching their faces and chests. I asked Gabriel who they were. He replied, They are those who eat people 's flesh (backbite them) and disgrace them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When one of you gets angry, he should sit down if in standing position, and lie (on the ground) if in sitting position.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When one's knowledge gives him no fruit, his ignorance burns his root.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When people talk ill of someone in a gathering, (try to) defend him, stop them doing so and leave there.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When sending me a messenger, send one with beauty of face and name.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When somebody invites you, accept (his invitation).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When somebody longs for something, he should be heedful of his (her) longing, for he knows not what of his (her) longing will be recorded in his (her) book of deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When someone dies, let him be at ease, and speak not badly of him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When someone goes on a pilgrimage to Mecca by means of unlawfully - earned money, God will reject and leave unanswered his invocation, O God!I accepted what you made lawful and unlawful, saying, yours failed and are back to you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When someone is back from a trip, he should have a souvenir with him (her), even if it is a piece of stone.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When someone of equal status (with you) asks your daughter in marriage, marry her to him and leave not her affair to coming events.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When someone tells you something while looking (worriedly) all around, you should hold his saying in trust.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When someone wants to sell his house, he should first offer it to his neighbors.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When someone's child dies, God asks His angels, Did you take back the soul of My servant's child? Yes we did, they reply. (Then), God asks, What did my servant say? The angels say: He praised you and said, from God we are and to Him shall we return. Then God says to His angels, Build my servant a house in Paradise and name it the house of praise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When the Exalted God created man, He prescribed for Him with His own hand `the priority of His mercy over His wrath' for Himself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When the Exalted God created the world, He turned away from it and looked not at it, for it was highly insignificant to Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When the learned and the righteous arrive at the Bridge (in the Last Day), the righteous are called to cross onto Paradise, while the learned are allowed to stop right there, interceding whomsoever they like, and thus the latter stands with the prophets.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When the sins of a God's servant increase in number, and his good deeds do not suffice to make amends for them, God will cause him to suffer grief instead.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When three people gather together, any two of them are not allowed to start talking without the participation of the third (unless they join other people), for this will bring the latter grief.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When three people gather together, it is not good for any two of them to whisper.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When two Muslims draw sword against one another, and one manages to kill the other, both will be put to Hell. The people asked, O Messenger of God! the case is clear as to the killer, but why is the killed treated as such ? The Holy Prophet replied: He too sought to kill the other party.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When two persons insult each other, the one who has begun (the game) is sinful, provided that the oppressed does not exceed his limits.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When two persons invite you simultaneously, accept the invitation of the one whose house is closer to yours, thus being your closer neighbor than the other, but if one of these two neighbors invites you sooner, accept his invitation (first).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When two persons whisper to each other, do not approach them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When usury and adultery spread out in a place, the residents of that place are (actually) bartering their doings for God's punishment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When you are deep in religion, the most good- natured of you are the best in Islam.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When you are told a mountain has left its place, believe in it; but when you hear someone has left his manners, believe it not; for man will finally return to his own nature.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When you brush your teeth, move the brush horizontally.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When you come across something you can not change, be patient and leave it to God for so doing.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When you conquered your enemy, forgive him out of thanksgiving for your power.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When you decide to do something, ask for God's grace seven times, and then see what you are inclined to, for your good lies surely in that.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When you decide to do something, meditate on its results. If it entails good results, perform it; otherwise, forget about it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When you face those overtaken by calamities, ask God (to grant you) health.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When you love one of your brethren, show your love to him, for this will strengthen your friendship and make it last longer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When you make a request to your brother (in faith), do not start with extolling him, for it puts a pressure on his back.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When you make friend with someone, try not dispute with him, nor to seek superiority over him, nor to inquire about him, for it may come to pass that you come across one of his foes who might cause discord between you by speaking ill of him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When you see breach of promise and weakness of trusteeship prevalent among people, (the Holy Prophet said with enveloped fingers), run a solitary life at home, control your tongue' practice what you know, leave aside what you know not, manage your personal affairs and keep away from people's business.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When you see God has subjected one of His servants to poverty and disease, know that He intends to purify him (of his sins).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When you see someone who is superior to you in beauty and wealth, think of someone who is inferior to you in these respects.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When you want to know about one's status to God, heed to what is said of him in his absence.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When your rulers are the benevolent, your rich men are the most generous and your affairs consulted among you, the back of the earth would better suit you than its depth, and when your rulers are the most wicked, your rich men are the most miserly and your affairs controlled by women, the depth of the earth would better suit you than its back.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: When your servant serves you a meal which he has prepared with lots of troubles, share the meal with him, or (at least) ask him to have a morsel or two.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whenever a human being or one of God's creatures eats the fruits of a tree, a good reward is recorded for the one who has planted the tree.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whenever Gabriel came to me urged me to brush my teeth, to the extent that I got worried of wearing away my gum.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whenever the Sun rises, two angels call out from its two sides, O Lord!Reward the generous and ruin the stingy as soon as possible.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: While weakness befalls an old man's body, his heart grows younger (eager) towards the love of long life and abundant wealth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever abandons shooting while knowing it well, loses one of (God's) blessings.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever abandons something merely for the sake of God, will in return receive things from God serving him better here and in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever abandons the (material) world, will be made knowledgeable and insightful by God without taking lessons.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever abides by the following three (before death), will be pardoned by the Exalted God for all his (her) sins: taking no partner with God, refraining from sorcery and following sorcerers, and harboring no grudges against brothers (in faith).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever abides by the following three, among the good ones will be: being satisfied with one's destiny, abstaining from heavenly- unlawful deeds, and becoming angry for the sake of the Great and Powerful God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever abides by the following three, perfected in faith and competent for heavenly reward will turn out to be: good manner by which to get along with people piety by which to keep away from heavenly- forbidden deeds, and forbearance by which to ward off the ignorance of the ignorant.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever abides by the following three, will be kept under the shade of Divine Throne the day when no shade but God's will prevail: making ablutions in trouble, walking towards mosque in darkness, and feeding the hungry.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever abides by the following three, will be perfected in attributes of faith: refraining from wrong when pleased, deviating not from right when crossed, and avoid seizing others' property when in power.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever abides by the following three, will face the exalted God's easy reckoning and will be allowed to Paradise with God's Mercy: bestowing upon the one who has deprived him (of something), forgiving the one who has wronged him, and joining the one who has broken the bonds of kinship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever abides by the following three, will receive vast heavenly support and mercy, and will be allowed to Paradise: thanking God when bestowed with blessings, forgiving (people) when in power, and slowness in action when crossed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever accompanies a tyrant, has committed a crime.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever accuses a believer of blasphemy, has actually killed him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever acts as a mediator before a man of power to solve a Muslim brother's problems or to do him some good, will be helped by God to pass over the Bridge the day when everybody slips.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever acts without knowledge, will cause more corruption than correction.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever among women asks her husband for divorce without reason, will not be allowed to enjoy the fragrance of Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever among women dies while her husband is pleased with her, will be given entrance to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever among women leaves home without her husband's consent will be subject to the Exalted God's anger until she returns or satisfies her husband.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever among women perfumes herself and leaves home to pass by a group of people to enjoy her pleasant smell, will be adulterous, and all eyes are adulterous.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever among women uncovers herself outside her husband's house, is actually tearing out the veil between herself and the Great, Powerful God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever among you is able to benefit his Muslim brothers, should do so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever among you is able to have a hidden reserve of good deeds must do so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever among you is able to provide a Muslim brother with a piece of dress, should do so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever among you is able to save one's face and faith with his wealth, should do so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever appoints someone a ruler to ten people, knowing that among them there is one superior to the former, has actually (tried) to deceive God, His Messenger as well as Muslims.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever argues about, without knowledge, in a dispute, will face God's anger till he abandons his arguments.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever asks forgiveness (from God), does not (in fact) insist in sins even if he commits seventy sins a day.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever asks goodness from God won't suffer despair, whoever counsels in his affairs won't regret, and whoever considers lawful the prohibitions in the Qur'an, does not believe in it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever assists a tyrant to suppress truth by his false nature will lose the support of God and His messenger.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever assists a tyrant, will be subjected by God to the domination of that tyrant.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever at kings' doors sets his goal, to seditions will he fall.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever avoids defaming people through his tongue, will receive God's forgiveness in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever avoids meddling with people's affairs, is a good Muslim.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever bears witness resulting in loss of a Muslim's property or shedding someone's blood will be surely put to Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever beats his bondservant in tyranny will suffer revenge in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever begs without need, will be like unto a drinker of wine, indeed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever begs without need, will suffer the agony of body and mind.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever belies intercession, will not enjoy it in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever believes in God and the Last Day, should either say something good or keep silent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever believes in God and the Last Day, should respect his neighbors.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever betrays a Moslem, wastes his wealth or plays a trick on him does not belong to us.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever blames a heretic will face God's security in the Day of the great horror (Judgment).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever blames his brother (in faith) for a sin, will not die unless he commits the same sin.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever borrows (something), intending not to give it back, will be resurrected by God as a thief.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever breaks off bonds of kinship or swears falsely, will face due penalty before death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever calls on diviners or soothsayers and confirm their sayings, has (actually) denied what has been descended on Muhammad.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever calls people to corruption will carry the same (burden of) sins as his followers, without any reduction befalling to the latter's burdens, and whoever calls people to guidance will enjoy the same rewards as his followers', without any reduction befalling to the latter's rewards.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever carries his own goods, is devoid of vanity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever casts a kind look at his brother (in faith), with no animosity in the heart, will be purged from his sins before turning back.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever casts an angry look at his father, is not (in fact) kind to him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever causes a loss (to people) will be made by God to sustain a loss, and whoever is hard on people will be treated harshly by God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever causes discord between a mother and her child, will be made by God to suffer discord between him and his friend in the Day of the Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever commits a folly or a sin, and then turns regretful, his regret is the atonement of his fault.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever commits adultery will be afflicted with adultery.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever commits adultery with a slave girl whose adultery has not been established, will be whipped by God with a fiery lash in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever commits adultery, loses his faith, but God will accept his repentance, if he repents.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever conceals knowledge from the seekers of knowledge will be harnessed with fire in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever consults (others) will not regret and whoever takes a middle course will not suffer poverty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever continues knocking at a door will finally find it opened.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever controls his tongue and privy parts, will be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever curses the one who has brought him cruelty, will end up in victory.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever deceives somebody's wife or slave, does not have any connection with us.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever deceives us, does not belong to us.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever dies in loneliness, is a martyr.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever dies will come up with regret, either of not having done more good deeds if he has been a good- doer, or of not having taken distance with evil if he has been a wrongdoer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever disdains God's authority, will be brought to contempt and whoever glorifies it, will be honored by Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever dissimulates in heavenly affairs for other than God, has actually turned away from Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever does any good to one among Abd- ul- Muttalib's family, but receives no reward from him, will receive compensation from Me in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever does evil, will suffer its recompense in this very world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever does not consider calamity as a blessing and excessive abundance as disaster, is not perfect in his faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever does not keep trusts is bereft of faith, and whoever does not keep his promises is irreligious.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever does not keep trusts is bereft of faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever does not lose control of himself when facing fear, anger and passion, will be saved by God against the Fire and Satan.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever does not properly recite the Qur'an does not belong to us.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever does not treat people with humility does not serve God in (all) humility.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever drinks wine will be resurrected thirsty in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever drives out a heretic, will receive from God full safety and faith in his heart.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever earns his living through his own physical efforts, is a friend of God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever earns unlawful money, will be made by God to lose it in difficulty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever enjoys moderation enjoys goodness, and whoever is deprived of moderation is bereft of goodness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever extends mercy, even about killing a sparrow, will receive God's Mercy in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever extends no mercy, will not receive God's Mercy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever fabricates heresy in our religion, is actually denying us.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever fasts continuously without breaking it in due time, is neither fast nor otherwise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever fears (God), travels (prays) the whole night and whoever travels the whole night, reaches his destination.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever fears God dulls his tongue and hides his wrath.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever fears God is kept intact against everything.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever feeds a fast person, will be granted the same reward as his.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever feeds a starving Muslim, will be fed by God with heavenly fruits.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever feels self- conceit and walks arrogantly will meet the Exalted God's anger.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever follows a people belongs (actually) to them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever follows his greed, should decelerate his speed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever follows moderateness will not suffer poverty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever follows the manners of those other than us does not belong to us.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever forcibly occupies one inch of soil, will be forced by God in the Day of Judgement to dig the soil down to the seventh Earth and wear it as a necklace to the end of His judgment among people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever forgives in power, will be forgiven by God in the day of hardship (Day of Judgment).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever gets accustomed to gluttony, will come up with hard- heartedness.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever gets married has half of his faith completed; as to the other half, he should seek piety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever gives a grace period to his debtor or dispenses with his debts, will reside under the shade of the (divine) Throne in the Day Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever gives a sick man his favorite food, will be offered heavenly fruits by God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever gives enough time to a poor to repay his debts, will be given enough time by God to repent his sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever gives his condolences to an afflicted person, will receive the same reward as him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever gives the poor a good dead line (to pay back debts), thus reducing his burdens, will be allowed by God to reside under the shade of His Throne the day when there is no shade but that of Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever goes hunting will hunt something.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever goes somewhere to have food not called to, stealingly enters and blamefully leaves there.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever goes to extremes in usury will end up in poverty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever happens to witness a sin which he detests, will be regarded as absent, and whoever is pleased with a sin committed in his absence, will be regarded as a witness to it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has a blessing is subject to jealousy, save humble people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has a debt and intends to repay it, will always be supported by an angel on God's side.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has an excessive greed for people's property, will touch fire, being it a bit or a lot he takes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has been given sixty years of age by God, has actually been given enough life (to do good).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has been granted a good face, good- naturedness, a pious wife and generosity, has (in fact) been granted the blessings of both worlds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has been granted something, should endeavor to preserve it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has been granted virtue, has (actually) been given the blessings of both worlds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has been married to a chaste wife by God, has (actually) been helped by Him in half of his faith; as to the other half, he should seek piety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has faith in God and the Last Day should be kind to his neighbors and hospitable to his guests, and should either say something good or keep silent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has faith in God and the Last Day, does not frighten a Muslim.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has health of body, safety within his community, and sustenance- earning ability, is like unto the one who possesses the world in its entirety
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever hesitates (in doing something), goes or will go the right path and whoever hastens, goes or will go the wrong path.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has no mercy (for others) will not enjoy (God's) mercy, and whoever does not forgive (people) will not be forgiven (by God).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has no pity for people, will not receive God's Mercy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has no pity for those on the earth, will not receive the Mercy of the One in the heavens.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has the following three, owns what was granted to David: being just in anger, being satisfied and moderate in poverty and affluence (respectively), and fearing the Exalted God in public and privacy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has to swear, should not swear save by God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever has two tongues in this world (i.e. being double- faced), will be given two tongues of fire in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever helps a blind person to move forty steps, will be absolved of his past sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever helps one's brother in his absence, will be helped by God here and in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever hoards up Muslims' food, will be made to suffer leprosy by God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever honors a heretic, has (in fact) helped the destruction of Islam.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever honors a Muslim, has verily honored the Exalted God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever hopes to carry out something through disobeying God, will come up with despair, and will achieve what he fears sooner than expected.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever hurts Muslims in their affairs, has to suffer their curse.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever intends to commit a sin but abandons it, will be rewarded a good deed.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever intends to return his debt but dies before doing so, will have his debt paid by God in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever intercedes to prevent divine punishment being carried out, will be subject to God's wrath until he stops doing so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever introduces something heretical to this (Islamic) nation, will not die before being afflicted with it in this very world.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is able to assist a believer being humiliated in his sight, but avoids doing so, will be humiliated by God in the sight of all people in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is able to defend his Muslim brother being backbitten in his presence but avoids doing so, will be made abject by the Exalted God, here and in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is afflicted with a physical or material calamity but hides it and avoids stating his grievance to people, will be definitely blessed by God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is appointed as a judge, is like unto the one beheaded without a knife.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is bereft of any of the following three features is meaner than a dog: piety to stop indulging in heavenly- unlawful acts, forbearance to ward off people's ignorance, and good- temperedness by which to deal with people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is born into a respectful family and is pure in birth, has a desirable company.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is called to account, will (actually) touch his punishment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is degraded by his own deeds, will not be upgraded by his parental lineage.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is devoid of moderation is bereft of all good.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is devoid of the following three, imperfect his deeds will be: piety to keep him away from disobeying the Lord, good- mannered ness through which with people to accord, and forbearance by which to repel fools' ignorance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is double- faced in this world, will be harnessed with two tongues (flames) of fire in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is easy- going, gentle and kind, will not be put to hell (fire) by God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is endowed with a bit of moderateness, is actually endowed with the good of both worlds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is granted a (heavenly) gift, should thank God for it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is granted God's grace, should reveal the sign of it on his face.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is hard on his family despite God's facilities for him, does not belong to us.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is helped by God to keep away from the evils of his tongue and privy parts will be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is kind to others, will see nothing but praise for which he should thank (God); if not, he will be considered ungrateful.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is merciless towards his subjects, will not receive God's permission to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is not pleased with divine decree and does not believe in his (predestined) destiny, should search for a god other than the (Unique) Deity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is not respectful to the elderly, is not Merciful to the younger ones, does not bid to good and does not forbid evil, does not belong to us.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is pleased that God is his Lord, Islam is his religion and Muhammad is the messenger (of God), and gives expression to these three, will be allowed to Paradise. The fourth to the above three is struggling in the way of the Great, Powerful God, which is as important as the heavens and the earth.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is pleased with his good deeds and is worried about his evil deeds is a (true) believer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is raised to the leadership (of people) and treats them moderately, will be treated in like manner by the Exalted God in the Day of Judgement.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is seized by pain, uneasy will remain.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is slain in defending his faith, is a martyr.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is slain in defense of his possessions is a martyr.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is treated kindly, should make up for it or remember and mention it, if not able to do so, for in the latter case he has actually shown his gratitude.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is tried with having a number of daughters he treats kindly, will be a shielded by them from the fire of Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is ungrateful to the small (gifts of God), is surely the same to the great (abundance of Him).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever is worried about his sins, will be forgiven (by God), though he does not request it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever joins a tribe as a guest, should avoid arbitrary fasting without their permission.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever keeps aloof from the society, will die as in the Age of Ignorance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever keeps his temper while being able to reveal it, will be overflowed with faith and security.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever kisses his mother's forehead, will be immune from the fire (of Hell).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever knowingly buys a stolen object is actually a partner in the theft and shame of it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever knows his limits will not perish.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever leads one person to Islam, will be allowed to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever leads others to good, will be rewarded as good- doers.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever leads people to a right direction, will be rewarded as those who follow it, without any reduction in the latter's reward, and whoever shows people a wrong direction, will be punished as those who follow it, without any reduction in the latter's punishment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever learns shooting but does not put it to practice, is guilty of ingratitude.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever lies about me in purpose, will have an abode of fire in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever longs for eternal magnanimity, should forsake the world's (passing) beauty.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever longs for Paradise should haste towards the good, whoever is afraid of Hell should abandon passions, whoever is worried about death should connive at pleasures, and whoever does not attach (his heart) to this would, will face calamities with ease.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever loses hope in what he has lost will reach comfort, and whoever is pleased with his destined share will feel relief.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever loses three children in death, will not be put to the fire of Hell by God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever loves and hates, grants and avoids granting (something to people) for the sake of God, stands at the peak of faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever loves something, remembers it a lot.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever loves the world damages the Hereafter, and whoever loves the Hereafter damages the world. So, prefer the immortal to the mortal.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever lowers himself in obedience to God, is more honorable than the one who has earned dignity through disobedience to Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever marries a woman with the intention not to pay her marriage portion, will die as an adulterer, and whoever buys something intending not to pay its cost, will die as a traitor, and traitors will dwell in Fire.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever mentions a defect which is not to be found in someone, will be kept in Hell so long as to prove his saying.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever mentions the name of a man for the trait he possesses, is actually backbiting him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever observes an undesirable action in you should stop it with his hand; if not possible, with his tongue, and if still not possible, he should detest it in his heart, for it is the very least form of faith.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever observes the following three, is away from misery: giving alms, inviting guests, and being generous at hard times.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever pays a visit to a patient plunges himself into the Mercy of God, and if he sits beside him, Mercy will surround him. A perfect visit to a patient is achieved when one of you puts his hand on his face or hand and asks him how he feels. The perfect way of greeting for you is to shake hands with each other.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever performs an action, should do it well.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever performs the following three, a wrongdoer will turn out to be: hoisting the banner of falsehood, subjecting oneself to his (her) parents' curse, and accompanying a tyrant with the intention to assist him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever plants a good deed will profit by it, and whoever plants an evil deed will reap it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever plants a good deed will profit by it, and whoever plants an evil deed will reap remorse.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever plants something on which a bird feeds itself, earns an act of charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever plays a trick on us does not belong to us. Verily, cheating and deceiving lead man to Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever plays backgammon is like unto the one who has dipped his hands into a pig's meat and blood.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever pleases his parents, pleases God, and whoever displeases them, displeases Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever possesses four things, will enjoy the good of both worlds: a tongue by which to remember God, a heart by which to express gratitude to Him, a body to be tolerant enough against sufferings, and a wife not to be disloyal to one's wealth and chastity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever practices the following three, will taste the sweetness of faith: loving God and His prophet more than any other one, loving people just for the sake of God, and detesting blasphemy, after having been saved from it by God, just as one detests falling into fire.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever prays much at night, will in the day have a face bright (nice).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever prays well in the presence of people but does the reverse in privacy, is actually offending his Lord.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever prepares provision in this world, will make use of it in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever pronounces judgment without knowledge, is responsible for its subsequent sins, and whoever advises his brother (in faith) to do an action which he knows should not be done, is a traitor to him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever purifies (his intent) forty mornings for God's sake, will come up with fountains of wisdom flowing from his heart to his tongue.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever refrains from bearing witness when required is like unto the one who gives false testimony.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever regards tomorrow a day of his life, is not well aware of death.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever rejoices at the good or evil deeds of a people is like unto the doers of those deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever remains in the sulks with his brother (in faith) more than three days before death, will be put to Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever remains in unfriendly terms with his brother (in religion) for one whole year, is like unto the one who may happen to kill him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever resides in deserts gets crude.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever rules over ten people should be as wise as forty, and whoever rules over forty people should be as wise as four hundred.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever rules over ten people will be brought to the Day of Judgment in chains to be either freed for justice or demolished for tyranny.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever seeks a sort of knowledge and finds it, will be rewarded in double, and whoever seeks a sort of knowledge but fails to find it, will be rewarded in single.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever seeks knowledge to vie with the wise, to dispute with the unwise, or to attract laymen's attention, will be put to Hell by God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever seeks people's admiration through disobeying God, will end up with his admirers' reproaches.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever seeks safety should control his tongue, not expressing what occurs to his heart (mind), should do good and cut his dreams short.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever seeks something in earnest, will (finally) find it.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever seeks worldly gains through otherworldly deeds will be spared eternal benefits.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever sees indecencies (in people)but covers them up is like unto the one who saves a live- buried girl.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever sells a defective object without mentioning it, will always be detested by God and damned by His angels.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever sells a house without need, will see its money wasted by a waster appointed by God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever sells a kind of food should only do it with all proper conditions.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever sells his house and does not buy another with its money, will not end up in blessings.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever settles his Muslim brother's needs is like unto the one who has performed minor and major pilgrimages.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever settles his Muslim brother's needs is like unto the one who has served God all his life.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever shares not his food with the one who watches him eating, will be afflicted with a calamity with no remedy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever shelters a deviated person is deviated himself as long as he keeps it a secret.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever sits in judgment among Muslims, should be just to them as to looking at them, pointing to them and giving them a seat.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever sits in judgment among Muslims, should not shout at one party unless he shouts at the other.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever slanders people is mentally ill or has something wrong with him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever sleeps well- fed, knowing that his neighbor is hungry, does not (truly) believe in me.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever smiles when committing a sin, will weep when entering Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever spares his help from people, will not be spared from the fire of Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever spreads out an evil deed is like the doer of that deed, and whoever blames a believer for doing something, will not die unless he does the same.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever starts his day with obedience to God in his parents' affairs, will face two opened doors of Paradise; and one door, if he has only father or mother.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever starts his day with other than God in his mind, will not receive any attention from Him, and whoever starts his day with no attention to Muslims' affairs is not a Muslim.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever starts his day with piety in mind, but happens to commit a sin, will be forgiven by God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever supports his own or others' orphans as long as they are made needless of him by God, will be entitled to enter Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever supports oppression through hostility (to people), will always be detested by God unless he stops doing so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever swears an oath to do something but faces a better one to perform, should atone for his oath and do the latter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever swears by anything save God, is a dualist.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever takes an affair of Muslims upon himself but does not carry it out as carefully as the does his own, will not be allowed to enjoy the fragrance of Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever teaches his knowledge (to others), will receive the reward of the one who acts upon it, with the doer's reward not reduced.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever treats his subjects deceitfully, will assuredly dwell in Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever treats my people moderately, will be treated in like manner by God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever undertakes the leadership of my people after me, will in the Resurrection Day be made to stop on the Bridge, and the angels will read out his book of deeds. He will then be saved by God, if he has practiced justice, but if he has been unjust (to people), the Bridge will shake under him in such a way that his bodily organs will disintegrate, with a two- hundred year distance between any two organs, and he will finally fall down the Bridge (into Hell).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever unduly kills a sparrow, will be called to account by God in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever unjustly kills an animal, a bird and so on will be called to account by God in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever veils his brother ('s faults), will be veiled by God here and in the Hereafter.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever walks in a way in search of knowledge, will be led by God to a path to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever whips (someone) in tyranny will suffer revenge in the Day of Judgment.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever wishes dearth of one single night for my people, will be frustrated by God in his worship of forty years.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever wishes his prayers to be granted and his grief to vanish, should resolve the difficulty of an indigent person.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever wishes his prayers to be granted by God in hardship and grief, should pray a lot when at ease.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever wishes to be safe, should keep silent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever wishes to be safe, should keep silent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever wishes to be the most beloved of all people to God, should fear Him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever wishes to be the most needless of all people, should rely on what is with God more than what himself possesses.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever wishes to be the most powerful of all, should rely on God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever wishes to be the strongest among people, should rely on God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever wishes to do something and counsels with a Muslim about it, will be granted success by God in (carrying out) the most logical affairs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever wishes to have abundant sustenance and long life, should go on keeping the bonds of kinship.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever wishes to know what he has with God, should see what of God is with him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever wishes to reside at the heart of Heaven, should get along with people.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever wishes to taste the sugar of faith, should love people just for the Exalted God's sake.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whoever wishes to taste the sweetness of faith, should wish to love someone whom he loves only for God's sake.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Whomsoever you benefit, will benefit you, and whoever loses patience in worldly events will turn helpless, whoever slanders people will be slandered, and whoever leaves people on their own, will not be left unrequited.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Why do you kill your brothers (in faith)? When someone sees something pleasing in his brother, he should ask God's blessing for him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Willing someone to die in a certain place, God sets there a need for him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wine is the mother of all indecent deeds and great capital sins. Whoever drinks it, may happen to commit adultery with his mother and aunts.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wine is the mother of all wickedness. Thus, the prayers of the one who drinks wine will not be accepted for forty days, and if he dies with wine in his veins, his death will be that of the Age of Ignorance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wine makes the totality of all sins.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Winter is the spring of a believer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wisdom causes (and is the object of) intimacy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wisdom is a believer's lost one. Hearing it from anybody, he takes it in, regardless of its source.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wisdom is loss in matters secular, and joy in matters religious.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wisdom starts with knowing God.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wisdom starts with piety.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wise sayings are believers' lost ones- wherever they happen to find them, they would be more entitled (than others) to catch them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wise sayings are lost ones of the wise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wish for others what you wish for yourself.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wishing a ruler good, God appoints for him an honest minister to remind him of what he forgets and help him in what he remembers to do, and wishing him evil, God appoints for him a dishonest minister who does the reverse.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wishing evil for a people, God entrusts their affairs to the seekers of luxury among them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wishing good for a family, God grants them leniency and moderation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wishing good for a people, God makes their learned increase (in number) and their ignorant decrease to the extent that when a learned man talks, he is followed and supported by many and when an ignorant person talks, he fails to succeed, and when the reverse God wishes, the other way round will be the situation.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wishing good for a people, God trusts authority (government), judgment and wealth respectively to the forebearant, learned and generous among them, and wishing them evil, He trusts such things to the stupid, ignorant and miserly among them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wishing good for someone, God appoints a preacher within him to bid him to good and forbid him from evil.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wishing good for someone, God assigns him a job. How ? the people asked. The Holy Prophet retorted: He causes him to engage in a good deed before his death, thereby pleasing those around him.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wishing good for someone, God offers him leniency and moderation in life, and wishing him evil, He inflicts him with ignorance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wishing good for someone, God purifies him before his death. How ?, the people asked. The Holy Prophet retorted: He inspires him to engage in doing a good deed and takes his soul meanwhile.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wishing good for someone, God rebukes him in his dreams.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wishing good for someone, God sweetens him. How ?, the people asked. The Holy Prophet retorted: He gives him the opportunity to do something good before death and takes his soul meanwhile.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wishing ruin for someone, God deprives him of all solutions.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wishing the destruction (or annihilation) of a people, God lets adultery prevail among them.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wishing to create something, nothing can stop Him doing so.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Wishing to put His decrees to practice, the Exalted God makes the learned's wisdom vanish (for a while) and subjects them to His will, and when this is accomplished, He gives their intellects back to them and regretful they turn.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: With great people keep company, to the learned make (your) enquiry, and converse with men of philosophy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: With self- respect secure your needs, for pre- destined are all affairs and deeds.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Witnessing his enemies in disobedience of God suffices to make of man a sinner.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Woe is my people for bad scholars!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Woe is the learned for the ignorant and woe is the ignorant for the learned.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Woe is the one who deprives his family from good and approaches God with evil!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Woe is the one who doesn't know (the truth of something), and woe is the one who knows it but doesn't act upon it!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Woe is the one who lies to make people laugh! Woe is he! Woe is he!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Woe is the one who violates a Muslim and tramples his rights.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Woe is the rich for the poor!
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Woe is women for two colored things: gold and colored garments.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Women are (usually) taken in marriage for their four possessions: wealth, chastity, beauty and faith. But, you marry a woman for her faith to receive God's Mercy.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Women are more entitled than their guardians to decide about their own marital affairs, but girls' consent in such issues should be asked for by their fathers, and silence is their consent.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Women are Satan's hardest weapons.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Women are Satan's traps.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Women make the largest population of Hell.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Women who do housework will receive the reward of the strugglers in the way of God, if He so wishes.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Words of extensive meanings were bestowed on me, and brief my discourse turned out to be.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Work in such a way as if you would never pass away, and fear so as if you would die tomorrow.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Work, for everybody earns what he has been created for.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Worldly affairs bring nothing but hardship, the world causes nothing but adversity, and people are on the way to unceasing avarice.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Worldly joys entail otherworldly grief, and worldly grief entails otherworldly joys.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Worship God as much as your ability permits you, for God does not get tired of you as long as you do not get tired (of worshiping Him).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Worship God in such a way as if He were in your view, for if not so, surely He sees (me and) you.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Worship God to the extent of your ability, for God will not get tired (of you) till you get tired (of worshipping Him).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Worshipping God suffices (to show) man's deep knowledge and vaunting personal views, (to show) his ignorance.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Would you like to have a compassionate heart and to achieve your goals? Be Merciful to orphans, treat them with tender care and your food, let them share.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: You and whatever you own belong to your father.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: You are a (true) believer, if you feel happy with your good deeds and feel sad with your bad ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: You are ruled as you deserve.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: You can only swear about something the truth of which is confirmed by your friend (Lord).
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: You have no benefit of your wealth, save what you eat and exhaust, what you wear and wear away and what you give in charity.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: You will (surely) follow your ancestors' path step by step to the point that if one of them used to creep into a crocodile's hole or mate with his wife in the way, you would do likewise
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: You will be a good man, if your neighbors admire you for doing good; and a bad one, if they regard you as a wrong- doer.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: You will experience leaders who will confiscate your sustenance, talk to you untruly, commit evil deeds, and get not satisfied with you unless you would consider their bad as good and their lies as truth. Should such leaders happen to conform to truth, treat them according, and should they trespass upon the limits of truth, (stand against them), for whoever is killed in so doing, will be a martyr.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: You will not be helped but for the prayers and patience of your poor ones.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: You will ruin a man in case you admire him to his face.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Your (excessive) love towards something blinds your eyes and deafens your ears.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Your faith is the best when (from you) people feel at rest, and (your) Islam the most perfect stands when people feel safe from your tongues and hands.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Your fate has been predestined.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Your God loves the youth who do not follow their carnal desires.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Your Great and Powerful Lord will not grant the requests of three persons: a man who chooses a ruined place for living, a man who resides along the roads, and a man who leaves his animal untied and asks God to keep it safe.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Your house is your sanctuary. Kill the one who trespasses upon its limits.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Your kids are leeches of Paradise. When one of them sees his father, sticks to his clothes and leaves it not till God takes his father with him to Paradise.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Your most dangerous enemy is your (evil) soul within thee.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Your slaves are your brothers (in faith). Be kind to them, ask them to help you in your hard labors, and help them in their intolerable affairs.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Your subordinates are you brethren, subjected to you by God. Thus, whoever has his brethren as his subjects, should share them in his own food, dress them with his own dresses, oblige them not to jobs beyond their tolerance and help them in performing exhaustible tasks.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Youth is of madness a part, and women are Satan's traps.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)

quotes.quote: Youth is of madness a part.
quotes.author: Holy Prophet (s.a.w.s.)
